loans.name: Marly

texts.en:
"My husband and I have been farming since the start of our marriage. We have been tilling the land for 12 years already. We use the 2 and 3/4 hectare farm to buy the things that we need," says Marly L., 39-year old mother of four children.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals. In doing so, she thinks that her loan will help increase their harvest. 

CEVI provides financial services to the poor. CEVI gives not just loans but trainings and insurance as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals for farming.

loans.name: Ever Jose

texts.es: El señor Ever José M., trabaja en un restaurante como jefe de mesero, desde hace ocho años labora, abecés difícil por que sale muy noche de trabajar y se le hace cansado, pero con buenas propinas que dejan los clientes, tiene 41 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 10 y 12 años de edad, que estudian la primaria. Con este crédito va invertir en materiales de construcción para hacer una pared de concreto de la casa para tener seguridad para su familia. Sus objetivos es lograr poner su propio negocio para poder estar mejor económicamente y poder terminar de hacer su casa, como poder dar estudios a sus hijas para que sean profesionales. Da las gracias Afodenic por los préstamos otorgados ya que a través de ellos ha mejorado su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ever José M. has worked as the head waiter of a restaurant for eight years. It is sometimes difficult because he leaves late at night for work and it makes him tired, but the customers leave him good tips.
He is 41 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighbourhood in the capital, Managua. He and his wife have two children aged 10 and 12 who are in primary school. With this loan he will purchase building materials to build a concrete wall around his house for his family’s security.
His goals are to set up his own business to improve his economic situation, to complete construction on his house and to educate his daughters so that they have careers. He thanks Afodenic for the loans he has received because through them he has improved his life and that of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials for a concrete wall

loans.name: Ankatoallama 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  dix femmes du groupe Ankatoallama 1 sont toutes mariées et  résident à Soromana, un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba, dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali.  Elles ont  une moyenne d’age de 32 ans,  4 enfants et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Elles  ont fait plusieurs cycles en prêt solidaire ( prêt de groupe) et tous ces prêts ont été bien remboursés. Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne (prêt agricole),qui correspond avec leur activité primaire, étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne et les trois précédents ont été biens remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semence, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles exploitent 18  hectares d’arachide avec  une production moyenne estimée à 3 tonnes l’hectare soit 54 tonnes.
Toute la récolte sera vendue, après qu’elle est eu de la valeur, à une clientèle riche et variée, au comptant surtout.
Le bénéfice généré de  la vente sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du  prêt, la prise en charge de certaines dépenses familiales (les frais scolaire, de santé) et acheter les trousseaux de mariages des filles.
texts.en:
The ten women in the Anakatoallama 1 loan group are all married and reside in Saromana, a village in the sub-prefecture of Fakola, prefecture of Kolondieba, in the third region (Sikasso), Republic of Mali. They are, on average, 32 years of age, with 4 children and live within polygamist families. They know each other through family and neighborhood ties. They have made numerous group loans and all of these loans have been repaid. Their primary activity of these country women is farming and they have seized the opportunity by borrowing and now repaying their fourth farm loan. Their three previous loans were all successfully repaid. They plan to use this new loan to pay for labour costs, weeding, seed, fertilizer and herbicide. They manage 18 hectare of peanut plants, with a harvest averaging 3 tonnes (metric tons) per hectare, totaling 54 tonnes. The entire crop will be sold, after its value is established, to a varied and wealthy clientele for cash. The profit generated from the sale will be used to meet the loan payments, manage certain household expenses (school and health costs) and buy wedding trousseau(s) for their daughters.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for labour costs, seed, fertilizer, herbicide and weeding costs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and a mother with four children. She is a 38-year-old petty trader and her husband is also a petty trader. All her children are in school. She sells lace materials, textiles and clothing materials. She takes her stock of goods from importers in Kumasi central market. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. For lack of adequate working capital, she buys only a little lace materials and sells through hawking. She sells during the markets days in the surrounding market communities.

She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk quantities of lace materials and textiles. She hopes to use part of her profit to rent a store and also save the larger part for the children's education.

loans.use: To purchase bulk quantities of lace materials, clothing materials and textiles

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina has been operating a general store in the village of Binarzang, Quirino, Isabela for more than a year. She is 33 years old and married to Gilbert, age 34, who is a farmer in their village. Regina dreams of a good future of her three children. She plans to expand her business, and to make it a reality, she is now asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders. She believes that this amount will lead to a progressive life and she can continue to send her three children to school. At present, they are all in the elementary level.  She hopes that she will be given the chance to achieve her dreams for her family.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia tiene su frial (tienda de comestibles)en el mercado de alto San Antonio, vende pollo, panza, salchichas y carne de cerdo, además de abarrotes y conservas. Ella es de los Yunas de La Paz, y tiene también su frial en Coripata que está ubicado en Nor Yungas, al norte del departamento de La Paz, con su hija se turnan  en la atencion. Su esposo tiene su ferretería en su casa, donde vende material de construcción, ambos son conocidos en la zona y les va bien en sus negocios. Doña Julia invertirá en la compra de abarrotes para los dos friales, son clientes que trabajaron hace un año con nuestra institución descansaron un tiempo y ahora retornan para seguir trabajando con nosotros.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia has a food store at the Upper San Antonio Market, where she sells chicken, tripe, sausage, and pork, as well as groceries and canned goods. She is from Yunas de La Paz and also has a store in Coripata, which is located in Nor Yungas, north of the district of La Paz. She takes turns with her daughter in managing both locations. Her husband operates a hardware store out of their home, where he sells construction materials. Both of them are well-known in the neighborhood and have done well in their businesses.

Doña Julia will purchase groceries for her two stores. She and her husband have worked with our Institution for one year. They have been inactive for awhile, but they have now returned to continue working with us.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries (oil, rice, flour, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Go Ahead Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the Go Ahead group. Members of the Go Ahead group are small scale businesspeople in the town of Magburaka in the Tonkolili district. They are seeking a loan from SMT/Kiva for the first time. Each is requesting a loan of Le 500,000 to improve his or her business and consequently improving his or her standard of living.

Mohamed T. (on the left) is the leader of this group. Mohamed was born in Magburaka town about thirty-two years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children and one foster child together. One of his children is currently in class six, one in class four, and the others are still not of school age. Mohamed sells medicines. He hawks the medicines in and around Magburaka town. He has been in this business for over seven years now. With this loan, he will be able to add more drugs into his business.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of a taxi-motorocycle

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a 30-year-old borrower from San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. This is Roberto’s very first loan with Esperanza International, and he is very excited to get started. Roberto lives in one of the poorest neighborhoods of San Pedro with his wife and son. Their home lacks water and electricity, but that has not stopped Roberto from finding a place to use his skills.

Roberto is an experienced tailor of men’s clothing. He specializes in the manufacture of underwear, but also offers his services for other types of clothing. He will use this loan to purchase fabric and sewing supplies, and to rent the space that he uses to work. He hopes that with more access to capital, he will now be able to expand his line of products and reach a greater amount of people.

Roberto dreams to one day own his own business where he can make his own hours and hire employees to help in his shop. He would like to have a full men’s clothing store, offering everything from head to toe. With his extra profits, Roberto also hopes to secure a good education for his son, ensuring that he can grow up and work hard to become a professional just like his dad. Thank you for your loan to Roberto and his tailoring business!

loans.use: To buy supplies for the production of clothing

loans.name: Patricia Albertina

texts.en:
For 5 years, Patricia has operated a pharmacy in her home. She is widely known for having fairly-priced items and customers favor her store amongst the other pharmacies for this reason. Her home and business are located in the central part of the city near the banks, so she is assured of good foot traffic.

With this loan of 20,000 gold cordobas (NIO), Patricia will purchase a variety of medicines to restock her inventory.

Patricia’s husband works as an engineer in an agricultural factory. Together, they continue to follow their ambition of improving their economic situation.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of medicines to restock her inventory

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel L. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 57 years old. Joel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Joel owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. Joel has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $335 a month from these activities.

In 2004, Joel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Joel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from GDMPC. Joel is requesting a new loan of 19,036 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This will be his 6th loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Digna Noe

texts.es: La Sra. Digna Noe R. R. de 27 años de edad. Es madre soltera con un  hijo en edad escolar. Vive en casa de un familiar ubicada en el Caserío de Sacta Distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como obrera de campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 2 años de experiencia, es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que ha salido adelante. Requiere el crédito para construir su vivienda en esteras en un terreno que han cedido sus familiares. Su sueño es lograr construir su vivienda de material noble con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Digna Noe R. R. is 27 years old. She is a single mother with a young, elementary-school aged son. She lives in a relative's house located in the Caserío de Sacta district of Santiago. She has been working as a rural laborer in an agro-industrial company for two years. She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial person, who has been able to prosper financially. She needs this loan to build her house in a parcel of marshland that her family has given her. Her dream is to be able to construct her home out of “material noble” (cement and brick) with the goal of being able to achieve a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support that we have offered her through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House improvements

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is a 28-year-old married mother of one child who is in school. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Vida works hard to be able to provide for the son. She is a seamstress by profession and a baker as well. She bakes bread and supplies to retailers. She buys bags of flour from nearby towns. Vida has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Kisakye Development Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
M. Margaret is the leader of her lending group. She is 46 years old and married with seven children aged 24, 22, 20, 18, 15, 14, & 12. Margaret has been a farmer for seven years as well as handling rental properties for two years in Kasenge. She is able to make about $210 in profits per month.

She says that she has been successful because of her fair prices and having quality products for her customers. She has both crops and animals on her farm, and her dream is to have more animals for farm expansion. She would also like to educate her children to the highest level.

Margaret needs a loan to be able to diversify her farming activities and rear more animals by buying more seedlings and cows, goats and pigs for expansion. She is a very determined lady.

(The credit officer had divided the group into two sub-groups, yet their loan is below the Kiva limit and he conducted only one interview, hence the sub-groups are merged.)

loans.use: to buy more seedlings and animals for business expansion.

loans.name: Mouskéba

texts.fr: Mouskéba D. est une femme de 54 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de GADAPARA depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle a construit un four traditionnel où elle grille du pain vendu dans son quartier. Elle est très expérimentée en la matière pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plus d'une décennie. Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge familiale et de renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Mouskéba D. is a 54-year-old woman; she is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villegeois” of GADAPARA for two and a half years. She has built a traditional oven where she cooks bread sold in her neighborhood. She is very experienced with this work, having done it for more than a decade. Her goal is to participate in supporting her family and to build up her savings.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her investment capital

loans.name: Bear Bozzu Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Bear Bozzu II Group. They are small-scale businesswomen in the township of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied to SMT/Kiva Lenders for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Aminata S.. The 40-year-old Aminata was born in Magburaka town. Aminata is married to a businessman and they have four children. Aminata has been a businesswoman for 15 years now. She sells locally produced items like rice, palm oil, fish, cassavas, potatoes and any other goods she can lay her hands on. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying rice, palm oil, fish, cassavas, potatoes etc.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, fish, cassavas, potatoes etc

loans.name: Rath

texts.en:
Rath P., 58, is a widowed farmer who lives with her three daughters. (She is pictured with one of her daughters.) Living in the Takeo province, she typically makes about US$1 each day and two of her daughters together make about US$6 each day as garment factory workers at Phnom Penh city.

Rath P. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her daughters to commute to work. This will allow her daughters to save even more.

In the future, Rath P. wants her daughters to create their own business instead of working as garment factory workers at Phnom Penh. She says that her daughters need to spend alot on food and accommodation. If her family has enough money, she will suggest that her daughters sell vegetables and fruit at the local market of Takeo province, so that her family will live happily and closely.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Firas

texts.en: Firas is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents and 3 siblings. He has studied computers in an academy in his town and he has working at the same time in this occupation to gain experience. And since 2 months ago, he opened a computer shop where he sells computers, and laptops accessories in addition to repair service. He opened his shop with a limited work operation due to his savings and today, he wants to make his business operation bigger, that's why he is asking for a loan of $500 to buy additional merchandise needed to expand his business.

loans.use: buy additional merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase products for her hamburger stand

loans.name: Iccel Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Iccel Amanda M. S., tiene 31 años de edad es originaria de Santa Lucia, Boaco, es casada y juntos tienen un niño pequeño, ellos tienen una pulpería y es su esposo quien la administra, ellos habitan en el Barrio Laureles Sur, un populoso Barrio de la capital que según los Records Policiales, obtiene una alta calificación de inseguridad social.

El capital circulante de la familia, ha mostrado bajas en los últimos meses, las ventas del negocio no han dado los mejores resultados que esperaban, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo para la reinversión en su negocio, en la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería y de esta manera, elevar el volumen en las ventas, este préstamo a futuro le favorecerá a la familia M.,  el capital necesario para realizar mejoras al hogar que contribuyan a la seguridad personal y la de su familia, debido al ambiente en el que se habita actualmente en su comunidad. En otras ocasiones han tenido prestamos gracias al apoyo de los fondos Kiva, fue gracias a su esfuerzo personal y a los créditos, que ha logrado mejorar día a día sus condiciones económicas-sociales así también las de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Iccel Amanda M. S., 31, is a native of Santa Lucia, Boaco. She and her husband have one young son. They own a small general store that is managed by her husband. They live in the Laureles Sur neighborhood, a heavily populated neighborhood of Managua that police records show to be one of the city's most crime-ridden. The business hasn't generated much income over the last few month because sales have been lower than expected. Iccel is applying for a loan so that she can refinance the business. She expects to buy better merchandise and, in turn, increase the store's sales volumes. This loan will greatly help the M. family in the future by helping them to generate the income they need to make improvements to their house, improvements that will contribute to making them safer in a neighborhood that is not very safe. They have received other loans from Kiva in the past. Thanks to their own efforts and past loans, they have been able to improve the lives of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Bun Noeun

texts.en: Mr. Bun Noeun H. is a 28-year-old married man who lives in Khsom Village, Kandal Province. He and his wife, Mrs. San Chum, are farmers who own a two-hectare field on which they cultivate rice for a living. In order to support his farming activities, Mr. Bun Noeun H. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work. His wife is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestra socia vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es ella  Sra. Virginia,  ella socia tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Nuestra socia  comparte sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, la socia se dedica a la fabricación de telares con lana de alpaca, oveja, lanas sintéticas, realizan mantas, frazadas, cuadros, correas, medias, monteras, chullos y otros artículos de vestir y adornos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar lanas. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Virginia belongs to the Pacha Illariy communal bank; she lives in the Llullucha community, district of Ocongate, Quispicanchis province, Cusco. She is 26 years old, lives with her partner and has two children. She is responsible for household activities and also does handicrafts— she makes textiles with alpaca, sheep, and synthetic wools. Her products include cloaks, blankets, wall hangings, belts, stockings, caps, chullos (Peruvian-style hats with ear flaps) and other clothing and accessories. Virginia is requesting this loan to buy wool. She values this available support and is grateful for it. She promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 4 Group

texts.en:
Johanny is the coordinator of her group Mujeres en Accion (Women in Action), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, an area where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple, wooden structure with her longterm partner and their three children.

Johanny is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a fantasia (fantasy), a small variety shop aimed at women, by purchasing six pairs of pants, skirts, blouses and shoes to sell.

Johanny will use the profits to invest in her home, by replacing wooden walls with concrete block, an important improvement in the termite-infested and hurricane-prone Dominican Republic. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, women's shoes and skirts to sell

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro, de 43 años, vive en su casa que es propia, en compañía de su esposa y sus dos hijos.Desde hace 6 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, de una reconocida marca a nivel mundial. Para comercializar sus productos, al por mayor, viaja a diferentes provincias y abastece a sus clientes fijos. Es por esta razón, que se  encuentra feliz con su trabajo, aunque sea poco usual que un varón se dedique a la venta de estos productos, pues es un rubro femenino,  pero él  no se hace problemas, pues gracias a este trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, y le gusta porque además es un trabajo tranquilo. En el futuro quiere seguir mejorando su negocio, para lograr mayores ventas, ya que anhela convertirse en un gran empresario. Actualmente se encuentra construyendo su casa, pues piensa que esto le ayudará para que en el futuro instale  un negocio en su casa.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y siempre se ha caracterizado  por ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.Isidro tiene planeado invertir el  dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de  mercadería en productos de belleza,  al por mayor, para viajar y distribuir estos productos pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes. De esta manera espera seguir trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Isidro is 43 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife and 2 children. For the past 6 years, he has been selling beauty products from a well-known international brand. To sell his products wholesale, he travels to visit established clients in different provinces. For this reason, he is very happy in his work, although it is not typical for a man to be involved in the sale of such products. This does not seem to cause him any difficulties and it is thanks to this job that he is able to provide for the costs of his home. In the future, he would like to continue improving his business and sales, since he hopes to become a successful businessman. At present, he is building his own home, in which he hopes one day to establish his business. This is the second loan he has requested from MFP. He has always been responsible in making his payments on time. Isidro is planning to invest the money he has requested in purchasing a large amount of beauty products wholesale. He will then travel and distribute these products, since he already has various pending orders. In this way, he hopes to continue working in search of progress.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large amount of beauty products for his business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer G. is a 29-year-old married woman who supports her family by owning and operating a general store and by selling rice. She lives in West Proper Talaban Zone 1, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their two children who are 3 and 7 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and rice retailing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Jennifer is now borrowing PHP 13,000 so that she can expand her general store and rice retailing business. This will be her 11th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Jennifer aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Van K., 30, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for being the favorite tourist place in the country.

K. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and earns an income of USD 6 per day. K.’s husband appears in the photograph because K. was not available.

K. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a tuk-tuk (a motorcycle-based taxi) for her husband to expand his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a tuk-tuk for her husband's business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
To support her family, Cristina C. engages in a business venture in the retail sector operating a general store. She offers a variety of products in their community including rice. Cristina has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 2500 Philllipine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. With this she was able to help her husband to support the educational needs of their child who is attending school. The family happily lives at the village of Allinguigan 3rd. At the age of 27, Cristina says that she has a lot of dreams for her family.

In 2008, Cristina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Cristina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar is married to A. M. and lives in a city called Lahore which is the second largest city of Pakistan. She owns a three room house and lives with her family in the area called Yadgar. Yadgar is famous for its bus stands. Every bus is easily available at this location. 

She is a very caring wife and a mother as well. She has four children: two sons and two daughters. Her daughters are married and her sons are settled in their own businesses. Her elder son is involved in a dairy business. The younger son runs a grocery shop. 

Naseem feels herself a blissful lady who has a very nice family and disciplined kids who give respect to their elders and obey them. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her elder son. With the loan amount he will buy another dairy-cow and increase his dairy business. 

Presently, he has a single cow which produces 6-8kg of milk for him which has now become insufficient and is affecting his earnings. He thinks that by buying another cow the milk productivity will definitely increase and he will also increase his sales.  Naseem is an optimistic lady and has a strong belief that her son will surely achieve his plan and will become more successful in his business.

loans.use: purchasing a dairy cow

loans.name: Miraji

texts.en:
Miraji is married to a businessman and has six children who all attend school. She lives at a rented house with electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Miraji’s business is selling clothes, handbags and shoes. She has been operating for the last two years, selling in a shop and also by selling door-to-door to her neighbors and to passersby. Her major challenge in her business is seasonality.

Miraji decided to join Yehu so as to get financial assistance. With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase more stock of shoes, clothes and handbags. She hopes to open a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of shoes, clothes and handbags

loans.name: Dustmurod

texts.en:
O. Dustmurod is 50 years old, married and has six children. He has secondary school education and has an animal husbandry business. He has a small cow shed where he breeds calves. Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. 

Dustmurod buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells them at the same market at a more profitable price. He provides the market with meat and his family with the necessary food. Dustmurod wants to buy more cows and needs money so he decided to apply for a loan. He will be very grateful to all those who can support him.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine A. was born in1975, she is single and she has two children. She lives at Ntamulung Junction a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Justine, as any other entrepreneur, has faced significant challenges in life. She has suffered terribly in the hands of ill health; poverty has been her major difficulty in life, and the inability to raise capital for business projects. She plans to invest this loan in her marketing business in which she plans to buy and sell clothes and assorted dresses for resale. She believes the business will succeed because she has been in the business for a long time. She also thinks her approach to her customers will be welcoming and hence lead to the success of her business. She has also put in place factors that will ensure the success of her business like getting her business advertised at cheaper rates. With this loan she will be able to support her community firmly in improving their standard of living and social interaction, not forgetting decent appearance. The inhabitants of her locality will also benefit from low transportation costs which would have been incurred in distant places.

Justine will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to expand her business and save for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE:
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Safooran's Group

texts.en:
Safooran lives in Khanewal, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agricultural industry. She is 48 years old and has three sons and two daughters. She couldn’t provide an education to her children due to the poor financial conditions of her family. 

Her eldest son has a barber shop and the next to him is a welder by profession and welds different machines on order. Her husband, F. S., is a laborer by profession. He is a very hard worker and his work involves a lot of physical energy. He is still very active at the age of 55. 

Safooran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s barber shop. With the loan, her son will buy scissors and hair-related products such as creams, gels and colors to provide better services to the clients. He has been doing this business for the past four years and Safooran is hopeful that this investment will prove successful for his business.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous years, she has proved herself as a very responsible client who paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady who is holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Safooran.

loans.use: To buy hair-related products and scissors for a barber shop

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa A. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old. Nimfa is married and has two children. To make a living, Nimfa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, detergent, biscuits, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nimfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nimfa is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Nimfa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
Cherry Ann A. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 23 years old. Cherry Ann is widowed and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Cherry Ann owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising and selling pigs. Cherry Ann has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cherry Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cherry Ann is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cherry Ann from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ericka Delfina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ericka Delfina; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de panadería y también tiene un locutorio donde realiza llamadas a cualquier lugar del país y la panadería atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de panadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar harina, manteca e ingredientes para preparar el pan.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ericka Delfina belongs to the “El Amanecer” (The Dawn) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Ericka is 26 years old and lives with her partner.  She has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her bakery business.  She also has an establishment which contains telephone booths for public use from which customers can make calls to any part of the country.  She serves in her bakery from 6.00am to 6.00pm.  She would like to improve her bakery business.  She is requesting this loan to buy flour, butter and ingredients for baking bread.

She is grateful to those who will take part in her dream by funding her loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy flour, butter and ingredients for baking bread

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya B. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a traditional Mongolian housing dwelling called a ger in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Both of her children attend the university and her husband supports her business. 

Enhtuya operates a dairy retail business at the local market. She began the business in 2006 with working capital of 300,000 MNT. Since then, her business has become successful and her working capital now exceeds 1,000,000 MNT. In the years of running her business, she has gained a reputation among her customers as a reliable supplier of quality dairy products. Enhtuya is a very honest person and says, "My only concern is to provide good quality dairy products to my customers." 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more dairy products to sell in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Omurjan

texts.en:
Omurjan B. lives in Kozhomkul, a village in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan.  He is married and has two children.  Omurjan was born into a family of farmers and helped his parents with farming and cattle breeding, which helped him gain useful experience.  After serving in the army, Omurjan worked as a tractor driver at the state farm.   

In 1995, Omurjan decided to start his own cattle breeding business in order to earn a living to support his family.  Omurjan bought one bull-calf with the money that he had put aside for a rainy day.  Due to his persistent and hardworking personality, Omurjan managed to multiply his investments and bought a used car.  Today, his farm has two milk cows and he sells their milk at the local market.  He also has three horses and forty sheep. 

Omurjan is applying for a loan of 120,000 KGS to buy two milk cows and three bull-calves.  With the revenue, he plans to broaden his business by purchasing more cattle for fattening.  In the future, Omurjan plans to buy a house for his family in the town of Karabalta. 

The Kiva partner Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan.  As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa J. tiene una tienda de abarrotes y papelería  desde hace 6 años este negocio es su fuente de ingresos para el sostén de la familia. Ella es considerada en esta institución cliente distinguida y esta agradecida por el apoyo brindado ya que ha podido realizar sus proyectos. Teresa desea invertir más en su tienda para así vender más variedad a su clientela y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa J. has managed a grocery store and stationery shop for six years. This business is the source of income to support her family. She is considered to be a distinguished client of Credituyo and is grateful for the support that she has received in order to pursue her projects.

Teresa wants to invest more in her store so that she can sell a greater variety to her customers and earn more income.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower is 22 years old and single. He graduated from Industry Preparatory School. He owns a mini-market and sells various foodstuffs. The borrower will use this loan to develop his shop and purchase goods such as sugar, tea, and rice. The borrower has a good character in the market. Lots of customers do their shopping at his market. The borrower has a great ambition to enlarge his shop and earn more income.

loans.use: For purchasing materials & a vertical fridge

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a widow who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a sari-sari store and a fried chicken business. She has one child who is 6 years old. Belinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Belinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 56,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell to continue to save up for the future to repair their house and for her children’s education. Belinda is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Galib

texts.ru: Galib yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione  vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet odnoqo rebonka. Galib E. 33 qoda. On ranshe rabotal prodavcom v magazine no potom on reshil zanyatsya druqim biznessom i uje 3 qoda kak on zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. Galib etomu biznessu nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadi. Galib seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya toqo chtobi uvelichit kolichestva produkta. On prodayet moloko i kefir po zakazu , tak kak on imeyet mnoqo zakazov yemu nujni yeshe korovi.
texts.en: Galib is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city, and now he and his family live in the Fuzuli region. He is married and has one child.  Galib E. is 33 years old.  He used to work as a salesman in a store, but then he decided to change businesses.  He has been working as a herdsman for three years now.  Galib started this business with his uncle.  Galib now needs 2000 AZN to buy cows in order to increase production.  He takes orders to sell milk and kefir.  Currently he has so many orders he needs more cows to fill them.

loans.use: buying cows

loans.name: Fibi

texts.en:
Fibi is married, with five children.  Three of them attend school, while two are still too young for school. She and her husband own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and school fees. 

For over ten years, she has operated a retail shop at the market. Fibi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 , she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey R. is 47 years old and her husband, Mr. Sos Yin, is 44 years old.  They have been married since 1991 and have three sons and two daughters -- four are in school and one is still young. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  

Srey and her husband are rice farmers. When she is not at the farm, Srey also sells cakes in her village to earn additional income. Srey wants to launch a new business selling groceries to generate much more income.  Hence she is applying for her first loan of $500 to build a grocery store and to buy grocery items for her inventory.

loans.use: open a grocery store

loans.name: Humbelina Vicenta

texts.es:
Humbelina es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad que reside junto a sus dos hijas en el  distrito de Chepén. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la Región de La Libertad, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Humbelina se dedica desde hace 8 años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, especialmente aves de corral, cuyes los cuales los cría en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

Ella desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, asimismo realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
46-year old Humbelina is mother to two children and lives in the district of Chepén, an agricultural area located in La Libertad region, over an hour from the town of Chiclayo.

For the last eight years Humbelina has raised and then sold young animals, particularly poultry, which she raises in a corral near her house. She feeds them grain and natural grasses, and when they have reached a good size she sells them to merchants who visit the area frequently.

Humbelina wishes to expand her business by buying more animals and nutritious feed. This will provide her with a better income and she will be able to make some improvements to her house. She is seeking a loan of 1000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve this objective.

loans.use: to buy more animals and nutritious feed

loans.name: Joconda Monica

texts.es:
Joconda  de 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora que inicio las venta de pollo por medio de su mama y le ha servido de mucha ayuda para mantener a su familia.

Ella trabaja vendiendo pollos sola en todo el día en la venta para sus clientes. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para su negocio pero por ahora quiere darle una buena vida a su familia por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar cemento, bloque y hierro y asi construir el segundo piso de su vivienda y darle lo mejor a su hijo y que prospere más su negocio.
texts.en:
Joconda, age 37, is a hard-working woman.  She started selling chicken through her mother, and it has been a great help in supporting her family.

She works alone all day selling chickens to her customers.

She has a lot of aspirations for her business, but for now she wants to give her family a good life.  That is why she wants the loan to buy cement, block, and iron to build a second floor onto her house.  

She wants to give her son the best and to see her business prosper more.

loans.use: to buy cement, block, and iron.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 49 years old, married and has 4 children, two of whom are in school.

Mercedes is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. Mercedes has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mercedes has been pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed  and repaid 17 loans in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mercedes would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret lives in the Makerere neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members. Margaret has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years and works seven days out of every week. Margaret sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale and retail. Margaret has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Margaret include rain, which hinders her customers ability to come to her, and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and build more rental rooms. Margaret lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Vaitupua

texts.en:
Vaitupua is 36 years old and married with six children. Vaitupua owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Vaitupua needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Vaitupua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Vaitupua's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets and knives

loans.name: La Amistad Centro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Amistad Centro esta formado por 5 mujeres y 3 hombres quienes son amigos y conocidos, viven en los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad  es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad  desde diciembre de 1999, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía la misma que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es muy amable y cordial. Los integrantes de este grupo son personas trabajadoras y luchan día a día para salir adelante con sus familias.

Una de las socias de este Banco Comunal es la Señora Rosa, ella vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca.
 
Tiene 42 años, es casada y ha concebido 2 hijos de 23, 18 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja para cubrir sus gastos personales, su segunda hija esta estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se encuentra fuera del país, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Rosa tiene hace 7 años un  bazar el mismo que atiende de lunes a viernes desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada  por una vecina, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de artículos de bazar.
 
Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
The “La Amistad Centro” (The Friendship Center) Communal Bank is comprised of five women and three men.  They are friends and acquaintances who live in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  This city was named the Cultural Heritage of Humanity in December, 1999. The city has a widely varied gastronomy, which captivates the palate of natives and foreigners. Its people are warm and friendly. 

The members of this group are hard-working people who struggle day to day in order to get their families ahead.

Rosa is one of the members of the communal bank.  She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  She is 42 years old and married.  She has two children, ages 23 and 18.  Her first child, a son, works to cover his personal expenses.  Her second child, a daughter, attends a school in the city.  Her husband is out of the country.  She does not have her own house, so she lives in a rented home.

Rosa has had a bazaar for seven years.  She tends this business from Monday through Friday from nine in the morning until seven at night.

This is her first loan with the communal bank, which she was invited to join by a neighbor.  She will use the money from the loan to buy items for her bazaar.

loans.use: to buy bazaar items.

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en: Sarum, 59 years old, is a vegetable seller earning $10 per day. Her husband is retired. She has 6 children: three are studying and the other three are working and earn about $11 per day. Every month she has to spend $165 on food, $30 on school fees, $10 on electricity and $40 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work. She has a plan to get a tailoring shop for her daughter at home when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi, 46, lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. 

She and her husband are both farmers. They work together in tilling their land and growing rice crops. Noemi also raises pigs to help augment their income. She works hard to support her family.

Noemi requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to open a sari-sari (variety) store business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Percina

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito da Matutuine provincia de Maputo e residente na Ponta Douro. Fez o  nivel primário. Tem 3 filhos com idades compreendidas de7 a 12anos de idade.
Trabalha numa instancia turistica e faz pequenos negocios de venda de produtos diversos. Com os  lucros que obtem do seu negocio e salario do marido que recebe consegue alimentar a sua familia e poupa um pouco no banco comercial(BCI).
Vem a conhecer a Hluvuku-Adsema apartir de conversas com seus amigos e colegas de servico do seu marido, e decide aproximar para ter mais esclarecimentos sobre os procedimentos para ser cliente e beneficiar-se do financiamento para realizar seus projectos.
Vem a tornar-se cliente da Hluvuku ha 2 de junho de 2010. O seu primeiro emprestimo foi no valor de 5.500,00Mts para compra de cimento, no segundo foi para compra de chapas de zinco e barrotes.  No presente emprestimo de 10.000,00Mts PARA compra de  de material de construcao (cimento, areia e mao- de- obra).
Tenciona ver sua casa concluida e para tal conta com a Hluvuku-Adsema para mais financiamento.
texts.en:
Percina was born in the District of Matutuine in the province of Maputo and resides in Ponta D’Ouro. She completed primary school. She has 3 children aged between 7 and 12.
She works in a tourist resort and sells various products in her small scale business. With the profits she obtains from her business and her husband’s salary, she manages to feed her family and to save some money in a commercial bank (BCI).
Percina came to know of Hluvuku-Adsema through conversations with her friends and her husband’s work colleagues. She decided to get closer in order to request clarification on the process for becoming a Hluvuku client and to benefit from financing to carry out her projects.
She became a Hluvuku client on 2nd June 2010. Her first loan was for the amount of 5,500 meticals (MZN) to purchase cement, her second was to purchase sheets of zinc and beams. The current loan of 10,000 MZN is for purchasing construction materials (cement, sand and payment of labour).
She intends to see the build of her house completed and for this she will count on Hluvuku-Adsema for further loans.

loans.use: purchase construction materials (cement, sand and payment of labour)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh corn to roast for sale.

loans.name: Olok

texts.en:
Olok is 30 years old and lives in the town of Pachwach in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has 6 children. Two of his children are currently in school. Olok has a business of a small retail shop where he sells plates, cups, saucepans, which he has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Olok has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase plates, cups, saucepans for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Olok hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  

In the future, Olok hopes to expand his business. Olok is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase plates, cups, saucepans for resale.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La señora Teresa es artesana y también vende todo tipo de artesanías que trae del departamento de Oruro. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mayor cantidad de artesanías y  así aumentar la mercadería y mejorara sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona de Villa Exaltación  en la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltera  y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que Teresa aplica y obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y por el carácter de mujer empresaria se lo envia a Kiva para su fondeo.
texts.en:
Teresa is an artisan, and she also sells all types of handicrafts that she gets in the Oruro department.

She needs the loan to buy a greater quantity of handicrafts.  That way she will increase her merchandise and improve her income.

She lives in her own house, which is located the Villa Exaltación zone in the city of La Paz.  She is single, and she does not have children.

This is the first time that Teresa has applied for and received a loan from IMPRO.  Due to her integrity as a businesswoman her request is being sent to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts in the city of Oruro in order to sell them in the city of La Paz.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es: Wilma tiene 54 años, es una mujer valiente y muy trabajadora, esta separada de su esposo, pero es madre de tres hijos, quienes ya son mayores, pero solo vive con uno de ellos en una casa alquilada. Ambos trabajan para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Su trabajo consiste en ofrecer diversos servicios, como: fotocopias, tipeos, impresiones, alquiler de cabinas de Internet, recargas de saldo a celulares, venta de golosinas; asimismo ofrece alimentos, desayuno por las mañanas y almuerzo por las tardes. Tiene cuatro años haciendo este trabajo, y lo hace en compañía de su sobrina, a quien contrata para que le ayude a atender a la clientela o cuidar mientras se encuentra ausente. Su local de trabajo se encuentra en un espacio de su casa, desde entonces viene ofreciendo diversos servicios, además es muy conocida por le efectividad con que realiza el trabajo. Por otro lado, ella dispone de su propio tiempo para dedicarse a otras cosas. Por lo pronto desea tener otro local, para ampliar el servicio de internet. Este será el crédito número 12 con MFP, y asegura que cumplirá con el pago de sus cuotas. Agradece además a todos ustedes por préstamos anteriores ya que eso le ayudó a consolidar su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, repotenciará sus computadoras para que pueda tener un mejor funcionamiento y seguir brindando un buen servicio.
texts.en: Wilma is 54 years old. She is a courageous and hardworking woman who is separated from her husband but is the mother of 3 children, all of which are adults. She lives with one of her children in a rented house. They both work for the upkeep of the home. She provides different services such as: photocopying, typing, printing, internet access rental, cell phone balance refills, candy sales. She also sells food: breakfast in the mornings and lunch in the afternoons. She has been doing this work for 4 years with her niece who she employs to help her serve the customers or take care of things when she is out. Her workplace is located in her house and since its installation there she has been providing various services. In addition she is very well known for the effective way she performs her work. On the other hand, she can manage her own time and devote time to other things. For the moment she wants another locale in order to expand her internet service. This will be her 12th loan with MFP and she assures us that she will make her repayments. She is also grateful to all of you for the previous loans as they helped her consolidate her business. With the amount requested, she will repower her computers to improve their performance so that they will continue to give good service.

loans.use: to repower her computers.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, Nyevu has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES, Nyevu wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia  de Tete, norte  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos já maiores de idade. Fez a 3ª classe e não continuou porque foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatorio. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 3 netos que vivem com ele. 

Saiu de Tete para  Maputo no Distrito de Boane quando foi transferido como militar, é pensionista militar ha mais de 25 anos e tem pensão de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para a obra da sua casa (cimento, pedra, areia, blocos e outros). O anterior foi de 15.000.00mt e foi aplicado na habitacao.
Compromete-se a pagar sem problemas e no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para melhorar ainda mais a sua casa e criar gado suino.
texts.en:
Jose was born in the province of Tete in northern Mozambique. He is married and the father of two adult children. He went to school through the third grade but dropped out in order to complete his compulsory military service. He lives in his own home with his family, and also supports three grandchildren who live with him.

He left Tete for Maputo in the district of Boane when he was transferred there as a soldier. He retired from the military after 25 years and earns a pension of 4,500 meticals a month. He uses the pension to pay for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account.
He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku from a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his second loan, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, cinder blocks, etc.) to continue the construction on his house. The previous loan, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, was also used for the house.
He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to further improve his house and start raising pigs.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (cement, stone, sand, cinder blocks, etc.) to continue the construction on his house.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат занимается торговлей на рынке района Дж. Руми. Она в основном продает овощи, зелень и чаку. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 15 лет. Саодат вдова. У нее четверо детей. Ей 45 лет. Она берет кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Saodat works as a seller at a market in the region of J. Rumy. She mainly sells vegetables, fresh herbs, and chaka (a fermented milk product). She has been working as a seller for 15 years. Saodat is a widow and has four children. She is 45 years old. She is applying for credit to increase turnover.

loans.use: to purchase beets, radishes, Korean salads, chaka (fermented milk product), and cabbages

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 48 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy trabajadora. Esta separada del padre de sus hijos, es por esta razón que se volvió una mujer luchadora, ya que crió a sus cuatro hijos ella sola. Tiene tres hijos mayores e independiente y solo la menor depende de ella ya que recién tiene 14 años y aún esta en etapa escolar. Ella vive en su casa propia en donde aún vive sus hijos mayores pero que aportan en la economía del hogar y son de ayuda para ella. El trabajo de Rosa consiste en la venta de productos regionales, entre las cosas que vende encontramos: hojas de bijou, limones regionales, yuca, cocona y mas, ella invierte su dinero de acuerdo a la temporada que están lo productos en la región, tiene una puesto en el mercado de su ciudad y lleva trabajando ahí por dos años. Le gusta mucho trabajar así, ya que se siente libre e independiente ya que no tiene que estar rindiendo la cuentas a nadie de su horario, además gana muy bien y eso le hace estar mas tranquila. Tiene como meta muchas cosas, como el de ampliar su negocio y empezar a vender en cantidades mayores y enviar a otras ciudades, ya que hay salida de estos productos. Este será el segundo crédito con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Así mismo ella se compromete en seguir pagando de manera puntual ya que está muy agradecida y la manera de demostrarlo será pagando sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más productos para su puesto, entre las cosas que comprará serán hoja de bijou, limones, mangos y otros productos de temporada.
texts.en:
Rosa sells regional products.  Among the things she sells are regional “bijao" leaves (heliconia hirsute, a tropical plant used to wrap food for cooking), lemons, yucca, “cocona” (a tropical citrus fruit), and more.  She invests her money according to the season of the regional products.  She has a stand at the market in her city.  She has been working there for two years.  She really likes to work this way because she feels free and independent.  She does not have to account for her schedule to anyone.  Also, she earns very well, and that makes her happy.

She has many goals like expanding her store, starting to sell in greater quantities, and sending her products to other cities because there is a demand for these products. 

This will be her second loan with the MFP institution.  She hopes to get their collaboration in order to continue with her objectives.  She pledges to continue paying in a punctual manner because she is very grateful.  Her manner of showing this is to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested loan to buy more products for her stand.  Some of the things she will buy are bijao leaves, lemons, mangoes, and other seasonal products.

loans.use: to buy bijao leaves, lemons, mangoes, and products of the jungle region.

loans.name: Kibisi Central B Group

texts.en:
Hellen is the facilitator of the Kibisi Central B group. Hellen and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hellen and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Hellen takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to get skills about farming and to access fertilizers and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Hellen had a very good maize yield, harvesting 26 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Hellen was only able to harvest 12 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Hellen will educate her children and  ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Kibisi Central B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows 7 people; 6 women and 1 man.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samwel is a single man aged 24. For the last two years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to make a living. He has employed one person to assist him to manage the business. He expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training him on good customer care. He has requested for a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike. In the next 5 years, he plans to transform his business from a motorbike to van transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Vithel

texts.en:
Vithel is 39 years old and married with two children currently going to school. Vithel works very hard to provide for them.

Vithel runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.  

Vithel has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, bread, canned goods, spices, etc.. 

In the future Vithel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es:
La Sra. Evarista, tiene 46 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Itá, está casada con el Sr. Modesto con quien tiene una hija de 22 años de edad.La Sra Evarista tiene una despensa bien surtida hace mas de 12 años, y nos comenta que cuenta con una clientela bien formada quienes se encuentran muy conformes con los precios y los productos que se encuentran a la venta en la despensa.
Ella es una señora muy trabajadora y sacrificada que gracias a su esfuerzo y su perseverancia a logrado llevar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida, ademas de su depensa logró montar una herrería donde trabajan su marido y su yerno.
La Sra. Evarista manifestó que solicita la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de Arroz, azúcar, panificados, lacteos, carnes, articulos de limpieza, etc. con lo cual podrá abastecer su despensa y de esa forma cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Evarista, 46, lives in the city of Itá.  She’s married to Modesto and they have a 22-year-old daughter.  Evarista has had a well-stocked store for over 12 years and she comments that she has a well-established clientele who are very satisfied with her prices and with the products that are available at her store.

She is a very hardworking, self-sacrificing woman who thanks to her effort and perseverance has managed to move her family ahead and improve their quality of life.  In addition to her store, she managed to also open a hardware store where her husband and her son-in-law work.

Evarista stated that she is asking help from the Fundación and from Kiva to buy rice, sugar, baked goods, dairy products, meat, cleaning supplies, etc. to stock her store to fill customer orders.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Sitha is a weaver, while her husband, Det, is a house builder. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City and have two married daughters. One daughter lives in a separated home and the other one still lives in the family home.
