Sitha has asked for Kiva loans several times. She is now asking for a new loan of $300 to support her weaving business by allowing her to purchase weaving materials.  Weaving is a traditional profession.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman. She has 2 children aged 2 months and 3 years. She describes herself as flexible. She operates a food stall where she sells fish and sardines. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a competitive and busy area. She describes her biggest business challenges as increasing travel costs and shortages of fish. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy one basin of sardines and one bundle of dried fish. Her business goal is to buy a fridge within 5 years. Eunice hopes that, in the future, she will be exporting fish.

loans.use: To buy one basin of sardines and a bundle of dried fish

loans.name: Anyhelo Geovanny

texts.es:
Anyhelo vive en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú. El cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y por la generosidad de sus pobladores. Anyhelo es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, sobre todo porque sus padres son de condición humilde y por ello se esfuerza mucho cada día para poder ofrecerle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida. Día  a día trabaja en una empresa como vigilante, el trabaja alrededor de 12 horas y en turnos variados semana a semana; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo con, muchas ganas de ser mejor cada día.

Anyhelo esta muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la gran ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que realizara unas reparaciones en el techo ya que se filtra el agua, de esta manera el podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener una carrera universitaria y poder apoyar a sus padres”.

loans.use: Para reparación de techo

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret, pictured above, has six children and is always described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the leader of her group. Margaret is representing her group of nine farmers in Matete District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Margaret has been a farmer for more than 30 years. In order to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this coming season, Margaret is planning to buy a cow.

A total of 4.25 acres will be planted by Margaret's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Gbetode

texts.fr: Mariée, Gbétodé a en charge un enfant. Gbétodé est âgée de 44 ans et habite à Agoè où elle prépare et vend de la pâte bandée. Gbétodé achète le nécessaire servant à la préparation au marché. Gbétodé sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs afin de gagner plus de bénéfices en vue de soutenir les besoins de son foyer et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes.
texts.en: Gbétodé is married with one dependent child. Gbétodé is 44 years old and lives in Agoè where she prepares and sells corn mash. Gbétodé buys the goods for making her preparation at the market.  Gbétodé requests this loan to order sacks of corn so she can earn more income to support the needs of her household and improve the conditions of their daily life.

loans.use: To buy six sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Ma. Celia

texts.en:
Celia lives in Tampico Tamaulipas. She is 48 years old and works selling shoes. She began her business to help her husband with the family expenses because his salary does not cover all the household needs. She has two young daughters who are still in school. It is very important to Celia that they continue their studies so they can be independent in the future.

Celia has been operating her business for six years. It has helped her to pay for all her daughter’s expenses such as school supplies and clothing. She needs a loan for $375 USD to finance to her client’s purchases. This way she can increase her sales and her income. She and her family need your support and generosity.

** Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Celia vive en Tampico Tamaulipas, tiene 48 años y se dedica a la venta de zapatos por pedido. Inicio su negocio ante la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, ya que el gana un salario que no es suficiente para cubrir con todos los gastos del hogar, por lo que Celia decidió apoyarlo. Tiene dos jóvenes hijas las cuales se encuentran estudiando, para Celia es muy importante que ellas estudien para que en un futuro puedan ser independientes.

Actualmente Celia tiene 6 años con su negocio y este le ha permitido cubrir con los gastos de sus hijas como lo es en estudios y vestido. Ella requiere de $375 USD para financiar a sus clientes sus productos, de esta manera ella aumentara sus ventas y sus ingresos. Ella y su familia requieren de tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
My name is Magdalena and two years ago I decided to sell clothing for men, women and children. I also sell jewelry such as rings, chains and earrings. My sales are from client-direct orders, so they are safe. As Mother's Day and summer are approaching, I need to provide warm-weather products like bathing suits, sandals, shorts, T-shirts and some jewelry for gifts.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Me llamo Magdalena y me dedico a vender ropa para damas, caballero y ninos desde hace dos anos, tambien vendo anillos, cadenas y anillos de enchape de oro. Mis ventas son por encargos de mis clientes, por lo que mis ventas son seguras, en este momento por acercarse el verano y dia de la madre necesito surtir mis productos con ropa de verano como trajes de bano, sandalias, shorts, camisetas y algunas joyas para regalos.

loans.use: Buy clothing such as shirts, pants, shorts, T-shirts and jewelry accessories.

loans.name: Julia Arcila

texts.en:
My name is Julia Arcila, I've run a candy store in my home for several years. I started the store myself since work is limited in my city. Thanks to God, my store generates enough income to provide for my family. The economic situation in my country gets worse every day.

Mi nombre es Julia Arcila, mi actividad princial es el comercio, cuento con una chiclera, en mi casa de habitación desde hace barios años, negocio que inicie con esfuerzo propio ya que en esta ciudad las oportunidades de empleo son limitadas, y gracias a Dios este negocio me genera ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de mi familia ya que cada día la situación economica es mas dificil en nuestro pais.

loans.use: Purchase sweets, cookies, sodas,  jellos, juice, and firewood.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
This single man is 25 years old and  lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region.
He has 3 years of experience in this business. He would like  a loan of $600 to buy fertilizer and orchard medicines.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and orchard medicines

loans.name: Cheng Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng Chhun L. (26) lives with her husband (28) and 2 children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Cheng Chhun  makes Khmer noodles for resale. Her husband sells wholesale items, an activity which earns him $7.50  a day. Chen Chhun L. has applied for this loan in order to repair the car which her husband uses to transport the wholesale items for sale.

loans.use: To repair their car

loans.name: Herlis

texts.en: Herlis is 31 years old and is married. She sells rice and some fried foods such as fried chicken, potatoes, fish, fried snacks, and many more items. Her husband, Paman has no fixed income and only does odd jobs. Herlis has been running her business since she joined MBK, and can earn $17 per day. She needs a IDR 900,000 loan for buying some foods and to increase her capital. She hopes that this will increase her business and she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Omar

texts.id:
Omar's daily working hours started at 6:00-9:00 AM, then again 3:00-5:00PM. In between those times he used to sort the items he got, then to deliver them to the wholesaler. Places Omar visit includes garbage places, also shops to obtain used items by buying it, like empty cans, cartons, and items made from plastic. He does this recycling business with his wife. Profit obtained could reach Rp 500,000.00/month. (Translator's note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp 9,000-9,500.00). Since 5 years Omar moved to Bali, and lives in Monang-Maning area. He likes to add used items to be sold to the wholesaler from the loan he hoped to obtian.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Jam kerja Omar setiap harinya dimulai dari pukul 06.00 – 09.00. Kemudian dilanjutkan kembali pukul 03.00 – pukul 05.00. Jeda waktu di antaranya digunakan untuk menyeleksi barang – barang yang diperoleh untuk kemudian disetor ke pengepul. Tempat – tempat yang dikunjungi Omar adalah tempat sampah - tempat sampah. Selain itu ia juga ke toko – toko untuk mendapatkan barang – barang bekas di sana dengan membeli, seperti kaleng minuman, kardus dan barang – barang dari plastik. Usaha ini ia kerjakan bersama sang isteri. Keuntungan yang diperolehnya mencapai Rp 500.000,00 per bulan. Sejak 5 tahun yang lalu Omar pindah ke Bali dan menetap di kawasan Monang – Maning. Ia akan menambah barang – barang bekas yang dijual ke pengepul melalui pinjaman modal usaha yang dia peroleh..

loans.use:
To buy used items

Membeli barang - barang bekas

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a 42-year-old woman. She has 1 child and lives with her family in the region of Aley. Samira refills propane gas for household use. Samira is supporting her family through this business. This is the fourth time Samira is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. She needs to buy supplies to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for the business.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng K., 48, is a widow and lives with her three children in Kampong Chhang province. She runs a stall selling a variety of grocery products and earns approximately $6.20 a day of profit. Two of her daughters are garment workers earning around $70 dollars each month, and the other son works in Korea, generally earning around $700 dollars a month. Mrs. Eeng K. hopes to use this loan to purchase small cow to resell. People in provinces like buying small cows and reselling them when they grow up because it produces profit. Mrs. Eeng K. plans to use the profits from the cow to help her daughter open a stand selling a variety of spices. (Mrs. Eng K. is on the right hand side of the picture)

loans.use: To use this loan to purchase small cows to resell when they grow up

loans.name: Cruz Ch°En 2 Group

texts.es:
Lorenza is 46 years old and she is responsible of feeding 7 children, she manufactures blouses, skirts, shawls, tablecloths, and napkins typical for her region and she sells them in the town of San Cristobal and when she has an opportunity she sells at Nachij. With the loan she will buy material and different colored yarn to embroider her handicrafts. The other members of the group are PascuaL. G. P., Maria J. H., and Rosa J. H., all of them are craftswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

LORENZA TIENE 46 AÑOS Y ES L. ENCARGADA D. MANTENER A 7 HIJOS, SE DEDICA A ELABORAR BLUSAS, FALDAS, REBOSOS, MANTELES Y SERVILLETAS TIPICAS D. SU REGION, MISMAS QUE SALE A VENDER A L. CIUDAD D. SAN CRISTÓBAL Y CUANDO HAY OPORTUNIDAD LAS VEND. EN NACHIJ. CON EL CREDITO LE GUSTARIA COMPRAR TEL. Y MUCHOS HILOS D. COLORES PARA BORDAR SU ARTESANIA, LAS OTRAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, PASCUAL. G. P., MARIA J. H. Y ROSA J. H. SON ARTESANAS

loans.use: Purchase material, yarn, and dye.

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: Bou S. is 50 years old and owns a small farm in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband have grown vegetables to sell in the market since 1980. They support themselves and their only child on a combined daily income of US $3. Their daughter also works at a local garment factory making US $50 per month. They want to invest in an additional plot of farmland on which to grow vegetables, which will bring them greater financial security.

loans.use: To buy farmland

loans.name: Nhor Daut Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhor D., the group leader, lives with the other members of her group in Cham Bak Phém Village. She buys sugar palm and then re-sells it for a profit. She does not currently have enough money to buy more sugar palm, which is why she applied for this loan. Last year, Mrs. Nhor D. obtained a loan to buy pigs for breeding.

Mrs. Nhor D. is 29 years old, married and has six children. Two of her children work in a garment factory while the others attend school. Her husband, Mr. Sareourn Tu, is a subsistence farmer.

The family is in good health and Mrs. Nhor D. hopes to generate more money through her business.

Mrs. Nhor D. is the middle woman in the picture.

loans.use: To buy sugar palm that will be re-sold for a profit

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Khoeurn S. owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup in Pon Ley Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Last year, Mrs. Khoeurn S. obtained a loan to get her small restaurant opened. Her business now is improved, but Mrs. Khoeurn S. does not want to expand it. She would like to start another pig-breeding business. Thus, Mrs. Khoeurn S. needs to access a loan again in order to buy pigs and pig food for this purpose. She is 46 and a widow with three children, one of whom is a cassette-player repairer while one other is car repairer. The youngest one is attending school.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig food to start another business.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge is a very hard working man: aged 54, with his work he provides for his elderly mother and other relatives. Jorge is a successful farmer who principally cultivates maize and barley which he takes to sell in the local market. Since his childhood he has undertaken agricultural labour, the inheritance of his parents’ courage and effort. In the future his desire is to continue cultivating his land and he is now preparing for the next harvest. He is therefore asking for help with a loan in order to buy manure and fertilizers. Your help with Jorge’s loan will be important in order that he is able to continue cultivating his land.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Jorge es un hombre muy trabajador, con sus 54 años y con su trabajo es el sostén de su anciana madre y para los suyos. Jorge es un exitoso agricultor que principalmente cultiva maíz y cebada que lleva a vender en el mercado local. Desde su niñez él se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas como herencia de valor y fuerza de sus padres. En el futuro su deseo es seguir cultivando sus tierras y ahora las prepara para la próxima siembra, él pide su apoyo con un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes. Tu aporte en el préstamo de Jorge será de mucha importancia para que siga cultivando la tierra.

loans.use: Purchase manure and fertlizers for his fields

loans.name: Setha

texts.en:
Mrs. Setha P., 38, is a widow with four children; one son and three daughters. All of her children study in the local school. Setha and her children live with her old mother in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh.
 
Mrs. Setha has been selling beauty products since 1993. She buys them from a market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in the village market. Her business is doing very well because a lot of villagers come to her shop to buy her products. They don't want to spend a lot of time traveling to the market in Phnom Penh. 

Setha wants to purchase more beauty products to serve her customer's need and to repair a part of her shop. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $1000 USD to expand her business and repair her shop.

loans.use: To buy beauty product for resale and to repair her shop.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es:
Eliana tiene 48 años, vive con sus tres jóvenes hijos y con su esposo.  Se dedica a las plantaciones de plátano y yuca, lo cual realiza por más de 9 años, ahora tiene la experiencia de cómo desenvolverse como agricultora, y de tener la posibilidad de mejorar sus plantaciones, por ello se dedica a ellas todas las mañanas para que en las tardes pueda dedicarse a su hogar.Lo que le agrada, es poder hacer las plantaciones en sus terrenos, lo cual no es fácil, pero es como sembrar nuevas esperanzas, de la misma forma tiene que saber lidiar con el tiempo, que a veces le falta para poder limpiar sus terrenos.
Para Eliana, su mayor motivación son sus hijos, quienes desean estudiar en la universidad. 
Por ellos, tienen pensado invertir en nuevas plantaciones de yucas y plátano, pero sobre todo  ampliar sus terrenos de cultivo y llevar sus productos a las ciudades.
texts.en:
Eliana is 48 years old and lives with her three young children and her husband. She has been working on plantains and yucca farming for the last 9 years, now she has experience to develop more as a farmer and improve her land; this is why she works on the land every morning, so she can dedicate to her home in the afternoon. She likes to be able to work on her own land, which is not difficult and is like sawing new hopes; she also needs to organize her time, because sometimes she doesn’t have enough to clean her land.
To Eliana her greatest motivation is her children, who want to go to university.
Is because of them she wants to invest on land to cultivate plantains and yucca, mostly to improve her current land and take her products to the cities.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the land to cultivate yuca and plantains to increase production and sell it to nearby towns

loans.name: Saienesi

texts.en:
Saienesi S., 50 years old, is married with six children.  She has many years of experience producing and selling taro and bananas. She sells to the villagers and public three days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about 187 USD). SPBD loans are Saienesi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  She hopes that this loan with assist her in buying materials for her business needs. Her husband is also fully engaged with the business.

loans.use: To purchase taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, chemicals and a shovel

loans.name: Las Salvadoras Group

texts.es:
Banco comunal, formado en Santa Cruz, Bolivia, con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y sus negocios mediante el microcrédito.
GIOVANNA LUCIA V..- Es la líder del grupo, ella vive en el Km. 9 Barrio 23 de diciembre, es dueña de casa hace  25 años que reside en la zona, vive con su esposo tienen un hijos.
Tiene la actividad de venta de cosméticos y ropa, y el crédito que necesita es para invertir en el mismo negocio aumentando su capital..
PADY MARIELA.- es la secretaria del banco comunal, ella vive en el Km. 9 Barrio 23 diciembre en la misma zona ella se dedica a la venta de ropa , tiene un hijo y vive con su esposo, ella vive en casa alquilada aparte sueña con tener su propia tienda de ropa.
LETICIA V..- es la tesorera del Banco comunal, ella vive en la misma localidad es decir en el Km. 9 Barrio 23 de diciembre tiene el negocio de la venta de ropa. Vive en la casa familiar cuenta con un hijos 
El negocio con el que cuenta actualmente es ambulante y de la misma manera que las otras compañeras con el tiempo quiere llegar a colocar su negocio fijo.
texts.en:
A community bank, formed in Santa Cruz, Bolivia, with the goal of bettering the quality of life and their businesses through microcredit. GIOVANNA LUCIA V. is the leader of the group. She lives at Km. 9 Barrio 23 de diciembre. She is the owner of her house and has lived in the area for the past 25 years. She lives with her husband and they have one son. She works selling cosmetics and clothing, and this loan is needed in order to invest in her business, increasing her capital. PADY MARIELA is the secretary of the community bank. She lives in Km. 9 Barrio 23 diciembre, in the same zone. She works selling clothing. She has one son and she lives with her husband. She lives in a rented, freestanding house. Her dream is to have her own clothing store. LETICIA V. is the treasurer of the community bank. She lives in the same location, or at Km. 9 Barrio 23 de diciembre. She has a business selling clothing. She lives in her family’s home with her children. The business that she has at the moment is on foot and similar to the other group members with time she wants to have a fixed location for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: Leoncio tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y vive con sus cuatro hijos. Se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace 30 años, actividad  que  le agrada realizar, sobre todo durante la siembra de sus plantas, porque es el inicio prometedor de lo que  vendrá. Dedicarse al café es rentable  para  Leoncio porque  los grandes productores se encuentran  en la selva central y por ello es bastante concurrido por grandes comerciantes que tiene depósitos de café, sin embargo, lo difícil es poder plantar las plantas de café en los terrenos, ya que estos tiene que estar debidamente abonados. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Leoncio comprará abono necesario para sus terrenos, cada  bolsa de abono tiene un costo de 250 soles, él requiere de cuatro a  bolsas.
texts.en:
Leoncio is 47 years old, married and lives with his four children. He has grown coffee for 30 years, an activity he enjoys doing, above all during the planting of his plants because this is the promising beginning of what will come. Growing coffee is profitable for Leoncio because the big growers are in the central jungle and it is rather common for the large growers to have coffee plantations, nevertheless, it is difficult to be able to plant coffee plants on this land as they need quite a bit of fertilizer. This is his first loan with MFP. Leoncio will buy the necessary fertilizer for his land, each bag of fertilizer costs 250 soles, and he needs four bags.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for his coffee plants

loans.name: Afishata

texts.en:
Afishata M. is thirty-five years old and married. She and her husband have five children, and the family lives in a business center called Ejura. Ejura is a busy market town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Afishata says all her kids are still in school.

Afishata enjoys trading very much. She started trading in her infancy when she stayed with her parents, and has been trading in maize and yams for over fifteen years. She buys her goods from the small towns nearby and sells at the local market. She buys beans, groundnuts, or other cereals, depending on the situation.

With this loan, Afishata plans to increase the quantity of cereals she buys on each trip, which will reduce her travel time and costs and enable her to supply a sizeable market. She is in a group called ‘Rely on God’. The group members guarantee for one another to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy cereals and yams in bulk

loans.name: Sadjida

texts.ru:
Салихова Саджида предприниматель с 10–и летним стажем. Ей 52 года, у нее 4 детей. Она занимается торговлей женской и мужской одежды на оптовом рынке «Корвон».  С связи с тяжелым финансовым положением она при помощи знакомых решила начать свой бизнес. На свои сбережения она арендовала маленькое место на базаре и стала заниматься продажей детской одежды. Получаемый доход стал основным источником в ее семейном бюджете. Закупает Саджида товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон» и с поставщиков с Китая. Ассортимент товара составляет брюки, юбки, пуловер, вязаные платья и сорочки. 
Саджида хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони  сроком на 9 месяцев, чтобы пополнить ассортимент товара.
texts.en:
Sadjida S. is a businesswoman with a 10 year experience. She is 52 years old and has four children. She sells women's and men's clothing on the wholesale market Korvon. Due to her difficult financial situation she decided to start her own business with the help of her friends. She used her savings to rent a small space on the market and started selling children's clothes. The profits from this business became the main income source in her family's budget. Sadjida buys the merchandise on the wholesale market Korvon from suppliers from China. Her inventory includes pants, skirts, pullovers, knitted dresses and blouses. Sadjida wants to get a loan for 3000 somoni (USD$875) for a 9 months term to fulfill the assortment of her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy men's pants

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 25 year old man who lives in the Bekaa. Ali has owned a owned a mini market store for a year. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.
His clients are people from his area. In the future, Ali plans to expand his business.

loans.use: Ali will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Mujeres Decididas 2 Group

texts.en:
Mujeres Decididas 2 is a group of five people who are all trying to receive their first loans with Esperanza International. This group comes from an extremely poor area in San Pedro, Dominican Republic. The majority of this group do not have a steady income, and they are looking to start small businesses to change that fact. This group is very excited about this opportunity, and they are ready to get started on their businesses.

Alexandra G. is the representative of this group. She is planning on starting a small store where she will sell all sorts of goods. She is the mother of two young children, and she wants nothing more than to be able to provide them with a comfortable life. She dreams of sending them to a University someday. Alexandra is an extremely hard worker who will find a way to make her business work. She is excited to finally be getting a chance, and she admits that opportunities like this haven't come often in her life. She is ready to take this next step towards a better life!!

Thank you!

loans.use: Buy products for her store

loans.name: Iqra

texts.en: My name is Iqra and I’m a 21 year old married lady.  I have resided in a city named Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years.  I got education till 10th standard and then got married to a man whose name is Zulfiqar Ali.  He is a movie maker.  He makes movies of different occasion e.g. (birthdays, marriages).  He has been in this business for the past 10 years.  Iqra B. successfully repaid her first loan.  Now she is applying for a loan to buy another movie camera for her husband.

loans.use: Buy movie camera for husband.

loans.name: Davaadolgor

texts.en:
Davaadolgor D. is a 39-year-old married woman. Her family lives in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces.

In 1999, together with her husband Sunduijav, Davaadolgor started her retail sales business at the local market. Once every month, her husband goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city, to buy cosmetics and housing supplies such as napkins, toothpaste and toothbrushes.

As a result of ten years of hard work, her business capital has increased from 800,000 tugrugs to 2,500,000 tugrugs ($1.00 USD=1450 MNT). With her profit she has bought the stall that she had rented for many years. She requests a loan to buy kids' apparel and cosmetic goods.

loans.use: to buy kids' apparel and cosmetic goods.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina Y. is a twenty-two year old lady. She is single but has given birth to one child, a girl, who is currently in nursery school. Augustina says she and her daughter live with an aunt in a rented apartment in a town called Takorase. Takorase is farming and commercial community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Augustina runs a drugstore in the community. She sells drugs such as paracetamol, syrups and all other kinds of tablets. Her drugstore is located at the local market square. Augustina procures the drugs from nearby bigger towns. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure drugs in bulk. She is hopeful to give her child the best of education.

loans.use: To procure drugs for re-sale

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Kafui T. est une femme de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle est productrice de l’huile rouge à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. son activité consiste à acheter des noix de palme au près des agriculteurs et de venir les transformer en l’huile de palme (huile rouge). Kafui exerce cette activité depuis sa jeunesse. Elle compte avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son entreprise. Les sacs qui sont dans la vue contiennent des noix de palme.
texts.en:
Kafui T. is a 48-year-old woman, married, and the mother of five. She is a producer of red oil in Wome, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Her work involves buying palm nuts from farmers and processing them into palm oil (red oil). She has been in this business since her youth. She intends to use this loan to expand her enterprise. The sacks appearing in the photo contain palm nuts.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm nuts for producing palm oil

loans.name: Ork

texts.en:
Ork N., at 50 years old, is an older villager that lives in the Province of Pursat, Cambodia. She is a widow, her husband died of senility years ago. Right now, she has four children: three are married and have already started new family homes, whilst the other one is single and works as a staff member for a casino hotel in Phnom Penh City.

Ork N. currently works growing a kind of local crop. In addition, she raises pigs in a cage behind her house. Ork N. requested a loan in order to buy a sow to breed for babies to sell. She proposes to use the rest of loan to pay for plowing a field.

loans.use: For a breeding sow and to have a field plowed

loans.name: Dora Bernardina

texts.es:
Dora es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Dora es separada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Dora es panificadora, elabora panes típicos de la zona como la chapla, actividad que realiza en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena.
Dora necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina y azúcar.
Los sueños de Dora son tener un horno propio y culminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy, which means Harvest in Quechua. Dora is separated, 56 years old, and has 6 children. Dora is a bread maker, and makes traditional breads of the area, such as Chapla; Dora carries out this activity in a rented oven, and her sales are carried out as an ambulant vendor in the Magdalena market. Dora needs a loan of 1,500 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of flour and sugar. Dora dreams of having her own oven, and finishing the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase of flour and sugar.

loans.name: Benkelema  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  neuf femmes du groupe Benkelema  3 sont toutes mariées et  résident à Flacoda un hameau  de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région administrative (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles ont  en moyenne  36 ans,   4 enfants  et vivent dans des familles polygames. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne (prêt agricole) de Soro Yiriwaso, qui correspond avec leur activité étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne, le premier a été bien remboursé.
Elles veulent utiliser ce prêt  actuel pour les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. 
Elles veulent cultiver 23 hectares avec comme spéculations  l’arachide, le riz et le mil. Ces femmes espèrent sur  une production moyenne de 3 tonnes par hectare soit 69 tonnes.
Une partie de  la récolte sera consommée, l’autre partie stockée d’abord puis vendue au comptant.
Le bénéfice généré sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, prendre en charge certaines dépenses de la famille et acheter les trousseaux de mariage des filles.
texts.en:
The nine women of the Benkelema 3 group are all married and live in Flacoda, a hamlet in Fakola in the prefecture of Kolondièba in the third administrative region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. Their average age is 36, they have an average of 4 children each and they live in polygamous families. They got to know each other through family and neighborhood connections. When Soro Yiriwaso started offering farming loans (agricultural loans) that apply to their business activity of farming, these women seized the opportunity. They are on their second farming loan, the first one having been fully repaid. They intend to use this current loan to cover the cost of plowing, weeding, and purchasing seeds, fertilizer and weed-killer. They want to cultivate 23 hectares as areas for growing groundnut, rice and millet. These women hope to produce an average of three metric tons per hectare, making 69 metric tons in total. Part of harvest will be consumed and the rest will be stored and then sold for cash. The generated profit will be used to reimburse the loan, to take care of certain family expenses and to buy trousseaus for their daughters.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover the cost of plowing, weeding, buying seeds, fertilizer and  weed-killer.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of five children who are all in school. She is a petty trader and sells smoked meat. She gets her stocks from Tamale in the northern part of Ghana. She buys in bulk and supplies to food vendors in the community market where she lives.

In most cases, people place their order in advanced and she supplies to them as soon as she arrives. She started her business two years ago with lots of experience and the atmosphere of creating a good environment. She requests the loan to trek to the north of Ghana to buy stock. She also dreams of providing education for her children from the business proceeds.

loans.use: To buy meat in bulk.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie S. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 22 years old and single. To make a living, Charlie drives a taxi.  She has been doing so for over one year and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.  Charlie joined PMPC in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlie has successfully repaid a loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, and now she is requesting her third PMPC loan (for 7,000 PHP) which she will use to repair her taxi.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To repair her taxi.

loans.name: Raulina

texts.en:
Raulina P. is from the village of Tinotongan in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 40 years old. Raulina is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Raulina owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store where she sells a variety of products in the local community. Raulina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Raulina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Raulina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Raulina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Raulina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions and support the education of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rutchel

texts.en:
Rutchell V. is a 45-year-old married woman with 4 school-age children who lives in the village of Brgy. Palaka Norte, in the town of Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She's reaching for her dreams through hard work, patience, self-discipline, and the determination to move away from poverty. As a young girl, she dreamed of having her own business someday.

Rutchell grew up going from town to town with her parents selling dried fish during the town market day. She learned how to deal with customers, how to sell, and how to handle money from her parents. When she got married, she decided to put up her own dried fish vending business. With the help of her husband and a little capital, they started selling dried fish in their community.

Needing more capital to expand her business moved Rutchel to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997. With more capital available, she was able to start going to different towns during their market day, exponentially increasing her income. After her 3rd cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rutchell decided to further supplement her family's income potential by opening a general store as an additional source of income. Over the next 10 years, her business provided well for her young family, and she now earns on an average PHP 16,400 per month, which is used to pay for the education of her 4 children, cover the family's household expenses, and set aside some savings for the future of her children.

Rutchell has been an NWTF-Project Dungganon member in good standing for the last 12 years and her last loan of PHP 29,500 was paid in full with no delays in weekly installments. For this 17th loan, Rutchell is again borrowing PHP 29,500 which she intends to use as revolving working capital for her dried fish business and the general store. The profits from this loan will continue to fund the education of her children and provide for the family's household expenses.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: As additional capital for dried fish vending and general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de mèches

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr: Alimatou T. est une veuve âgée de 45 ans avec 4 enfants en charge, elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS2" depuis 3 trois ans. Elle y a bénéficié de 6 prêts qu'elle a régulièrement remboursés. Avec son crédit elle fabrique de la glace et de la crème qu'elle revend. Elle vend également des tissus teintés. C'est elle qui assure la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité de ses 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Alimatou T. is a 45-year-old widow with four children to support.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "SAMBA 15ANS 2" for three years and has benefited from six loans, which she repaid regularly.  With her current loan, she is making ice and cream that she sells retail.  She also sells dyed fabrics.  She is the one who ensures that her four children are provided with food, health care, and schooling. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To promote her micro-enterprise

loans.name: Ligia Cumanda

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tres Marías se encuentra a unos 15 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad del mismo nombre en el sur de la ciudad, esta localidad goza de una belleza natural y biodiversidad por su lugar de ubicación, su gente adulta se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería mientras que los jóvenes trabajan en la ciudad o han migrado al extranjero para darles una mejor vida a su familia.
 
Ligia V. es socia del banco comunal 3 Marías, vive por el sector la autopista vía a Punta Corral;  tiene 34 años de edad es casada y madre de cuatro hijos de 16, 14, 12, 10 años, su primer hijo estudia  en el colegio Unedid, el segundo en el colegio Miguel Merchán, su hija en el colegio Herlinda Toral y su último hijo en el centro Educativo Yanuncay, su esposo es ebanista(carpintero) y viajó al exterior desde hace muchos años en busca de un presente y futuro mejor para su familia, aún  no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de su madre.

Ligia trabaja en su taller de costura desde  hace  quince años,  arregla toda clase de ropa confecciona blusas, faldas, pantalones pero lo que más elabora es bolsicones (vestimenta tradicional de las cuencanas);  también se dedica a la  cría de pollos, chanchos, tanto para el consumo en su hogar como para la venta cuando lo solicitan sus vecinas de la comunidad  o por alguna emergencia económica.

Lleva tres años trabajando con la fundación y nos comenta que los créditos obtenidos le han  permitido  terminar sus obras y para educar  a sus hijos, con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue  va  a comprar tela para elaborar los bolsicones, blusas, faldas, pantalones para sus clientes frecuentes.

Su meta es incrementar su negocio y llegar a construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
The "3 Marías" communal bank is located some 15 minutes outside of the city of Cuenca, in the community of the same name to the south of the city. Thanks to its location, the area enjoys great natural beauty and biodiversity. Its adult population works in agriculture and ranching, while the young people work in the city or have migrated abroad to provide a better life for their families. Ligia V., a member of the "3 Marías" communal bank, lives near the highway to Punta Corral. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of four children, aged 16, 14, 12 and 10. Her oldest son studies at Unedid School, her second son at Miguel Merchán School, her daughter at Herlinda Toral School, and her youngest child at the Yanuncay Educational Center. Her husband is a carpenter who traveled abroad many years ago to strive for a better present and future for his family. They do not yet have their own home, so they live at her mother's house. Ligia has worked as a seamstress in her own shop for the past fifteen years. She offers alterations to every type of clothing, and she also sews blouses, skirts, and pants; but the garment she makes most often is the "bolsicon," a traditional skirt worn by the women of Cuenca. She also raises chickens and pigs, both for her own household needs and to sell when her neighbors in the community ask for them, or when an economic emergency arises. She has worked with the foundation for the past three years, and she tells us that the loans she has obtained have allowed her to carry out her work and to educate her children. With the loan provided to her by the Espoir Foundation, she will buy fabric to make bolsicones, blouses, skirts and pants for her regular customers. Her goal is to expand her business and eventually to build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric to make skirts, blouses, pants and traditional garments

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys sells garri (food item made from cassava) and firewood at retail prices to her customers. With this combined business, she sells for long hours to ensure that there is food on the table to feed her immediate family members. She has been in this business for four years. She is 32 years old and married with six children. She is a focused, hard worker. She is determined to excel in her business. She is requesting for a loan amount of 60,000 NGN to purchase more garri and firewood to sell. She says that this will help to boost her business. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase garri and firewood to sell

loans.name: Dédévi

texts.fr: Cette femme a appris la coiffure ; en 1997, elle a ouvert son atelier de coiffure dans le quartier de Bè Kpéhénou à Lomé. Son atelier est visité par de nombreuses clientes qui apprécient la qualité de ses services. Elle a aussi à son service des apprenties coiffeuses. Elle en profite aussi pour vendre des mèches ; en ce moment elle a besoin de disposer d’un nouveau séchoir ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES. Le prêt lui permettra également d’acheter 2 grands miroirs, 30 serviettes et 40 mèches. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman has trained as a hairdresser; in 1997 she opened her hairdressing studio in the Bè Kpéhénou area of Lomé. Her studio is used by a large number of customers who appreciate the quality of her services. She also has trainee hairdressers working for her. In addition she takes advantage of her studio to sell hair extensions; at the moment she needs to buy a new hairdryer; it is for this reason she would like to have a loan from WAGES. This loan would also allow her to buy two large mirrors, 30 towels and 40 hair extensions. She is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hairdryer, mirror, hair extensions and towels

loans.name: Susana Hilaria

texts.es: Doña Susana Jiménez tiene un pequeño salón de belleza el cual lleva 18 años administrándolo ya que desde joven curso el curso y ha sido su fuente de ingreso, procreo ochos hijos todo mayores, tiene 63 años de edad, y ha  sido una alegría poder apoyar a sus hijos, ya que es viuda y le toco duro sobresalir adelante. Cuando inicio lo hizo con dinero propio vendía cosméticos ambulantes en un mercado. Debido ala crisis del país, desempleos, ingresos bajo no ha tenido la cantidad de clientes y le preocupa mucho ya que tiene que pagar mes a mes sus pagos de agua, luz, teléfono y a la financiera. La esperanza es que para este mes de Diciembre las jóvenes siempre cambian de lux y espera poder captar clientes y hacer muchos alisados, tintes, encrespado, entre otros es por eso compara: tintes, cremas, pinturas de uñas, materiales para trabajar en los pies, manos, para aumentar el servicio y vender. Sus planes es poder poner el negocio en su casa, lo cual cuidaría de la misma. Contenta por que ha logrado mantener su negocio y no se descapitalizado por los prestamos que hace y compra todos lo productos necesarios para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Susana Jiménez has a small beauty salon. She has been managing it for 18 years. When she was young she studied the program, and it has been her source of income. She has eight grown children, and she is 63. It has been a joy to be able to support her children. Because she is a widow, it was hard to get ahead. She started with her own money, and she sold cosmetics traveling in the market. Due to the crisis in country, unemployment, and low earnings she has not had the usual amount of customers. This worries her because she has to pay her water, light, telephone, and loan monthly. Her hope is that in this month of December when the young people always change their look she will be able to get more customers. She hopes to be able to do a lot of straightening, tints, curling, and other things. That is why she will buy tints, creams, nail polish, and materials to work on the feet and hands. She will do this to increase service and sales. Her plan is to be able to put the business in her house. She would take care of it herself. She is happy because she has maintained her business, and she has not taken money out of the business for the loans. She can buy all of the necessary products for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: K. Henry is a 33-year-old businessman and a married father of four children. Henry has a fish business, and is using his loan to purchase fish from fishermen to resell in Abaita Ababiri market. He hopes to expand his business in order to generate better profits. His dream is to educate his children and purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase fish from fishermen to resell

loans.name: Victor Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Victor tiene 57 años de edad el es conviviente con su segundo compromiso,  no tiene carga familiar tiene 3 hijastros  ya mayores de edad, ellos viven en la casa de su conviviente  casa de material de adobe en el Distrito de la Tinguiña, el Sr. Victor se dedica como operario de construccion, se dedica a prestar este servcio de albañileria hace 10 años, actualmente viene realizando una obra en  El Distrito de la  Venta. El Sr. Victor tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener una mejor casa para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, con el dinero que solicita invertira en  mejoras del techo de su cocina.
texts.en:
Victor is 57 years old and lives with his second partner. He does not have parental responsibilities. He has three stepchildren who are adults. They live in the same home as his spouse, which is made from adobe in the district of Tinguiña. Victor works as a construction worker. He has been dedicated to providing masonry services for ten years. Currently, he's working on a job in the Venta district. Victor has many dreams and goals, one of which is to be able to have a better house to give a better quality of life to his family. With the money that he is requesting, he will invest in improvements to the roof of his kitchen.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House improvements

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija G. is married and has two children. She lives in Mombasa, in an area known as Mikoroshoni. Khadija runs a grocery store in the area and her business has been in existence for two years. She serves clients from the Mikoroshoni area. Khadija supplements her income by selling home-made juice in the area and has been able to get regular customers for it.

Khadija is taking out her first loan from KADET and plans to buy vegetables and potatoes to add more stock to her greengrocer business. She also intends to do minor renovations on her store.

In the future Khadija hopes to relocate her business to a busier centre, preferably near the central business district of Mombasa.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and potatoes, and also to do renovations on her store.

loans.name: Khvan

texts.en:
Mrs. N. has been operating her own small business from her home for years. She is skilled in weaving palm leaves by hand and has done this since she was a single girl. She turns leaves into furniture and roofing material to sell for a profit. N. was married, but her husband died several years ago. She has two daughters; one is married and lives away from home and the other is single and a vegetable seller. 

N. depends on the income from her daughter, who sells vegetable in the market. Her daughter always needs to hire a taxi to deliver her vegetables to the market because she has no a vehicle. N. is taking out her loan to buy a motorcycle which will be used by her daughter to transport goods to and from her business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is 40 and married and has three children who attend school. He has been running a cafeteria for two years. He also operates a retail shop to earn more income. He was previously employed as a salesman. He renovated his cafeteria with his first loan of KES 20,000 from Faulu Kenya, hence increasing his profits. He wants a loan of KES 50,000 to buy outside catering equipment. He hopes to open other chains of businesses in the country. He describes himself as ambitious, hardworking and focused.

loans.use: Buy outside catering equipment.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian U. is from the village of Tumpagon Cagayan de oro City. She is 28 years old. Vivian is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Vivian owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Vivian has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vivian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Vivian from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Pedro Noel

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Noel D. Díaz es trabajador de  la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como Vigilante en el plantel, es acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos todos a su cargo,  habita en el barrio de Guadalupe.

El señor Pedro Noel D. Díaz lleva cinco años trabajando con CEPRODEL y a pagados sus créditos en tiempo y forma, el señor D. solicito el crédito para reparar las tuberías de su casa ya  que tiene fuga y el recibo del agua le sale por las nubes.
texts.en:
El señor Pedro Noel D. Díaz es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como Vigilante en el plantel, es acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos todos a su cargo, habita en el barrio de Guadalupe. El señor Pedro Noel D. Díaz lleva cinco años trabajando con CEPRODEL y a pagados sus créditos en tiempo y forma, el señor D. solicito el crédito para reparar las tuberías de su casa ya que tiene fuga y el recibo del agua le sale por las nubes.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejoramiento de tuberías pvc, tubo madre, pega, mano de obra.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 45 years old, married, and has five children aged between 12 and 26 years old. Four of her children are currently attending school. She relies on farming to cater for her family's needs. She has been farming for 25 years, selling her eggs, milk, maize and beans to the local market. 
Susan has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to start a poultry project. With the income she earns from this project, she will be able to pay for her children's education. Her biggest challenge is the cost of poultry feed, which is very expensive, and the diseases that often strike and increase her veterinary expenses and reduce her income. In future, she would like to expand her poultry project, especially during the peak seasons, in order to earn more income.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Hermelinda G. esta agradecida por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual pido cambiar todo el cableado de la luz de su casa.
Ahora a su vivienda le esta haciendo falta la reparación del techo ya que esta en muy mal las condiciones y tiene miedo que pueda pasar un accidente. Solicita nuevamente un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de venta de perfumes, bolsas para damas y varios artículos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hermelinda G. is thankful for your cooperation in her previous loan, which she used to replace all the electrical wiring in her house. Now her house is in need of repairs to the roof, which is in very poor condition, and she is fearful that an accident could happen. She´s requesting another loan in order to buy the necessary materials and pay someone to make the improvements to her roof. She plans to repay the loan with the profits she makes from her sales of perfumes, ladies' handbags and other merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repairs

loans.name: Erlinda Aurora

texts.es:
Erlinda tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene una hija de 12 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, un matrimonio de agricultores que radican en el distrito de La Florida un distrito de la sierra norte de nuestro país ubicado en la provincia de San Miguel de la región Cajamarca, a mas de dos horas de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la venta de comida preparada, bebidas gaseosas y licores en su domicilio, ella cuenta con un pequeño restaurante donde atiende los pedidos que le solicitan sus clientes, este negocio le permite solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres al sostenimiento de su hogar. Adicionalmente ella también ayuda a sus padres en labores propias de la agricultura.

Erlinda desea realizar mejoras en la construcción del ambiente en donde atiende a sus clientes: ella desea darle acabado a las paredes y poner piso; de esa manera su negocio tendrá mejor vista y atraerá mas clientes. Para alcanzar su meta ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Erlinda es una mujer que desea salir adelante y ofrecerle a su hija y a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y la consideran una mujer responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Erlinda is 47 years old. She is a single mother and has a 12-year-old daughter. She lives with her parents, an agricultural couple that lives in La Florida district. It is in the northern mountains of our country, located in the San Miguel province of the Cajamarca region. It is more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. She has been selling pre-cooked meals, soda and liquor in her home for more than a year. She has a small restaurant where she takes her customers’ orders. This business allows her to cover her personal expenses and help her parents maintain their home. In addition, she helps her parents with the farm work. Erlinda wants to make improvements to the structure where she waits on her customers. She would like to put a finish on the walls and lay a floor. This way her business would look nicer and attract more customers. She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 PEN to reach her goal. Erlinda is a woman who wants to get ahead and offer her daughter and parents a better quality of life. Her neighbors and acquaintances in the area where she lives hold her in very high esteem and consider her a responsible and hard-working woman.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses for improvements in infrastructure of the food and drink service area.

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal La Nueva Esperanza, está ubicado en el departamento de Huancavelica, inicia su ciclo 3 con 15 socias.

Edita, es casada y tiene 02 hijos de 20 y 18 años. Edita se dedica a proveer madera para fabricar muebles y construcciones. Edita ha podido adquirir mercadería gracias a los prestamos obtenidos y así a podido atender mas pedidos, generándole esto buenos ingresos. Edita quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, por lo cual quiere acceder aun crédito nuevamente, de esta manera hacer de su maderera una de las mas importantes y prosperas.

Mercedes, es casada y tiene 01 hijo de 07 años, quien va a ala escuela. Mercedes fabrica piñatas y adornos para fiestas infantiles, negocio que ha tenido mayor demanda, ya que ha podido tener mayor producción gracias a sus créditos. Mercedes necesita de un nuevo préstamo, para seguir produciendo en mayor cantidad y así alcanzar su primera meta, que es tener su propia piratería.
texts.en:
The La Nueva Esperanza ("The New Hope") community bank is located in the Huancavelica department. It is starting its third cycle with 15 members. Edita is married and has 2 children ages 20 and 18. Edita supplies lumber for making furniture and buildings. Edita has been able to acquire merchandise thanks to the loans she obtained, and this way she has been able to fill more orders, generating a good income. Edita wants to keep investing in her business, so she wants to take out a new loan. This way she will make her wood business one of the most important and prosperous. Mercedes is married and has 1 child, age 7, who goes to school. Mercedes makes pinatas and decorations for children's parties. This business has had much demand, and she has been able to have better production thanks to her loans. Mercedes needs a new loan to keep producing in greater quantities and to meet her first goal, which is to have her own pinata store.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of good quality material and items for their businesses

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en: Mouhamad, 36, is living in southern Lebanon. He is engaged and plans to get married soon. He has been working in agriculture since 1995. He plants all type of fruits and vegetables depending on the season. He plants watermelon, tomatoes, potatoes, lettuce, etc. Also, he has been managing his own olive oil production. Today, Mouhamad has requested his third loan: to prepare his land to be planted with rootstock. He has repaid his previous loans on time. His previous loans allowed him to improve his work and increase his income. His family depends on his income because it is additional revenue for them. For the future, he plans on getting married and wants to be able to provide the best to his future wife. He wants her to be very proud of him and does his best to improve his work in order to do so.

loans.use: To prepare his land to be planted with rootstock

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian G. is currently in the business of selling bags of rice and beans at the store. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize flour, pulses and soya beans to sell. Lilian is 37 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a hotel.

loans.use: To stock bags of maize flour, pulses and soya beans to sell.

loans.name: Din

texts.en: Mr. Din M., 36, is a village man living in Kompong Tom Province. He is a local crop farmer growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on his own farmland. He was married and has three children who live together in the family home. To facilitate the work on the farm, his wife works in the farm fields frequently alongside him. Growing crops is an annual action with which the couple has had great success. They are able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Din M. is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Torm

texts.en:
Torm S., 37, is married and lives with her four children in Kampong Chnang province. She works in a grocery store, making approximately US$ 4 each day, and her husband is a garment worker in Malaysia. Her family is also supported by her husband’s US$ 100 income each month, along with the income of one child who works in garment factory in Korea. 

Torm S. is asking for a loan of US$ 800 to expand her grocery inventory. She believes that this purchase will allow her to increase her income and be able to better support her large family.

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia D. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 46 years old. Virginia is single. Virginia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 14,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Nabugabo Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
B. Sylvia, who belongs to Nabugabo development group in Lugazi, is a 29-year-old business woman who excitedly takes pride in doing her work resolutely and diligently. She says she takes exception to laziness and it is on the strength of that that she has been able to make profitable use of her time overseeing her poultry sales business in Lugazi. 

Sylvia began this business out of her own initiative and ever since then she has been living within the ways and means of this lucrative business. Women owning businesses like these in Uganda are a sign of the times and many are doing well. Things like hard work and determination have become rooted habits for many women and Sylvia is no exception. 

She was previously running a little restaurant but now this is her main business. In a month Sylvia makes profits that add up to 280,000 shillings. She also sells fuel to eke out additional profit. She wants to use the proceeds from this loan to pay for the completion costs on  her house.

loans.use: The completion costs on her house

loans.name: Johnelyn

texts.en:
Johnelyn D., from the village of Bolinao, is 31 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Johnelyn owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over eight years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Johnelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 9000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase new items to expand product offering, she is requesting her fifth loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Johnelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen V., 61, is a widow who lives with her sister and one child in Prey Veng province. She works in construction and typically makes about US $5 every day. Her sister is a farmer who works for less than US $1 of profit per day.

Yen V.’s son is a construction worker building houses. He earns US $5 per day like his mother. Yen V. would like to take out a loan of US $1,000 to purchase construction tools for her son.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim L. is a 57-year-old farmer who has been living in the province of Kompong Tom. Mrs. Yim L. is married to Mr. Keo Korn, age 66. This couple has been cultivating crops on their farmland for over ten years. Mrs. Yim L. and her husband always work together in the farm field. They are blessed with four kids; one is married and living in their own house, and three are single. 

All the main income in Mrs. Yim L.’s family is earned by her two daughters who work in a factory. Mrs. Yim L. said that her daughters go to work by hiring a taxi and walking sometimes. So Mrs. Yim L. would like to request a loan for her children to purchase a used motorbike for driving to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike for her daughters to drive to work

loans.name: Virgenia

texts.en:
Virgenia S. is 43 years old and married. She supports her family by operating two businesses: a carinderia (eatery) and a general store. She lives in Purok Moises, Barangay Camangcamang, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF -- Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her carinderia and general store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8000.

Virgenia is now borrowing PHP 19,000 so that she can continue to fund her food production operations. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF -- Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within the repayment term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Virgenia aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon -- a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operation of food products

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es: Deysi, de 38 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Víctor de 40 años y de su pequeña hija. Esta emprendedora mujer se dedica desde hace 1 año a la preparación y venta de menús (comida ofrecida en taper). Desde muy temprano se despierta para cocinar los 50 platillos que debe ofrecer a sus clientes,  durante 6 días a la semana, luego al mediodía, y con la ayuda de su hermana se dirige al mercado de su zona, donde debe dejar todos los menús a sus comensales, quienes la esperan ansiosos por su deliciosa sazón. Lo que no le gusta de la labor es que cobra semanalmente, en una fecha indicada, pero esto a la vez le permite ganar un buen dinero seguro. Además como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar un restaurante en sociedad con su hermana, pero sabe que logrará concretar con sus propósitos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Deysi tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor (arroz, aceite, verduras y azúcar) pues quiere continuar ofreciéndoles lo mejor a sus comensales.
texts.en:
Deysi is 38 years old.  She lives in her own home together with her husband, 40 year-old Víctor, and her young daughter.  This enterprising woman has been in business for one year, making and selling meals (lunchboxes).  She gets up very early in the morning to cook the 50 dishes that she will offer her customers.  She does this six days a week.  Then, at midday, with the help of her sister, she goes to the local market where she leaves the meals with her customers who wait anxiously for her delicious food.  What she doesn't like about her work is that she collects her payment weekly, on a set date.  However, it does allow her to make a good, reliable income.

As Deysi is an enterprising woman, in the future she is planning to set up a restaurant together with her sister.  She knows that she will achieve her goals with a lot of hard work and determination.

This is Deysi's third loan with MFP and she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner because she doesn't want to make a bad impression on the people who have made her loan possible.  It will allow her to continue working in search of progress.  Deysi is planning to invest her loan in buying ingredients (rice, oil, vegetables and sugar) wholesale as she wants to continue offering her customers the best.

loans.use: To buy basic products such as rice, oil, vegetables and sugar wholesale so that she can continue preparing her meals

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
Adolat K. is married and has three children. She sells all kinds of food in her own grocery store. The store is located in a good area and she has many customers. Adolat has operated this business for three years. She always offers fresh products and her customers know the value of this. Adolat is honest, entrepreneurial, and hard working. She makes every effort to make her business an attractive place for her customers. Adolat is requesting a loan of $1,200 to diversify her store's stock. She hopes to use the additional income to improve her business conditions.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Rafah city in Gaza strip, married and a father of Shahd, five years old, Hani, three years old and Tamner, one year old.

Muhammd took a loan from FATEN to purchase home appliances he needs for his family, such as a fridge and other necessary items.

Muhammad, who appears in the picture here, is a Palestinian National Authority employee.

loans.use: To purchase home appliances

loans.name: Yahaira Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Yahaira D. R., es trabajadora en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, desde hace 9 años, desempeñando el cargo de responsable de Cartera Y Cobro Este es el tercer crédito que  trabaja con CEPRODEL los cuales ha pagado en tiempo y forma y los utiliza para gasto de vivienda, este lo quiere para gastos personales.
texts.en: Yahaira Davila Rodriguez is an employee of the wholesale market in Managua. For the past 9 years she has been in charge of the Treasury and Accounts Receivable. This is her third loan through Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner), and all the previous loans have been paid on time. She has used them to improve her home and for personal expenses.

loans.use: Personal expenses.

loans.name: Chynybek

texts.en:
Chynybek A. is a 53-year-old villager, who supports his family by means of cattle breeding. He works in the local administration and is known as a very responsible person. Unfortunately, salaries in rural areas are low and people need to find an additional means of subsistence. For this reason, Chynybek’s family decided to engage in cattle breeding.
As Chynybek was born into a farmer’s family and had wide experience in animal breeding, his start in this activity was successful. He used his initial capital of only 2,000 KGS to buy cattle and managed to increase the number. Also, Chynybek began to cultivate barley and perennial herbs, which serve as concentration of forage for his cattle. With the revenues from his business, Chynybek gave a good education to his children which allowed them to successfully manage their lives.
