Now Chynybek plans to use this loan of 25,000 KGS to buy one heifer. He wants to use the revenue from this loan to enlarge the number of his cattle. In future, he dreams of buying a car.

About Bai-Tushum and Partners
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase a heifer

loans.name: Por's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nineteen members. They are located in Kbal Kaoh village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Por C. was born in 1963 and is the village bank leader. She was selected to be the village bank leader by the other members. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows rice for a living. In order to support this farming, she would like a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline for growing rice. Aside from farming, she is also has a job where she is able to earn a small salary to help support her famiL.. 

Mrs. Por C. is a widow with four children.  One is a tailor, one is a laborer, one is attending a local school, and the last one is 6 years old and not in school yet.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and gasoline for growing rice.

loans.name: Parsoloi

texts.en:
Parsoloi O. T. is 34 years old. He is married to Nalutuesha and a father of four children. Parsoloi is a farmer and has been farming for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for land farming.


He learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he plans to use to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting and also to hire manpower during preparation of the farm. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children.


His hope and dream is to buy and build rental premises. Parsoloi is an energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for planting

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Madame Salimata Sangaré est une veuve de 43 ans et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit avec ses enfants dans la concession de son défunt époux dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
C’est suite au décès de son époux ,  qu’elle décide de mener des activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des pagnes afin de subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de sa sœur. Avec une expérience de 6 ans, elle maitrise son activité. 
Pour obtenir un fonds de roulement consistant, elle décide de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des pagnes. Elle est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée de femmes. La vente se fait dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni, généralement en ambulant et à crédit payable journalièrement, hebdomadairement ou mensuellement.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000FCFA. Elle envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salimata Sangaré is a 43 year old window, and the mother of 4 children. She lives with her children in her late husband's house in the Torakabougou neighborhood of Bougouni.

It was after her husband's death that she decided to take up income-producing activities, in particular, buying and selling "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) in order to meet her needs and those of the children.  She learnt the business from her sister. With 6 years of experience, she knows the business well. 

To have a steady amount of working capital, she decided to take a loan with Soro Yiriwaso to buy "pagnes." This is her first experience with Soro Yiriwaso. She obtains her supplies in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali). Her customers are women. Mrs. Sangaré sells her merchandise in different areas of Bougouni, usually on foot and on credit payable by the day, the week or month. She expects to make a monthly profit of 75,000 CFA francs, and plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes' (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is a married man with a 7 year-old child. He is engaged in farming and primarily grows rice crops. Efren sells his harvest to the people in his community. He owns cows that help him in tilling his land. Efren works hard to build his business. He wants to be able to provide all his family's needs.

Efren requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

In the future, Efren hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana se dedica a la venta de casas; su esposo es chofer interdepartamental. Con el dinero del préstamo hará la refacción de habitaciones un par de habitaciones pues vive en casa propia, ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de La Paz; es casada y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana sells real estate and her husband is an interdepartmental driver. They have two children. She plans to use the loan to renovate two rooms in her home which is located in the Tembladerani area of La Paz.  

This is her first loan through IMPRO.

loans.use: To renovate two rooms in order to live more comfortably

loans.name: Miriam Yaqueline

texts.es:
Miriam de 23 años, es una joven emprendedora que hizo el préstamo para poder adecuar su casa.

Ella labora en una Industria Pesquera llamada Santa Priscila donde ella verifica los productos si estan en mal estado o no.Con  la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales do construcción para poder terminar su casa y tener una vida sana con su familia.
texts.en: Miriam, 23, is a young entrepreneur who took out the loan to do some home improvements. She works for a Fishing Firm called Santa Priscila in quality control; she verifies whether or not the products are in good condition.  With help from the loan she will buy building materials and supplies to finish building her house to have a healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Caro

texts.en:
Caro is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
	
For the past three years, Caro has operated a cosmetic shop and a beauty salon business. Her customers are neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing another beauty salon in the future. 

Caro decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.  With her KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase hair food oil, relaxer and hair treatments.

loans.use: to purchase hair food oil, relaxer and hair treatments.

loans.name: Alice Murugi

texts.en:
Married to Joseph, who contributes to the family income, Alice Murugi is a 39-year-old mother of three children aged 15, 13, and 6 years of age. A retailer of clothes and shoes for the past three years, she earns a monthly income of KES.4,000. This will be her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member, and she will use it to purchase more stocks of shoes and clothes for her shop.

Her hope is to educate her children to a high level and provide them with a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of shoes and clothes for her shop.

loans.name: Aulagia

texts.en:
Aulagia is 41 years of age. She is married with two children. Aulagia owns and operates a business catching and selling ocean fish. She has many years of experience in this business. Aulagia needs a loan of $1,000 Samoan tala (WST) to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be $220 tala, or $92 USD, per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Aulagia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Aulagia's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en:
Lowela is married with 3 children.  She is 30 years old and lives in Clarin.

Lowela sells a variety of products in her general store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000.  She has requested a loan for 20,000 to purchase a larger variety of products. Lowela has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase a larger variety of products

loans.name: Precilda

texts.en:
Precilda says that "through patience and determination, life becomes easier." She is a positive thinker and has a strong faith in God.

Precilda is 53 years old and is married with 4 adult children. She has had a food selling business for 5 years and earns about Php 4,000 monthly.

Precilda sells different kinds of fruits and vegetables to locals. 
Precilda is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 to buy more banana, squash, eggplant, tomato and cabbage to sell.

In the future, Precilda is looking ahead and hopes that she can expand her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more banana, squash, eggplant, tomato and cabbage to sell

loans.name: Fils

texts.fr: Fils est un commerçant agriculteur, il est marié, il  a   25 ans et il a 1 enfant de 2 ans.il est ne au Rwanda .Il  a deux ans des études secondaires. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter un champ pour l'agriculture. Il  n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’augmenter les champs. Pour ses ambition il voudrait devenir le grand agriculteur en même temps un grand commerçant des semences dans son province, et il voudrait construire sa propre maison a usage résidentiel et payer le frais des études pour ses enfants .Il est aussi le chauffeur de taxi moto.
texts.en:
Fils is a farmer-merchant who is 25 years old and married. He has a 2-year-old child. He was born in Rwanda and has two years of secondary school education. This loan cycle is his third one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy a field for growing crops. No difficulties are expected at all with regarding to repaying this loan. 

His strategy for business growth is to expand his fields. As his ambitions, he would like to become a major grower and a major merchant of seeds at the same time in his province. And he would like to build his own residential house and to cover the cost of his children's schooling. He is also a motorbike taxi driver.

loans.use: to use his loan to buy a farm field

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 31, is a single, patient, hardworking, and focused business lady. For the last four years, she has been operating an M-pesa service (mobile phone money transfer business) to make a living. She wants in the next five years to have opened up other outlets in other places in the country. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop dealing with mobile phones. She is requesting 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy phone accessories and float money. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has now become financially literate.

loans.use: To buy phone accesories

loans.name: Suma Pancara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA PANCARA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Elena. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de lana de alpaca, venta de fruta, venta de pan, venta de peluches, costura de deportivos, costura de pantalones.

La señora Elena,  indica que esta es la primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de hilado de vicuña, que viene trabajando hace cuatro años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana de vicuña), que comprara de la 16 de julio y posteriormente  elaborado su producto lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el credito.
texts.en:
The SUMA PANCARA community bank is starting on its first round of funding from Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Cascada.  The group has eight members and is managed by a board lead by Sra. Elena.  The members operate businesses such as: alpaca wool sales, fruit sales, bread sales, toy sales and sewing services.  

Sra. Elena, who says this is the first time that she has worked with Pro Mujer, was invited to join the group.  She has operated a business selling vicuna thread for four years.
 
Sra. Elena will use this loan to increase her working capital (for buying vicuna wool).  She will buy the wool in 16 de Julio, turn it into thread and sell it at local markets.  The business generates an income that helps to support her family.  She is married and has two children.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the loans.

loans.use: to buy wool for her crafts business.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 39 years old and lives in the town of Pakwach in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has four children. One of his children is currently in school. Geoffrey has a small retail shop, which he has had for 10 years. He does farming as his second business. 

To help expand his business, Geoffrey has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like soap and salt for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Geoffrey hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. In the future, Geoffrey hopes to expand his business. Geoffrey is a member of BRAC's small enterprise program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like soap and salt for resale.

loans.name: Kriss Gin

texts.es:
Kriss nació en la provincia del Cusco, tiene 29 años de edad y es soltero.  

Actualmente, Kriss vive en la misma provincia donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, él es nutricionista y trabaja en la DIRESA (Dirección Regional de Salud), él trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde de lunes a viernes, él también tiene un pequeño negocio de preparación de comidas típicas de la región. En esta oportunidad Kriss requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, carne y verduras.

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Kriss was born in Cusco province.  He is 29 years old and single.  He lives in the same province in which he was born and this is where he carries out his business.  He is a nutritionist and works for DIRESA (Regional Health Authority).  He works from 7.00am to 3.00pm, from Monday to Friday.  He also has a small business making typical regional dishes.  On this occasion, Kriss needs a loan to buy supplies such as rice, meat and vegetables.

The 'Salud' community bank meet once a month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is well known as being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es: Cipriana tiene 37 años, esta casada con Teodoro de 37 años, con quien tiene 04 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva Fortaleza, Pichari. Ella desde muy joven se dedicaba a trabajar en el cultivo y cosecha de cacao, aunque no eran producciones propias, pero siempre anhelaba tenerlo. Y con el pequeño sueldo que percibía logró ahorrarlo, hoy cultiva y comercializa sus propios productos, como el café y el cacao. Reconoce que si no fuera por todos estos años de trabajo y de enseñanza que le proporcionaron su familia, nunca hibiera logrado lo que hasta ahora tiene. El tener productos de calidad, es una muestra de lo mucho que aprendió y sus compradores más potenciales se sienten satisfechos. En ocasiones sus hijos la apoyan, pero cuando es temporada de cosecha, debe contratar jornaleros para que se encarguen de éste arduo trabajo. Este será su Primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará fertilizantes para fertilizar su campo agrícola.
texts.en:
Cipriana is 37 years old and married to 37-year-old Teodoro.  The couple have four children and live together in their own home, which is located in Nueva Fortaleza community, in Pichari.

Cipriana has been growing and harvesting cacao since she was very young even though, back then, she wasn't growing her own crops.  However, she always longed to have her own.  With the small salary that she earned, she managed to save up and now she grows and sells her own produce such as coffee and cacao.  She acknowledges that if it weren't for all the years of work and education that her family gave her, she would never have managed to achieve what she has up to now.  Having top-quality produce is a sign of how much she learned and her buyers are satisfied.  Sometimes her children support her in her work but, at harvest time, she must hire laborers to take care of this hard work.  

This will be Cipriana's first loan from MFP and she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  She will use her 1,000 soles to buy fertilizers so that she can fertilize her farmland.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Nimambo

texts.en:
Nimambo is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has owned real estate houses as a business for the past 10 years; her potential clients are tenants. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by tenants. She dreams of establishing more rental houses in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase building materials to renovate her house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and uplift her life.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Benard Okoth

texts.en:
Benard is a 31-year-old married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 6 years. He describes himself to be God-fearing and humble. He operates a motorcycle transport service business where he provides transport services to the local people in Kisumu. He has been involved in this business for 4 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located in a semi-urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity and accidents. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to repair his motorcycle and purchase another secondhand motorcycle. His business goal is to expand his motorcycle transport business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle and purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is married with two kids and they lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.
Imelda sells different kinds of RTW (ready-to-wear) clothes in their barangay (village) for their daily livelihood and has had this business for over 3 years. Each month, she earns Php 5,000 doing this type of work which is enough to provide for the most important needs of her family. She has requested a loan in the amount of Php 10,000 to purchase additional clothes to sell. 
Imelda has been a member of GDMPC for more than one year. Imelda wishes that her small business will grow and become stable in their barangay.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Leticia Maria

texts.es:
Leticia de 40 años, una mujer trabajadora que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento de su negocio.
Su actividad de venta de cosméticos la inicio hace 5 años.
Trabaja sola, tiene un hijo de 15 años, estudia en escuela pública.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el incremento de su negocio, y para la compra de mercadería como: perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, etc.
Su sueño es terminar su vivienda y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en: Leticia is 40 years old. She is a hardworking woman who has aspirations of growing her business. She has been selling cosmetics for the last 5 years. She works alone. She has a 15 year old child who attends public school. She is asking for the loan to grow her business and to buy merchandise such as: perfumes, creams, deoderants, etc. Her dream is to finish building her house and that her business continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as perfumes, creams, deoderants, etc.

loans.name: Khanim

texts.en: Khanim is from Lankaran. She is 58 years old and married with one adult child.  Khanim has been involved in animal husbandry for over 3 years.  She and her husband breed livestock at home. They know very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. This business is the only source of income for the family.  They earn a monthly income of about 230 AZN.  Khanim wants to enlarge the stock by purchasing more cattle. For this purpose, she requested 1200 AZN that he will spend for the purchase of young cattle and for their feed.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle and feed.

loans.name: Salima's Group

texts.en:
Salima is married and has eight children. All of them are studying in a local school. It is very difficult for Salima and her husband to afford their living and educational expenses, which is why both Salima and her husband work.

Salima's husband is a mason, and Salima makes and sells decoration pieces. She receives orders from different gift shops in the market and completes their orders to earn income. She has a lot of passion for her work and she creates different designs and uses her skills very well in her work. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her business. With the loan investment, she will buy decoration  material like glitter, paint and brushes to make beautiful looking decoration pieces and also buys the decorations items likes (Vase, artificial flowers) etc. 

She is hopeful that she will be able to make beautiful looking decorative pieces and buy the decoration items in bulk that will be sold for higher profits. She is very experienced in her work and has been operating it for many years.

Note: In the group, one of the members has a clothing selling business, which is why they are holding clothes in the photo.

loans.use: to buy decoration material and decoration items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beds and drugs for the clinic.

loans.name: Virgen De Los Dolores Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Virgen del Dolores” empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya desde este año mediante la promoción de una de las asesoras en el barrio. En total son 10 mujeres, quienes trabajan de forma unida y siempre dentro de un marco de respeto y ayuda mutua.
Una de las miembros es la señora Adalbina, quien nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de bebidas, en lo cual dice que le va muy bien. Ella cuenta que tiene muchos clientes, lo cual la ayuda a poder tener buenos ingresos y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia. Una de sus metas es poder crecer y seguir agrandando su local.Adalbina 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas, vinos, licores y demás tipos de bebidas, con lo cual puede abastecerse y tener siempre productos para sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Virgen del Dolores” women’s committee started working with Fundación Paraguaya this year thanks to a promotion conducted by one of its promoters in the neighborhood.  There are 10 women in total who work together within a framework of respect and mutual help.

One of the members is Adalbina who tells us that she sells all types of beverages and says that she does quite well.  She relates that she has many customers which helps her earn good income and help her family.  One of her goals is to continue enlarging her locale.

She is asking for the loan to buy beer, wine, liquor and other types of beverages to stock up and always have products available for her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 68 years old and lives in Biasong, lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. 
Fely has a clay pottery business and earns approximately PHP 5,000.00 each month. She has a requested a loan of 20,000 to purchase materials for her pottery business. 
Fely has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. Fely hopes to save more for the future use of her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her pottery business

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: 13-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Thảo is 41 years old and is single with one dependent child. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Thảo has had a retail business selling clothes for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thảo is the group leader of the 13-Nam Ngạn solidarity group which consists of four members. 

In 2010, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and, since then, she has successfully repaid six loans. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more clothing to resell.

With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to resell

loans.name: Grace De Dieu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GRACE DE DIEU est composé de trois  personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Jacqueline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Jacqueline est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Jacqueline est mariée à un transitaire du nom de Clément. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Jacqueline vend depuis huit ans de la nourriture(pâte accompagnée de sauce). Jacqueline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Jacqueline  ensemble avec les membres du groupe GRACE DE DIEU, sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments, du maïs et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es: Martha con su primer financiamiento dio un excelente mantenimiento a sus cultivos de con lo cual logro cosechar una buena cantidad de grano, logrando obtener muy buenas ganancias al momento de la venta, salir de su compromiso de pago y tener la tranquilidad que necesitaba para salir adelante. Con su segundo crédito, compro los insumos agrícolas nuevamente que ayudaron a dar protección y asistencia a sus cultivos de café y sus cultivos de hortalizas teniendo éxito al momento de la venta y nuevamente muy agradecida con COMIXMUL en alianza con los diferentes inversionistas en KIVA por el apoyo brindado. En esta tercera ocasión ella nuevamente solicita un tercer crédito para compra de insumos agrícolas y dar la asistencia adecuada a sus cultivos de maíz los cuales están en el punto exacto de poder asistir para evitar que este se dañe y pueda perderse por alguna plaga esperando nuevamente ser apoyada para salir adelante y seguir con sus planes de superarse en la vida y ser una mujer exitosa y triunfadora.

loans.use: Para compra de insumos agrícolas y dar asistencia y cuidado a sus cultivos de maíz

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer is 27 years old and married with two children.

She is in agricultural business, raising chicken in the Philippines. Jenefer is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Jenefer has been in this business for 2 years and also earns additional income from manicure and pedicure service.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chickens

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
My name is Judith A.. I sell grilled and fried chicken with marinated vegetables and french fries. I have had my business for about 5 years. My clients prefer us because the food has a unbeatable taste and we are located in front of several private companies and government offices. My business produces income to feed my family. My goal is to hire more people for the preparation of the food and for customer service. With the profit I earn I will be able to improve my business to give better customer service and I will be able to afford private schooling to my three children.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Judith A. me dedico a la venta de pollo asado, frito con encurtido de vegetales y papas fritas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 5 años, mis clientes nos prefieren porque la comida tiene un sabor inigualable y estamos ubicados en frente de varias empresas privadas y gubernamentales, mi negocio me genera ingresos para alimentar mi familia, mi meta es contratar mas gente para la elaboracion de la comida y la atencion de los clientes y con las ganancias que obtenga poder acondiconar mejor mi pollera para tener una mejor atencio a mis clientes y darle un estudio privado a mis tres hijos.

loans.use: To buy poultry, salt, spices, coal, wood, matches, sodas, onions, tortillas, vinegar, chili, bread, juices, oil, dishes, glasses, napkins, potatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business.

loans.name: Urbano

texts.en:
Urbano Busto G. bought his one-room home more than 5 years ago. With work, he added 2 rooms since he has 3 teenagers. Due to the cost of education for his children, he has not been able to finish the rooms. He is asking for a $600.00 loan so that he can lay concrete slabs in the rooms to have more space for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Urbano Busto G. a se mas de 5 años que adquirió su vivienda que solo era de un cuarto, el cual con su trabajo le a construido 2 cuartos mas ya que tiene 3 hijos adolescentes. Por gastos de estudios de sus hijo no a podido terminar los cuartos es el motivo por el cual esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 600.00 dlls para colocar la losa en los cuartos y así tener mas espacio para su familia.

loans.use: Concrete slab in two rooms

loans.name: Venancio

texts.en:
Venancio Figuerdo, 40, is married and father of a three year old son. He and his wife specialize in weaving sobrecamas, throws, and typical Paraguayan table runners. Sobrecamas are equivalent to bedspreads made with craft thread that is very typical in Carapegua.

Venancio and his wife travel to other cities, such as Asuncion, to sell their merchandise. He started his business over 20 years ago and has been very successful in keeping his business running. Venancio works from home and watches over his son too. He spends his free time fixing his truck.

He is very grateful for being able to obtain a previous loan which gave him more capital to work with. Venancio needs a loan to buy more material, such as craft thread, to complete more sobrecamas and other products.

loans.use: Purchase craft thread.

loans.name: Rooslana

texts.en:
Rooslana is divorced with one child. She lives in Mukachevo and sells clothing and footwear in the market next to the local bus station. Rooslana started this business because she had to find ways to provide for her family. She has been in business now for 5 years. Currently, her monthly income is about $1200. The success of her business can be attributed to her integrity and outstanding managerial skills.

Rooslana would like to get a loan of $1200 to increase the assortment of inventory in her kiosk. She believes that more merchandise will help her meet the demand of her customers. We think that her desire to persist with her venture and promote its expansion will ensure prompt repayment of this current loan.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Bernardete

texts.pt:
Bernadete is a single mom. She lives with her son in her parents’ house. Bernadete’s parents are country people. They live from working on their small farm. Bernadete entered the loan program this year to save money and get her life in order. She wants to build a home for herself and her son and ensure his schooling. If the business does well, she plans to later sell clothing as well.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Bernardete e mae solteira. Ela vive com o seu filho na casa de seus pais. Os pais de Bernardete sao camponeses. Vivem do trabalha da pequena machamba. Bernardete entrou para o programa de credito neste ano para poder juntar dinheiro para organizar sua vida. A saber construir sua propria residencia onde quer viver com o seu filho, assegurar os estudos do filho. Se o negocio correr bem ela pensa mais tarde passar a vender tambem roupa.

loans.use: Bernadete would like to use the money to buy more products for her store

loans.name: Amir Din

texts.en:
Amir Din is married and lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan with his family. Amir is uneducated but he is a well-established farmer who has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Amir is happy from his work but would like to expand his business. Thus, he wants to take an individual loan to complete his necessary materials to cultivate all his land, therefore, making good income for his family. He extends his gratitude to AFSG.

loans.use: To complete his necessary raw materials

loans.name: Frola

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39 year-old Frola M.. She is married with three children, aged 9, 12, and 15. In 2000 Frola established a business selling household items and utensils, and now requires a loan of $150 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Frola would like to purchase additional stock of household items.

loans.name: Mamazoid

texts.en:
I. Mamazoid is 40 years old. He is married with four children.

Mamazoid is a cattleman. He has been in this business for eight years. Currently he has two cows, one of which is a milk cow, and two heads of small cattle. Mamazoid also sells combustive lubricating materials. As a rule, he purchases from 600 up to 1000 liters of fuel and sells it during a period of one to two months. His wife and elder son help Mamazoid in his work. These two types of activities compose the main source of income for the family. 

Mamazoid plans to purchase two more cows for raising and selling. For this purpose he requests 1000.00 US dollars for the term of 10 months. Mamazoid thanks all for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase two cows for raising and further sales.

loans.name: Elida Cristina

texts.es:
For the last 4 years, Elida has been a partner of “Banco Comunal Atinchik” which means “We are able to” in Quechua. In her “Banco Comunal” she has learned to save money, be punctual and responsible. Elida is single, 27 years old, she is studying social service at the university. Elida sells cosmetics from catalogues, such as Esika, Unique, and Natura, she offers her products to friends and family. She also sells clothes and school and office supplies depending on campaigns and demand. She buys her products in Lima. With the loan from “Banco Comunal” she will buy supplies and uniforms which she will sell in the district of Tambo.

Elida needs a loan of 2000 soles ($700) to buy notebooks, pencils, paper, and uniforms. Her savings will be spent on building her house and for her academic qualifications. It is Elida’s dream to own a wholesale general store, to make business grow, and to study another degree.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Elida es socia del Banco Comunal Atinchik que significa “Podemos” en Quechua, hace 4 años. En su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar, ser puntual y responsable. Elida es soltera y tiene 27 años, estudiante de trabajo social en la universidad, Elida vende cosméticos por catálogos como Esika, Unique, Natura, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares. Además Elida vende ropa, útiles dependiendo de las campañas y demanda, sus productos lo trae de Lima. Elida con el préstamo que obtendrá de su Banco Comunal tiene proyectado traer útiles, uniformes y lo venderá en el distrito de Tambo.

Elida necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuadernos, lapiceros, papeles y uniformes. Sus ahorros los utilizará en la construcción de su casa y para su titulación. Los sueños de Elida son tener una tienda de abarrotes por mayor, que sus negocios prosperen y estudiar otra carrera más.

loans.use: Purchase notebooks, pencils, paper, and uniforms to increase sales.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina O. lives in Ilogbo, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a married woman with 8 children and she sells textbooks and greeting cards. Sabina acquired this skill in 1 month and has been in her business since 1988. At 46 years of age, she wants to diversify her business to sell office accessories, like staplers and perferators, in addition to her textbooks and greeting cards. She needs a loan of $600 to enable her to buy more textbooks and office accessories to see.  She says "thank you."

loans.use: To buy more books and office accessories.

loans.name: Mohammad Rahim

texts.en: Until recently, Mohammad Rahim had lived all of his life in Iran. He is married, and he is the father of two boys. Over the years, he has worked for many construction companies. However, when he came to Kabul, he opened his own constriction company, and he has 5 employees (including himself) working at the company. Currently, he needs money to expand his business, so he is seeking a loan to enter into a lease. More generally, he plans on working extremely hard to allow his family to experience a better life in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand his business and to complete the purchase of a lease

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To capitalize on high demand for her soup by expanding her business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena L., 55, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to relatives and the village community and also friends 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).

SPBD loans are Elena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will assist her in operating her business. Her husband helps out with maintaining her business.

loans.use: purchasing equipment such as shovel, bushknife, weedkiller machine, spade, chemicals

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is 26 years old and married with two children -- one 4 years old and the other 3 months old. She became a soup seller in 2005 and works every day from 12:00 to 5:00 p.m. at her business. She can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

Zawadi now hopes for a loan to buy more meat for her soup business.

loans.use: To buy meat for her soup business.

loans.name: After You Na Me Group

texts.en:
This group is called After You Na Me. Its members include Marie C., Kadiatu K., Sallamatu Koroma, Mabinty K. and Kadiatu Koroma. (the latter is not pictured) They are requesting a loan of Le 3,200,000.00 to help them enhance their businesses.

This will be their 3rd loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans made a lot of improvements in the lives of these entrepreneurs. Their businesses expanded a bit further, and at the same time they were able to solve most of their numerous problems with the proceeds, and then repay their loans successfully.

Their leader is Kadiatu K.. Kadiatu is 35 years of age. She was born in Magburaka, is married to a businessman, and they have 2 children. Both of her children are in secondary school. She and her husband are responsible for their school fees and other charges.

Marie has sold peppers, onions, tomatoes, salt etc. at the Magburaka town market for the past 15 years now. Marie used her previous loans to buy gallons of palm-oil which she stored until the price for palm-oil increased. She also gave her husband part of the loan to start his own business. With this new loan, Marie will invest in rice and ground-nuts.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Faapopo

texts.en: Faapopo A., 68, is married with 6 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the ice cake and farming business. She sells to the village 5 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  Faapopo would like a loan to purchase sugar, cordial, plastic cups, cement, timber, nails, taro tubers, barbed wire, bush knives and fertilizer.   Part of her loan will be used to repair her house. Her husband helps to operate the business.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Faapopo's only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cordial, plastic cups, cement, timber, nails, taro tubers, barbed wire, bush knives and fertilizer

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, principalmente cultiva papa y maíz, para que después de 6 meses pueda obtener las ganancias, la ventaja es que en sus tierras de cultivo existe canales de regadío todo el año, lo cual le permite reducir al máximo el riesgo a fracasar, por lo cual Sonia sigue  persistiendo en esta actividad, pero sabe que la dificultad mayor es sostenerse económicamente mientras se espera 6 meses a la cosecha,  por lo cual  optó por invertir en un negocio de farmacia, administrado por uno de sus familiares en la ciudad de Lima, así puede afrontar la economía junto a su esposo, que también ha optado por trabajar por su cuenta, mientras esperan la cosecha. Lo que motiva a Sonia a trabajar es ofrecer lo mejor a sus hijos. En esta oportunidad solicita este préstamo para su campaña de siembra, invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono, alquilará toros para el arado y parte de ello será también para seguir invirtiendo en la farmacia.
texts.en:
Sonia is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. Since childhood, she has made a living in agricultural work, mostly in potatoes and corn, which take about 6 months to harvest and receive profits. The advantage is that her farm land is irrigated through canals throughout the year, which reduces the risk of crop failure. Sonia continues in this activity, but knows that the major difficulty is to remain financially stable during the 6 months before harvesting. Consequently, she has chosen to invest in her pharmacy run by one of her relatives in Lima. In this way, she can face the economy together with her husband, who has also decided to work while they wait to harvest the crops. Sonia's motivation to work is to offer the best to her children. This loan opportunity will be invested in to purchase fertilizer, rent bulls for plowing, and continue investing in their pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and rent bulls for plowing the land.

loans.name: Esso-Elonoyou

texts.fr:
Madame SALLE Esso-Elonyou est née le 31 aout 1972 à Kaza-Boua, une ville située au nord du Togo.  Elle est célibataire et mère de deux (2) enfants.  Elle a pour activité la vente des céréales dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2000, donc elle a huit ans d’expérience et elle connait bien ce commerce. 
Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 3 sacs de mais, 7 sacs de haricot, et 2 sacs de sorgho. Avec ce nouveau stock elle pourra mieux vendre et réaliser beaucoup de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Ms. Esso-Elonyou SALLE was born on August 31, 1972 in Kaza-Boua, a city located in the north of Togo. She is unmarried and the mother of two children. Her work involves selling grains in the Agoè district on the north side of Lomé. She started this commerce in 2000, so she has eight years of experience. She knows this business well. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy 3 sacks of corn, 7 sacks of beans, and 2 sacks of sorghum. With this new stock, she'll be able to do well in her sales and to realize a lot of profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell grain

loans.name: Francisco Daniel

texts.pt:
Francisco Daniel M. é natural de Maputo, tem 50 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 16 filhos, destes apenas vive com uma filha, um sobrinho e uma neta os demais já são maiores de idade e tem suas casas.

Francisco estudou até 9ªclasse e parou quando ingressou nas forças armadas de libertação nacional, foi formado na URSS, Na especialidade de Foguetes antiaérea e em 1997 foi desmobilizado. Logo depois da sua desmobilização iniciou a criação de frangos, negocio que durou apenas três anos por que ficou gravemente doente. Em 2005 começou o negocio de venda de carne, qual desenvolve até a data hoje. Compra a carne por 80,00mt o quilograma e vende por 100,00mt. Desta maneira consegue um rendimento líquido de 2000,00mt semanalmente.

Para Francisco este é seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque, tem sonhos para próximos empréstimo a compra de viatura para lhe ajudar no transporte de mercadoria.
texts.en:
A 50-year-old Maputo native, Francisco Daniel M. is married and had 16 children, although only one daughter lives with him along with a nephew and a granddaughter -- all the other are adults and have their own homes. Francisco went to school until the 9th grade when he joined the national liberation armed forces. He graduated as an anti-aircraft rocket specialist in the USSR and was dismissed in 1997. Right after his dismissal, he started a poultry business that only lasted until he fell gravely ill three years later. In 2005, he began a beef cattle business and he is still involved in this activity to this date. He purchases beef for 80,00mt per kilo and sells it for 100,00mt, which allows him to net 2000,00mt in income per week. This will be his first loan through Hluvuku and Kiva and he plans on investing it to increase stock. His dream is to be able to receive another loan that will fund the purchase of a vehicle that will help him transport his merchandise.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beef cattle purchase and sales

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita D. is 50 years old and married to Leorifo, a farmer in their village. They have two children: Leonita, 32 years old, a college graduate working as a teacher, and Leorifo Jr., 30 years old, an agriculture graduate involved in the farming business like his father. Their family lives in the rural area of Yeban Sur in Benito Soliven, Isabela. 

Anita is glad that she was able to achieve one of her ambitions, providing her children with their education. Now, she is focusing on her sari-sari store business (a community based store) which became her partner in supporting the immediate needs of their family, emergency needs, and farming activities. Thus, she doesn’t want to lose the business that gave them their livelihood. Anita wants to maintain her store, so she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 8,000 so she can purchase additional merchandise. 

Although she is getting older, Anita needs to work hard to achieve her dream of becoming a successful entrepreneur. Her strength comes from the support of her husband, children, and grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola O. is a 35-year-old married woman with three children.  She lives in Ogbomosho, in the Oyo state of Nigeria.  To earn a living, she is a hair dresser, and she proudly states that she provides her customers with lovely hair styles.  At the same time, she also sells hair extensions and hair cream to generate additional income.  She is now seeking a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) to purchase more hair extensions, hair cream, and a hair dryer.

loans.use: To improve her salon by purchasing a hair dryer and to expand her business by purchasing additional products for resale

loans.name: Colaboradores 5 Group

texts.en:
Group 5 from Los Colaboradores (Contributors) Bank of Hope are starting their second loan with Esperanza International. This is a group of 5 young women in search of better means for their families, specially for their young children. 

Yolanda P. is the group coordinator. She has two children, ages 3 and 2, and is only 22 years old. She has no formal education, and selling clothes is her sole source of income. She will purchase different items with the loan in order to be well stocked and be able to have stock available for her clients for a longer period of time. Getting ahead in life with her young children is her biggest challenge, but she doesn't waste her energy. She hopes to own a clothing store someday. 

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting the initiative of these young women!

loans.use: To purchase new items to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish for resale

loans.name: Khidoyat

texts.en:
K. Khidoyat first applied for a business-development loan with Kiva's partner MicroInvest in 2007. Thanks to previous loans, she could improve business terms and stabilize her business of making and selling the national bread in hard market-competition conditions.

Khidoyat has made the national bread known as “lepeshky” for 10 years. She has one trade outlet for selling the national bread but wants to open one more trade outlet in the local crowded bazaar, “Panjshanbe,” to increase sales and turnover of her national bread.

Khidoyat is applying to Kiva for the business-support loan of 3,200 STJ for eight months. She thanks Kiva for the small-business development and wishes all the best.

loans.use: To open one more trade outlet in “Panjshanbe,” the local crowded bazaar

loans.name: Mr. Song Shem's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people living in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Song S. is the 49-year-old village bank president. He is a farmer who hires a plot of land from the other people to cultivate rice on. In this plantation, he has an obstacle because his field is infertile which has a bad to affect on his crop. In order to solve this problem, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Chum Srey Neang, is a pig breeder. Mr. Song S. has eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while five others are enrolled in the local school, and the remaining one is too young to work or study.

Four members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: buy fertilizer to make his crop more productive

loans.name: La Fortaleza - Group 6

texts.en:
The members of this group of five entrepreneurs are requesting their second loan from Esperanza International. They live in an area of Santo Domingo named Los Coordinadores, which, despite being within the limits of Santo Domingo, is far less developed. Most of the residents live in inadequate houses and are at the mercy of the Ozama River as the rainy season, which has just started, constantly threatens floods and mudslides.

Aracelis V., the group coordinator, sells fruits and vegetables purchased in the market and products such as rice and beans which she buys at a warehouse. She will use her loan to restock her inventory and hopes to one day own a supply warehouse similar to the one from which she buys the products she sells. Aracelis also hopes this new loan will help her establish her business in her area. Her short term goal is to set up a colmado (a small convenience store).

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: 10-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mai Lê Thị (63) is a 64-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hóa. Mai is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 10 Nam Ngạn (17-05-10).

Mai is widowed and has 2 adult children. To making a living, Mai owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Mai has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Mai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mai has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.442.600VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mai plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. N. Thị Yến (64) is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector, running a food stall.

2. T. Thị Thanh (66) is a 31-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector, operating a tailoring business.

3. N. Thị Cúc (67) is a 64-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector, operating a service-based business. 4. Ngô Thị Gấm (68) is a 60-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector, running a food stall.

5. N. Thị Hương (51) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

*Note: Many FPW borrowers have expressed a desire to borrow larger amounts to make more significant investments in their businesses. In response to this, FPW has recently added a new loan product of 6.000.000 VND to its Thanh Hoa City branch portfolio.

Mai Lê Thị (63) là 64 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hóa. Mai là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 10 Nam Ngạn (17.05.10). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương. Mai thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Mai kiếm được khoảng 40.000 VND. Vào 2007, Mai đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Mai đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.442.600 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. Thị Yến (64) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 2. T. Thị Thanh (66) là 31 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc. 3. N. Thị Cúc (67) là 64 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 4. Ngô Thị Gấm (68) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 5. N. Thị Hương (51) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora María del Pilar, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres para el Futura II”, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años, 03 hijos y 02 
 aún dependen de ella.

María del Pilar, lleva ya varios años dedicando a la venta de mercería, pasamanería y grandes novedades en forma ambulatoria, nos cuenta que siempre deseaba implementar su propio negocio, por esto decidió sacar un préstamo y fue el Movimiento Manuela Ramos quien  la apoyo con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00, organizando y surtiendo así su negocio  en su misma casa. 

Hoy en día, continúa con el mismo negocio e implemento también sus ventas de artículos de higiene y cuenta con una clientela fija, que diariamente realizan sus compras y como también va ofreciendo a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, le va muy bien y mensualmente genera ingresos, y con el carisma que tiene sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando mas productos para vender como: cremas, betunes, pasta dentales en diferentes marcas, Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de algunos productos de higiene personal  como: serenas, papel higiénico, shampoos.

Pilarcita, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, feliz por que en su negocio le va muy bien. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Mrs. María del Pilar is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres para el Futuro II.” She lives in Tarapoto in San Martín. María is married, 43 years old, and has three children two of whom are dependents. As an ambulatory vendor, María del Pilar had been selling haberdashery, trims and tassels, and novelties for many years. She tells us that she always wanted to have her own business so she decided to take out a loan and came to Movimiento Manuela Ramos who helped her with her first loan of 300 soles. This is how she was able to organize and stock a business in her home. Today, she has the same business and also sells personal hygiene products. She has a loyal clientele who buy from her every day, and who also tell their friends and neighbors about her products. It is going very well and she earns something each month. She gets sales by word of mouth because she is so charming. With this loan of 1,000 soles, she would like to buy more products to sell like: creams, shoe polish, and various brands of toothpaste. She will also invest part of the money in the purchase of personal hygiene products like: toilet paper, and shampoos. Pilarcita is very happy with what she has achieved because her business is doing very well. She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her, and the many other women who want to be business women, get started.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara mas merceria

loans.name: Latofatkhon

texts.en:
N. Latofatkhon is 42 years old. She and her husband have raised five children. For five years, Latofatkhon has been working in the largest local market of the city. She is selling rice of different sorts. Her market is situated in the central local market where there are always a lot of people. The business is very stable and generates the main income for the family since her husband, because of a difficult situation, had to leave for Russia to earn money. Latofatkhon has been working with IMON for a year, and had proved herself as an accurate client. Today she requests 3800 Somoni. The loan will be spent for purchasing rice to sell. Latofatkhon thanks all for support and promises to pay the loan on time.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more rice

loans.name: Gloria Maxima

texts.es:
Señora Gloria vive en el barrio la Playa, es un barrio ubicado  en el sector rural Cruz del Camino en la Comunidad del Valle, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Cuenca, su clima es bonito  y variado, las tierras son buenas para las siembras, cosechan maíz, fréjol, papas, verduras, no en gran cantidad porque la gente sale a la ciudad a trabajar, pero si para abastecer al sector, y para consumo propio de los dueños, además se dedican a la cría de animales como vacas, borregos, pollos, gansos, cuyes, y otros.
Gloria nació en el año de 1966, teniendo hasta hoy 43 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos, de 17,15 y 4 años de edad, las dos mayores trabajan pero la escuela si terminaron, Gloria cuenta que no sabe cuando mismo ha estado divorciada, porque hace 15 años su esposo se fue al extranjero, de allí no supo nada de el, se olvidó de su familia, al momento que Gloria fue a retirar las partidas de nacimiento se entera que ya esta separada, no entiende la razón en ese tiempo tenía solo a sus dos hijos, al pasar el tiempo más o menos unos 10 años, llega a saber del padre de sus hijos, a partir de ello por exigencias de sus hijos el comienza a ayudarles económicamente.
Vive en casa propia sus dos hijos mayores la ayudan económicamente ya que trabajan el uno en la construcción y la otra de empleada doméstica en la ciudad de cuenca.

Gloria se dedica al negocio de los animales asiste a las ferias de ganado que se realizan en diferentes lugares de la provincia del Azuay, como por ejemplo Paute, Girón, Azogues, y otros, los días que sale son a partir del miércoles y termina el domingo, los otros días se dedica a cuidar a su madre que es de 87 años y está enferma, cuida también a sus animales, y cultiva las tierras que tiene, se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes, pollos, y el ganado que le resta del negocio de las ferias, los domingos va a la feria libre a comercializar los animales pequeños, también los vende en casa según los pedidos.
Gloria está solicitando este crédito para invertir en el negocio  comprando más animales y alimento para los mismos, tiene actualmente unos 100 pollos runas(pollos criados con alimentos naturales), y unos 60 pollos criollos(pollos criados con balanceado).
Esta muy agradecida con la Fundación espoir porque le ayuda a su negocio, su meta es llegar a comprarse un carro para que su hijo le ayude a trabajar en su negocio y no tener que estar pagando transporte.
texts.en:
Gloria lives in the La Playa neighborhood, which is located in a rural area called Cruz del Camino in the community of Del Valle, 45 minutes from Cuenca. The climate is mild and the fields are good for raising crops. They raise corn, beans, potatoes and vegetable, not in large quantities because the residents go into the city to work, but enough to supply the area and for their own consumption. They also raise animals such as cows, sheep, chickens, geese, guinea pigs and others. Gloria was born in 1966. Today she is 43 years old, divorced and has 3 children, 17, 15, and 4 years old. The two oldest work but they completed their schooling. Gloria does not really know how long she has been divorced because 15 years ago her husband went to another country and she never heard from him again and he forgot about his family. When she went to get a copy of her children´s birth certificates she found out that she was separated but never knew why. At that time she had only her two children. After about 10 years, she heard from the father of her children and he began to help them financially after the childen demanded it. She lives in her own house and her two older children help her financially; one works in construction and the other works as a domestic employee in Cuenca. Gloria´s business is animals; she goes to the livestock fairs which are held in different towns in Azuay province, such as in Paute, Girón, Azogues and other places. She does this from Wednesday to Sunday. Other days she takes care of her 87-year-old mother who is ill. She also takes care of her animals and her fields. She raises animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, and on Sundays she takes the livestock that she still has left over after the fairs to the open market where small animals are sold. She also sells from her home, on request. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more animals and feed for the animals. She currently has 100 free-range chickens (chickens fed organically) and 60 chickens raised on feed. She is very grateful to the Fundación Espior because they help her business. Her goal is to be able to buy a car so that her son can help her with the business and not have to pay for transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock and feed for livestock

loans.name: Bety

texts.en:
Bety is a member of the Muungano borrower group in Ilala,iringa.she is 32 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 18,13,8 and 5 years.

Bety started her own business selling clothes 10 years go,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Bety first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes like vitenge,kanga(fabric).

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Bety hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes(fabric)

loans.name: Islomiddin

texts.en: S. Islomiddin is a lively entrepreneur with a small business selling clothes and shoes for teenagers. He is an experienced entrepreneur having been self-employed for the past twelve years. Business has been good for Islomiddin. There is always demand for clothing and as the economy has improved in Tajikistan, so more people have been able to afford new clothing. Islomiddin is married and has three children. He is doing all his best to provide his children with the best future. Islomiddin has requested a loan of 2,500 USD to increase his available working capital. Eventually, he hopes to have his own small store. This loan will help him purchase new inventory and enable him to continue to invest in his business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Erasinus

texts.en: Erasinus, a 39-year-old married father of two children, sells VCDs in retail and wholesale to his customers.  He hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more VCDs to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is married to Leonardo, a tricycle driver.  They have a ten year old son named Ceasar and he is already in grade 5.  Their family is living in Sillawit, Cauayan City, Isabela. 

Leticia manages a retail store in their village and she is glad that she is earning a weekly net income of PHP2,500.00.  She is now planning to borrow a loan of PHP27,000.00 from the KIVA lenders for her business expansion and as additional working capital. This will be of great for her store to grow by purchasing different commodities that she can offer to her customers.  She hopes that her loan request will be granted as soon as possible. Leticia is very patient in keeping her business to become profitable.

loans.use: To purchase different commodities for her store

loans.name: Dianke

texts.fr: Dianké B. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle développe un petit commerce, elle vend des tissus, des sacs de voyage et valises. Elle soutien son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Dianké B. is a 44-year-old woman, married, and the mother of six children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de YAMATOGNE for six and a half years.  She's developing a small business selling fabrics, travel bags, and suitcases.  She supports her husband in covering family expenses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To further her commerce

loans.name: Gilfonida

texts.en: Gilfonida C. is from the village of Unidos, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Gilfonida owns and operates a business selling charcoal. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Gilfonida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital to purchase coconut shells (used to make charcoal). Gilfonida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Baldan

texts.en:
T. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and 18 year-old daughter in Arkhangai Province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife works as an accountant at Weather Forecasting Center, and his daughter attends a local secondary school, while T. operates a transportation business in town. He started his business in 2005, with working capital of 250,000 tugrugs (~170 USD). Since then, his working capital has grown to exceed 6,000,000 tugrugs (~4200 USD). To supplement his earnings, T. also buys cut timber from the countryside and transports and sells it to the residents of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug (~2,100 USD) loan in order to keep growing his transportation business.

About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To keep growing his transportation business

loans.name: Milagro

texts.es:
la señora Milagro C. M. tiene 33 años de edad es casada y tiene un hijo. su esposo esta en los estados unidos. Milagro se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras, granos basicos  y queso en su carro que lo maneja su hermano menor.
Su producto lo compra en tegucigalpa y lo distribuye desde que sale del lugar de donde compra hasta llegar a su lugar de origen San Lorenzo. aqui termina su producto.
