esta actividad la realiza desde hace un año, esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas verduras y granos basicos para esta epoca que la demanda es mayor, los pedidos son mayores y requiere de mas capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Milagro C. M. is 33, married, and has one child. Her husband is in the United States. Milagro buys and sells vegetables, basic grains, and cheese. She uses her car, which her younger brother drives. She buys her product in Tegucigalpa. She distributes it from when she leaves the place where she buys it until she gets to the place where she is from, San Lorenzo. That is where she finishes with her product. She has been doing this for one year. She is asking for the loan to buy more vegetables and basic grains for this season when the demand is greater. Orders are greater, and she needs more working capital

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables, basic grains, and cheese

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
Nuestra socia CARLA tiene 26 años, es madre soltera, es padre y madre para sus dos hijos. La socia tiene una pequeña ferretería en la “Calle Nueva” a 5 minutos de la Plaza de Armas del Cusco, donde vende repuestos de artefactos, focos, conectores eléctricos, candados, chapas y todo referente a la electrónica. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia a pesar de las dificultades de la vida y sin el apoyo de su ex pareja, padre sus dos hijos. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más repuestos como focos navideños y así de esta forma aumentar el capital del negocio.  
 
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “HUAYNA CCAPAC” de la Asociación Arariwa de la Provincia del Cusco del Departamento del Cusco.   

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This borrower, Carla, is 26 years old and is a single mother, she has to be both mother and father to her two children. Carla has a small hardware store in "Calle Nueva" five minutes from the Plaza de Armas in Cusco where she sells parts, lights, electrical connectors, locks, plates and everything related to electronics. She's had this business for several years and it has done well, thanks to all of the determination she has put into her work. Carla is a hard working mother and business woman that supports her family through the difficulties of life and she does it without the support of her ex-partner and the father of her two children. Carla needs this loan to buy more items like Christmas lights and things to increase the income of her business. She belongs to the Communal Bank "HUAYNA CCAPAC” of Asociación Arariwa in Cusco. Carla is grateful for the opportunity to provided and she is committed to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy Christmas lights and other decorations

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: K. Sarah is a businesswoman of thirty-four years old.  She is a married woman blessed with three children. She has run a spare parts shop for the past five years. She will use the loan to purchase spare parts to satisfy her customers’ needs. She really hopes to improve upon her business. Her aim is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to satisfy her customers’ needs

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 36 años, está felizmente casada con Luis, de 32 años. Ambos tienen tres hijos: Miguel de 10,  Noelia de 4 y Heidi de 1 año, todos viven en un apacible lugar de la sierra del Perú donde no existe muchas vías de comunicación. 

Para sacar adelante a su familia ella y su esposo trabajan muy duro en la chacra, sembrando papa, arveja, habas y maíz desde hace 10 años. Asimismo, cría animales los cuales vende luego de engordarlos.
Angélica cuenta que de todo su trabajo le gusta más cosechar y comercializar sus productos porque ve el fruto de su sacrifico, además desde que empezó a vivir con su esposo no se queja de las ganancias que obtiene porque le permite sostener su vivienda y educar a sus hijos.
Por ello, para el futuro planea comprar más terrenos agrícolas y cerdos para criar.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser responsable y pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Por otro lado, le gusta la idea de trabajar en grupo, más aún con su banco comunal que son personas que conoce. En busca de más ganancias económicas que le brinden bienestar a su hijos, con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará ½ saco de semilla de papa, ½ bolsa de semilla de arveja y un saco de abono.
texts.en:
Angélica is 36 years old. She is happily married to Luis, 32. Both have 3 children: Miguel, 10, Noelia, 4, and Heidi, 1. All live in a peaceful spot in the Peruvian mountain range where there aren't many channels of communication. To keep her family going, for the last 10 years Angélica and her husband have worked very hard on their farm, sowing potato, peas, broad beans and maize. She also breeds animals which she sells after fattening them. Angélica says that out of all her work, she most enjoys harvesting and selling her products because she sees the fruit of her labours. Also, since she began living with her husband he doesn't complain about the earnings she obtains because they permit her to maintain their home and educate their children. In the future she plans to purchase more agricultural land and pigs for breeding. This is the first loan Angélica will take out with MFP, and she promises to be responsible and make her repayments punctually. She liks the idea of working in a group, more so because her communal bank members are people that she knows. In the search for greater economic earnings that grant well-being to her children, with the money that she is now seeking she will buy half a sack of potato seeds, half a bag of pea seeds, and a sack of fertiliser.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilisers

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet has a unique business: she has a general store where she sells things ranging from toothbrushes to padlocks. She sells for long hours to enable her to make more profits to meet the basic needs of her family. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is 40 years old and married, with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Pedro Jr's Group

texts.en:
Pedro Jr C. is from the village of Pilitan. He is 39 years old. Pedro Jr is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Pedro Jr C..

Pedro Jr is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Pedro Jr plants and harvests rice for selling. Pedro Jr has been engaged in his business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $1415 every cropping season (every four months).

In 2010, Pedro Jr joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedro Jr is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel is 28 years old, single, and lives with his two parents. He has been working as an electrician for seven years. He works on construction projects as well as undertaking freelance work offering domestic electrical services on customer request. Like the majority of Lebanese young men, Kamel tries to work hard to help his parents with the family income.
Today, Kamel is requesting to borrow $500 USD to purchase more tools needed for his business. This will enable him to take on more projects and earn a good income.

loans.use: To purchase more tools

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house which they built themselves. He operates a raw materials trading business in their town with his wife. He sells a variety of animal products to his many customers. Ganzorig started his business in 2000 with a working capital of 150,000 tugrugs (~ 105 USD). After 10 years of successful operations he has managed to increase his working capital to more than 2,920,000 tugrugs (~ 2055 USD). His earnings have enabled him to build a larger house for his family.

Ganzorig is a very hard working person and says, “It was hard for me to find a job related to my profession. However, I started my own business and am providing money for my family's expenses.” He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~ 1407 USD) loan to purchase more raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his animal products trading business

loans.name: Mohamed A.

texts.en: Mohamed Alie K. is single and started business with a very small amount of money he acquired from his mother. Being that he was very determined to become a successful businessman, he was able to double his initial capital and left the sale of  postal cards and cosmetic items to begin the sale of mobile phone accessories and clothing. With an experience of 6 years in business, Mohamed  is therefore seeking a loan. He intends to construct a house in the future and start his own family with proceeds from the loan.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories and clothing for resale

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya M. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Thecho, Lalitpur. She sells different types of grocery goods, such as rice, maize, and various snacks, in her shop.

She opened her grocery shop two years ago. Her main goal in opening her shop was to improve the economic condition of her family. Due to a lack of money she cannot further expand her business. Therefore, Mrs. M. is requesting a Rs 15000.00 loan to add other kinds of grocery goods to her shop.

Mrs. M. lives in a single-family residence with her husband and two children. Her husband is a farmer. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 5 and daughter is studying in grade 7.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Los 5 Claveles Del Huayna Potosi Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO LOS CINCO CLAVELES ESTA CONFORMADO POR 11 SOCIOAS (OS), LAS CUALES  8 SON MUJERES Y TRES SON VARONES, TODAS VIENEN D. LA MISMA ZONA HUAYNA POTOSI D. AHI VIENE EL NOMBRE, LA MAYOR PARTE SON DUEÑAS D. CASA, LA MESA DIRECTIVA ESTA REPRESENTADA POR LAS SIGUIENTES PERSONAS.

LA PRESIDENTA ES LA SEÑORA NANCY  D. 35 AÑOS VIVE EN ANTICRETICO, TIENE DOS LINDAS HIJAS A QUIENES ELLA LAS MANTIENE SOLA, SU ACTIVIDAD ES VENTA D. RELLENOS MADRUGA DESD. LAS 06:00 A.M. PARA SALIR A SU PUESTO A LAS 9:00 D. LA MAÑANA, ESTE CREDITO DESEMBOLSADO LO UTILIZARA PARA COMPRARSE UN PUESTO EN EL MATADERO YA QUE ES UN LUGAR MUY TRANSITADO Y TENDRA MAS VENTA Y ASI MEJORARA SU CALIDAD D. VIDA YA QUE TENDRA MAS INGRESOS, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA INSUMOS PARA ELABORACION D. SUS RELLENOS, ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y RESPONSABLE, POR SU SOLIDARIDAD FUE ELEGIDA COMO PRESIDENTA.

TODAS LAS SOCIAS SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES Y TRABAJADORAS Y ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Los Cinco Claveles (“The Five Carnations”) Bank is maD. up 11 members, 8 of whom are women and 3 of them men. All of them come from the same neighborhood, called Huayna Potosi, hence the name of the group. Most of the members are homeowners. The board of directors includes the group’s president. Nancy, the president of the group, is 35 years old and lives in “anticrético” [Note: “anticrético is a Bolivian rental agreement in which tenants pay their landlord a fixed sum rather than a monthly rent]. She has two pretty daughters whom she is bringing up by herself. Nancy’s economic activity is selling rellenos (which in Bolivia are stuffed potatoes that are often sold as street food). She rises at 6:00 AM so that she can leave for her stand at 9:00 in the morning. The disbursed loan will be used to purchase a stand at the slaughterhouse, since it is a very busy place and she will have more sales. This will allow her to improve her quality of life, since she will have more income. She will also use the money to purchase ingredients for making rellenos. Nancy is very hardworking and responsible, and because of her solidarity with the rest of the group she was elected as the group’s president. All of the members are very responsible and hardworking, and they are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have given them by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for rellenos

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr: Née en 1951 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Z. Thérèse est mariée à DENON Timothée et est mère de quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Thérèse vit depuis quinze ans environs au quartier Avotrou à Cotonou, avec sa famille. Thérèse vient en aide à son mari et supporte avec lui les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui génère son activité. Thérèse vend divers condiments (piment, poivre, ails, crevettes écrasés, bicarbonate, conserves de tomates, huile de palme, etc.) au marché de Avotrou. Thérèse achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Thérèse exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans, et a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Dans le but d’augmenter davantage son stock de produits et de se faire plus de profits grâce aux ventes qu’elle réalisera, Thérèse sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1951 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Thérèse Z. is married to Timothée DENON and is the mother of four children, of whom some attend (or have attended) school. Thérèse has been living for the past 15 years in the Avotrou borough of Cotonou, with her family. She helps her husband deal with the various family expenses, thanks to the income her activity generates. Thérèse sells various condiments (hot peppers, pepper, garlic, shrimp paste, baking soda, canned tomatoes, palm oil, etc.) at the Avotrou market. She buys her products in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Thérèse has been running her business for the past five years, and has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which were fully repaid. Wanting to increase her stock of products and achieve more profits with her projected sales, she is now requesting a third loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various condiments (hot peppers, pepper, garlic, shrimp paste and canned tomatoes)

loans.name: Rosa Virginia

texts.es: Rosa Virginia tiene 30 años su actividad económica es la venta de ropa usada. Ella dio inicio hace más de 3 años por lo que anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida que ofrecía en su vivienda pues tenía demasiados problemas de salud y se cansaba, pero siempre le ha gustado diversificar en actividades pues tenía que mantener a sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo pero no le perjudico para buscar otro negocio así poco a poco es que ha ido creciendo con su nuevo negocio como la venta de ropa usada. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima. Sueña con tener un lugar estable para vender.
texts.en:
Rosa Virginia is 30 years old. She sells used clothing. She started off a few years ago by selling food from her home, but she had a number of health problems, and always felt tired. She doesn’t mind branching out into different kinds of business because she has two children to support. Her used clothing business has been growing little by little, day by day. Rosa will use her loan to buy some basic merchandise. She dreams of being able to do business at a regular location.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more water and juice

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
50-year-old Susan D. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. She does farming for a living. She and her husband plant and harvest rice crops. Their harvest is for consumption and sale. She also raises ducks and hopes to acquire additional ducks to grow. She also needs feed to sustain her ducks.

Susan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Susan is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and also feed for the ducks. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Susan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seed, and duck feed

loans.name: Nyètaa 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe Nyètaa 1 sont toutes mariées dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent le village de Balamissala dans la commune rurale de Sébougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parenté. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs superficies de culture, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt de campagne. Le riz, le fonio et le gombo seront cultivés par les membres du groupe.
Madame Korotoumou  C. veut utiliser son prêt  pour acheter 25kg de semences de riz,  deux sacs de complexe céréale, 2 bidons d’herbicide et recruter la main d’œuvre pour les activités de labour, de repiquage et de sarclage dans ses champs. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Sébougou, en main d’œuvre avec l’association des jeunes et des femmes du village. 
Avec une superficie de 3,1 hectares, elle espère produire 10 sacs de riz, 2 sacs de fonio et une trentaine de sac de gombo. Une partie de la production est auto consommée tandis que le reste est vendu pour prendre en charge les besoins du foyer en condiments, fournitures scolaires et soins de santé des enfants. Madame Korotoumou  C. à l’image des autres femmes du groupe Nyètaa 1 a pour objectif d’assurer l’auto suffisance alimentaire dans le village et faire de l’élevage des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Nyètaa 1 group are all married and living in big traditional families. Their average age is 41 and on average they have 4 children each. They live in the village of Balamissala, in the rural community of Sébougou, Ségou region (fourth administrative region of Mali), and they became acquainted because they are either in-laws, neighbors, or related to each other. Wishing to expand their arable land, they came to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second agricultural (seasonal) loan. Members of the group grow rice, "fonio" (a type of millet) and okra. Mrs. Korotoumou C. wants to use her loan to buy 25 kg of rice seed, two sacks of fertilizer for grains, two tins of herbicide, and pay for labor to help her transplant the rice seedings and do the weeding in her fields. She buys her agricultural inputs at the weekly market in Sébougou and finds her laborers among the young people's association and the women of the village. With 3.1 hectares, she hopes to produce 10 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of "fonio", and about 30 sacks of okra. Part of her production will be consumed by her family, whereas the rest will be sold to have money for household needs: condiments, school supplies, and health care for her children. Mrs. Korotoumou C., like the other women of the Nyètaa 1 group, aims to make the village self-sustaining in terms of food and be able to raise goats and sheep.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying fertilizer for grains, rice seeds, herbicides, and paying for labor

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Sin A., 41, is married with two young children living at home in the Takeo province. She raises pigs and sells fish at the local market, typically making $3 (USD) each day, and her husband is a rice farmer. Her husband’s income is $1 each day. Sin A. would like a loan of $600 to reinvest in her fish business.

loans.use: to reinvest in her fish-selling business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a single woman with two children, both attend school. She has been operating her food stall for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbours. With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase seeds for green vegetables, cabbage, bananas and beans. She has no other source of income. Fatuma faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to be self-reliant in the future and to improve her living standards. She decided to join Yehu so as to get a loan to improve her business. She owns a house with electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for green vegetables, cabbage, bananas and beans.

loans.name: Talemwa Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
The hallmark of any successful business person, especially from the point of view of Uganda, has always been having that painstaking hard work modus operandi together with determination and resilience. With these in tow, many people can testify that, even with stiff competition pitted against you, success will always be in your grasp.

40-year-old B. Rehema, who belongs to The Talemwa Development Group in Lugazi, is a testimony to this as she has, in the last decade, manifested all the above in her role as the mover and shaker of her hotel business.

For this mother of four, hard work is like a lullaby. In a month, she makes profits that add up to 200,000 Ugandan shillings. She also ekes out side profits from hiring out fridges. With this loan she wants to revamp her hotel services by constructing a recreational facility and, by and large, improving her overall facilities.

loans.use: To construct a recreational facility and to generally improve her facilities

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
la señora vicenta I. tiene 61 años de edad y se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa usada, zapatos y carteras, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio. Vicenta vive en la colonia Buena Vista de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo.
la señora vicenta I. esta solicitando el credito para invertirlos en la compra de ropa usada para  mejorar su nivel de ingresos y tambien que su negocio pueda crecer mas.
su mayor deseo es que todo le salga bien y poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Vicenta I., 61, earns a living buying and selling used clothing, shoes and wallets which she has done for several years. She lives in the Buena Vista neighborhood of the City of San Lorenzo. 

Vicenta I. is seeking the loan to invest in the purchase of used clothing to improve her level of income and also so that her business may grow. Her greatest hope is that everything turn out well and to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en:
Wenifreda M. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 43 years old. Wenifreda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Wenifreda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling food and household products like canned goods, instant noodles, snacks, soap, toothpaste and detergents. Wenifreda has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Wenifreda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Wenifreda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken by Wenifreda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell and as working capital

loans.name: Soun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Soun S. is a 23-year-old married woman, selected as the village bank president, by this village bank which consists of thirteen members. They are located in Pou Thum village in Kandal province. Each member of this village bank will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Soun S. is a farmer who rents some pieces of land to cultivate corn and rice. They do not have enough money to support their farm. Thus, S. would like to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and corn seed to grow crops. She wants use the rest of the loan to buy fishing supplies for her husband's fishing business.Her husband, Mr. Savuth Nuon, who is 29 years old, works as construction worker, and he is also a fisherman. With their occupations, they are able to earn some income to support their family.  This couple has two children who are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and corn seed to grow crops

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 37 year old married lady with two children.  She has been selling second-hand clothes for three years.  She is able to educate her children using the income from her business.  She says that through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to expand her business.

She has requested 80,000 KES to buy clothes.  Eunice hopes to supply clothes in wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ana es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito agrícola de Oyotún, una zona que se encuentra situada a más de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ana se dedica desde hace diez años a la crianza y venta de animales menores y aves de corral, ella cría estos animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio y los ofrece en venta al público en general una vez que estos ya se hayan desarrollado completamente, eventualmente los vende en una feria que toma lugar una vez cada semana en el vecino distrito de Cayaltí. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad son utilizados para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más animales y alimento balanceado ya que durante estas temporadas del año la demanda aumenta, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ana, 37, is a mother living with her husband and children in the agricultural zone, Oyotún, which is located over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For ten years Ana has raised small farm animals and barnyard fowl.  She raises these animals in the back yard of her home and sells to the general public once they reach ideal development.  Occasionally she sells them at a livestock fair that takes place once a week in the neighboring Cayaltí district.  Income from these sales is used to help her husband support the family.

She wants to enlarge the business buying more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them because during this time of year demand increases.  
To reach this goal she needs to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarah R. is from the village of Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, married to Glecirio R., Jr. and blessed with 2 children who are both still in school. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She’s been engaged in this kind of retailing business for 2 years already. At present she is earning an amount of not less than Php 3,000 from the sales of this business. 

Just this year, Sarah joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, Sarah is now requesting a loan of Php 25,000 as her 1st loan which will be used as additional capital for her existing sari-sari store business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, making loan repayments, children’s education expenses, and possible business expansion.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing sari-sari store business

loans.name: Ambrose

texts.en: Ambrose is a thirty-year-old man, married to a teacher, with one child, living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda with a family dream of educating his child and setting up a business. For a year he has been operating a restaurant and the business has tremendously grown although his dream is to own at least three restaurants. Ambrose intends to use the loan to buy food for sale.

loans.use: Buying food for sale

loans.name: Soem

texts.en: Soem K. is a 47-year-old single woman who currently lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Soem K. has been a farming businesswoman for a long time. Since 1979, Soem K. has owned and operated a farm to cultivate rice, from which she earns a daily income. Soem K. is a widowed mother who has four children, three of whom are single and one married. She has two kids who are sewing workers at the garment factory. Soem K. will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland, which is a good location for farming. She will use this land to do farming. The loan will provide her with an additional asset.

loans.use: To buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland for growing rice crop.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en: Gideon is a member of the Big Hope group in Faulu Kenya. He has been running a green grocery for four years. He also works as a casual laborer in order to meet his family’s needs. Since Gideon joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to educate his children because his business has improved. He hopes to expand his business and get capital for starting a transport business. Gideon also hopes to open other outlets for his business in the future. He has requested a 40,000 KES loan to buy bananas, mangoes and tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy bananas, mangoes and tomatoes

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is a married woman who lives in Lapu-Lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: Pig Fattening, Videoke and selling frozen foods. Her husband Rex, who is 50 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living. They have seven children who are between 15 and 28 years old. Genara joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Genara has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 30,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 4th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Genara is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Sarah.  She is married and has three children aged 14, 9, and 7.  In 2005, Sarah established her foodstuffs business. She began her business because her mother introduced her to it. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,112,000 every month from this business. 

Sarah would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. She wants a loan to help her buy Maggi, groundnut oil, and tinned tomatoes in large quantities. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 220,000. In the future, Sarah plans to get a new Victor motorbike and to help her children with their school fees.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph K. K. is a forty-year-old married man with three children. He runs a retail shop in the Kitale area and has been in this business for twenty years. 

This will be Joseph's first loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use the entire loan to buy a water tank. Since the area has water problems, with the tank he can store water and sell it. He anticipates some profits which he plans to use to add stock to his retail shop.

In the future he wants to educate his children and also expand his business and own a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a widow with two school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past eight years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household goods like sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking fat. In addition she also operates a livestock business which is her other source of income. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, a sack of sugar, maize flour and frying fat. Luvuno decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, a sack of sugar, maize flour and frying fat.

loans.name: Resma

texts.en:
Resma B. is from the village of Lupagan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Resma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Resma owns & operates a business of planting and harvesting rice for sale. Resma has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Resma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Resma is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to pay for the labor costs for farm maintenance and to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Resma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs for farm maintenance and to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Sop Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Composé de 11 femmes qui sont voisines et ont comme lien commun le petit commerce, le groupe de solidarité Sop Mame Diarra est créé le 27 août 2009. Le groupe fait partie du Banc villageois de Artillerie Baax Yaay. 

La responsable Nogaye M. est mariée, âgée de 50 ans et a six enfants en charge. Sur la photo elle est à droite habillée en robe bleue claire et couverte d'un châle jaune.

Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus, wax, thioub et de bijoux. Elle a neuf ans d'expérience 
dans ce domaine d'expérience. Elle s'approvisionne et vend au marché central de la ville de Louga

Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin d'augmenter ses revenus.

Nogaye Mabye aide son mari dans la prise des dépenses familiales et soutient ses enfants dans leur scolarité. Avec ses bénéfices elle augmente ses épargnes.
texts.en: The Sop Mame Diarra solidarity group was born on August 27, 2009 and its 11 members are all women who own small businesses. The group loan is part of the "Banc Villageois" in Artillerie Baax Yaay. Nogaye M., 50 year-old, is a married mother in charge of 6 children and leader of the group. She stands on the far right in the picture wearing a light blue dress with a yellow scarf. She sells cloth, wax (pagnes), thioub (a dyed fabric) and jewelry. She has a 9 years experience in this field. She gets her supplies and resell the products in Louga's main market. The loan will allow her to strengthen her business and increase her revenues. Nogaye Mabye helps her husband with the family's expenditures and their children's schooling. She wants to save the profits she will make.

loans.use: To buy and resell cloth and jewelry

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt:
Celina nasceu  na provincia de Gaza tem 46 anos de idade e divorciada mãe de 5 filhos de  11 aos 27 anos, Duas é que vão a escola. Responsabiliza se pelos seus 3 netos que vivem com ela em sua casa consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00mt porque conta com ajuda dos seus filhos.


Celina muda se para o distrito de Namaacha quando seu marido é transferido, é abandonada pelo marido deixando a com 5 filhos por criar, então ela vende seus utencilios domesticos nomeadamente (mantas, capulanas e loiça) e dá início do seu próprio negócio de venda de potes. Pois alguns filhos ja nem podiam ir a escola, hoje é uma grande negociante de potes tem vendido duas veses por semana (quartas e sábados) no Mercado Informal das 5h as 17h assim como também tem tido encomendas na Suazilândia de 15 em 15 dias fazendo a entraga nos meados do mês e o lavantamento do valor no fim de cada mês, assim sucessivamente. Tem gastado 15.000.00mt por viagem tendo de lucro de 8.000.00mt dependendo muito mas da estação do tempo porque o reino suazi aprecia muito este tipo de panelas de alumínio.


Este é o quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku e terceiro com Kiva. Os primeiros 3 emprestimos de (10.000.00, 10.000.00 e de 13.000.00) forao usados para a compra de potes. E este ultimo de 15.000.00mt sera para a mesma finalidade. Esta confiante que ira pagar antes do tempo presvisto e pedir um outro para pintura da sua casa.
texts.en:
Celina was born in the Gaza province.  She is 46 years old and the divorced mother of 5 children ages 11 to 27.  Two of them attend school.  She also supports her 3 grandchildren who live with her.  She is able to save 1.000.00mt per month because she has help from her children.

Celina moved to the Namaacha district when her husband was transferred.  Her husband left herand she had 5 children to raise, so she began selling her housewares door to door (comforters, fabrics, ceramic tableware) and began her own business selling water basins.  Some of her children were not able to go to school.  Today she has a substantial business selling water basins.  She sells twice per week (Thursdays and Saturdays) in the Informal Market from 5 am to 5pm, and she also has orders in Swaziland every 2 weeks.  She delivers around mid month and is paid at the end of every month.  She spends 15.000.00mt per trip and makes a profit of 8.000.00mt depending a great deal on the season. This type of aluminum pots are highly valued in the Swazi kingdom. 

This is Celina's fourth loan with Hluvuku and her third with Kiva.  The first 3 loans (for 10.000.00, 10.000.00 and 13.000.00mt) were used to purchase water basins.  This loan of 15.000.00 will be used for the same purpose.  She is confident that she will pay off the loan before it is due and request another to paint her home.

loans.use: to purchase products (aluminum pots, basins, etc.)

loans.name: Celina

texts.en: Celina is 30 years old.  She is married and has 5 children -- 3 of them go to school.  Celina sells onions, groundnuts and tomatoes.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more onions, groundnuts and tomatoes to sell.  She hopes to expand her business in the future with the extra profits generated.

loans.use: stock more onions, groundnuts and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Emi

texts.en:
Emi is 44 years of age and married with nine children. Emi owns & operates a business venture, baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  She has many years of experience in this business.  Emi needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional cooking ingredients.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Emi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Emi's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas, 51, is a rice farmer residing in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province. She raises pigs in a pigpen behind her house and sells them to a slaughterer in four-month cycles. She also plants a rice crop for her annual business. Her husband always assists her in the farming business. Mrs. Meas is looking for a loan as capital to support her farming business. She will use it to buy more piglets and to purchase rice seed for planting. Mrs. Meas has three children; two attend school and one is married and lives in another house.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and rice seed

loans.name: Maria Cecelia

texts.en:
Maria Cecelia is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Maria Cecelia has a retail shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock of used clothing.
Maria Cecelia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Maria Cecelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a 34 year old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 14 years old and the youngest is 8.

Corazon is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She grows rice and corn crops at her farm. Corazon sells her harvest to rice traders and earns about 30000 PHP per month. Corazon has requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

In the future, Corazon hopes for her children to finish school and to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a 31-year-old single mother of one. She operates a boutique to earn a living for her family. Being a single mother of one, she works hard in her business to provide for her child.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access business loans, which she has used to boost her business. Linet hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future.  She needs 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric, shoes and shirts.

loans.use: To buy fabric, shoes and shirts

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
Don Carlos labora como cadete de taxi, es casado, padre de tres hijos estudiantes. Su esposa labora en bodega en una empresa privada.
El objetivo de ambos es la construccion de su casa, en donde han venido construyendo el cuarto, el baño y hoy cambiaran el techo de su casa que esta bastante malo. Todoas estas mejora la ha hecho con prestamo en Afodenic, lleva siete ciclos trabajando con la institucion. El cual ha sido posible equilirar sus gastos, en la alimentacion, estudios y bestimenta a sus hijos.
Materiales a comprar laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, soldadura. Y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Don Carlos works as a taxi driver. He is married and the father of three school-age children. His wife works for a market that is owned by a private company.

His goal is to build his house. He is currently in the process of building a room, a bathroom, and replacing the roof since it is in very bad shape. All of these improvements have been made with loans from AFODENIC. Carlos has received seven loans while working with the organization. The loans have made it possible for him to equalize his expenses, feed his family, and pay for the education and clothing of his children.

Carlos plans to buy materials such as sheets of zinc, crossbeams, screws, welding supplies, as well as pay for labor.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to replace the roof of his house.

loans.name: Tupendane Group

texts.fr:
Consolate  est une  commerçante âgée de 38ans qui habite   en Province de Kayanza au Nord du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de  produits alimentaires (haricot,petit pois,ble) depuis 6 ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle n’a pas  fréquenté l’école. Elle est mariée a Jean et ont ensemble 4enfants qui étudient au secondaire. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter son capital en achetant beaucoup de produits alimentaires (haricot,petit pois,ble) à revendre pour réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TUPENDANE».
texts.en:
Consolate is a merchant, 38 years old, who lives in the province of Kayanza in northern Burundi. She has been doing commerce in groceries (beans peas, wheat) for six years. She is also a farmer. She did not attend school. She is married to Jean, and together they have four children who are in middle school. 

Consolate is asking for a Kiva loan to increase her capital and to buy a lot of grocery items (beans, peas, wheat) to resell in order to make a large profit. 

Consolate is a member of the community group “TUPENDANE”.

loans.use: to increase her capital by buying a lot of grocery items (beans, peas, wheat) to resell in order to make a large profit

loans.name: Olivia Margot

texts.es:
Olivia Margot tiene 35 años de edad, es casada tiene dos hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Olivia  se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha. Enfreta desafios no muy importantes. Su sueño es tener aumentar la produccion de cacao para generar mas ingresos para la educacion de los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte con los hijos y salir de paseo por el campo.
texts.en:
Olivia Margot is 35 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She lives with her husband and children in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolivar. 

The V.R.C. is called EL PLACER and belongs to the Chillanes canton in the parish of San Jose del Tambo which is located 60 minutes from the office. The group has 24 members who work in agriculture growing bananas, rice, cassava, cocoa, soya and oranges as well as breeding livestock.

Olivia works growing rice, corn, oranges, soya and bananas. She makes her purchases in San Jose del Tambo and sells them in the Chillanes market on Sundays at the fair.

She is asking for a loan to buy farming consumables and fertilizers. The loan will help support her in improving the harvest. The challenges she faces are not so serious. Her dream is to increase her production of cocoa to generate more income for her children's education.
 
In her free time she likes to play sports with her children and go for walks in the countryside.

loans.use: to buy farming consumables and fertilizers.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia es socia del Banco Comunal “Medallitas de Oro II”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos independientes.  Estudió solo hasta 3ro de educación primaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace  cinco años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, golosinas y gaseosas.
Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/.  3000.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, arroz, azúcar, galletas y otros insumos más.  En el negocio le ayuda su hija y esposo, éste último trabaja en el hospital.
Su sueño es vender frazadas y colchones al por mayor.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y la comprensión entre las socias.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the Medallitas de Oro II communal bank, located in the district of Puno, province and department of Puno.  She is 52 years old and married, with two children who live on their own.  She studied only through the third grade.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for five years.  Her first loan was for the sum of 300 PEN, which she invested in her business selling groceries, candy, and soda.

She will request a new loan for the sum of 3,000 PEN, which she will use to buy soda, rice, sugar, cookies, and other supplies.  Her daughter and her husband help her in the business.  Her husband works in a hospital.

Her dream is to sell blankets and mattresses wholesale.

What she likes about the communal bank is the punctuality, the responsibility, and the understanding among the members.

loans.use: to buy soda, rice, sugar, cookies, and other supplies.

loans.name: Alexie

texts.en: Alexie is 37 years old and has 3 children aged between 2 and 9. All of them are in school. She is married to a businessman and they own a retail food shop which they have run for 6 years.  She will use the loan to expand her inventory. She will use the profits to pay school fees and build savings. She would like to see her business grow and prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food for sale

loans.name: Whylyn

texts.en: Whylyn is 32 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children. To earn a living, Whylyn has a business selling dried fish. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase boxes of dried fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC since 2011. In the future, Whylyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of dried fish to sell.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is 29-year-old farmer from the village of Kheoti, South Georgia. Amiran is married and lives with his family: his wife, Maya, and two children, a 5-year-old son and 3-year-old daughter. Maya is a housewife. Amiran earns his income through his family's agricultural activities. In particular, he grows different vegetables on family-owned land. The harvested products are sold in Akhaltsikhe, a nearby town. The family's total average monthly income is 500 Laris. 

Amiran requested credit for purchasing additional land (approximately 0.5 hectare). He will be able to grow more vegetables and increase his family's income. Amiran plans to use increased income to ensure a better future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, vive por la comunidad de Racar en Cuenca, lugar en donde se puede admirar hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la artesanía como es la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña María tiene 47 años, está separada de su esposo y en su unión ha concebido 5 hijos de 25, 19, 18, 12 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado e independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su tercera hija está estudiando en una universidad de la ciudad, su penúltima hija estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija  en una escuelita de la ciudad. la casa en la que vive es el fruto de su trabajo.

La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidado de sus hijos, como pasa en casa cría y vende animales como cerdos, cuyes y pollos.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos, cuyes y en alimento para animales.

Sus metas son terminar su casa y llegar a tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Futuro para un Bienestar (Future for Well-Being) communal bank. She lives in the Racar community in Cuenca, where one can admire beautiful landscapes. Its people dedicate themselves to artisan work such as making tiles and bricks. Many work in the city in various activities, and they maintain the culture and tradition of their parents.

María is 47 years old. She is separated from her husband, and together they have 5 children aged 8, 12, 18, 19, and 25 years. Their oldest child is married and independent, their second-oldest works and helps out with the family finances, their third child is studying at a university in the city, their second-youngest child is in school, and their youngest child attends a little school in the city. The house in which she lives is the fruit of her labor.

María devotes her time to household chores and caring for her children. As she is at home, she raises and sells animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years, and with her new loan she will purchase chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and animal feed. 

Her goals are to finish her house and to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and animal feed

loans.name: Mgandi

texts.en:
Mgandi is applying for another loan to expand his existing business. He will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase more goats for resale. In the future, Mgandi aspires to continue expanding his business. 

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Mgandi has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Kikundi Cha Kilimo Liyombo Group

texts.en:
Adolfu is a 32-year-old married man with three children. He has worked in agricultural for over six years. His main economic activity is growing coffee, maize and beans. Adolfu earns a low income that leads to his failure to purchase fertilizers, hoes, insecticides and gumboots. 

Adolfu seeks working capital to buy fertilizers, hoes, insecticides and gumboots. He believes that in five years to come his coffee, maize and beans production will increase from 5 acres to 10 acres and he will be able to buy a power tiller for cultivation, to buy a transport vehicle and own an insecticides pump machine.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, hoes, insectisides and gumboots

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is 40 years old. He has been engaged in the farming business for 15 years. He lives with his wife and two children. He wants to further develop his business in order to continue to live a comfortable life. In order to do this he is asking for a loan in the amount of P25,000 to purchase corn seed, fertilizer and pesticide for use in his business. Hopefully, with the help of this material he can improve his farm and yield more fruitful crops. He also continues to send his children to school so that they can achieve their preferred careers.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizer and pesticide for use in his business

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: El señor Luis Carlos trabaja como agricultor desde hace 15 años y es esta actividad la que le permite conseguir los ingresos necesarios para su sostenimiento. Esta actividad la aprendió el señor Luis Carlos de la mano de su padre quien también era agricultor y quien falleció hace un año. Actualmente, el señor Luis Carlos tiene cultivo de maíz y fríjol en un terreno de la finca de sus padres la cual se encuentra en proceso de sucesión. Con la necesidad de mejorar su cultivo y superar las dificultades que se han presentado por la temporada invernal, el señor Luis Carlos requiere de la compra de insumos agrícolas para su cultivo como abonos y riegos. El señor Luis Carlos sueña con mejorar sus ingresos con los cuales pueda mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Luis Carlos has been working as a farmer for 15 years and this activity has allowed him to bring in the income necessary to support himself.  He learned this work from his father who was also a farmer and who died a year ago.  Currently, Señor Luis Carlos grows corn and beans on his parents farm land that he is in the process of inheriting.  In order to improve his crops and overcome the difficulties he faced during the winter season, Señor Luis Carlos needs to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and irrigation supplies.  

Señor Carlos dreams of increasing his income so he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and irrigation supplies.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 48 years old. He is a father of five children. He has been operating a local cafe for the past three years, earning a monthly income of 27,000 KES. 

Daniel was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He is applying for a second loan of 50,000 KES, which he plans to use to buy a stock of serving plates, tea cups, teaspoons and food (such as potatoes, onions, wheat flour, etc.), which he would use in his business. Daniel will use the anticipated profit to help pay the school fees for his children. 

In the future, Daniel hopes to grow his business and own a well-established hotel.

loans.use: To buy a stock of food and utensils for his cafe.

loans.name: Rogelyn

texts.en:
Rogelyn is married with three children. Rogelyn is 35 years old and lives in Gumbil, Tudela.

Rogelyn is a farmer and raises livestock to earn a living. Rogelyn has been doing this for six years. Rogelyn has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase feed for her livestock business. 

Rogelyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rogelyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock business

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Abir from Aberdeen western area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of eight and eighteen, who are currently attending school. In 2009, Abir established her general merchandise business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income to support her family. She works at the business every day except holidays. At present, she faces high transportation costs to move her goods from town to her store.
Abir requires a loan in order to buy more provisions such as eggs, milk, rice, and sugar. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, Abir plans to expand her business further. She thanks you for your support.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Abir from Sierra Leone

loans.use: to buy more provisions, such as eggs, milk, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
Willian es un hombre de 36 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene un pequeño hijo de 10 años, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres, Willian no pudo terminar sus estudios secundarios, le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo para poder estudiar la carrea profesional de Mecánica Automotriz, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las calles de su ciudad y en alguna de estas ocasiones come un riquísimo Caldo de Gallina, el cual es su plato favorito.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Willian brinda servicios como electricista, especialmente de mototaxis, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por la calidad en sus servicios y por los buenos precios que brinda a sus clientes.
Willian se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una mototaxi, la cual le servirá de mucho para que adicionalmente trabaje en ella brindando servicios de transporte; de esta manera Willian seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para ampliar su negocio y así desea lograr su gran sueño de darle una buena educación a su pequeño para que algún día pueda verlo convertido en un buen profesional en un hombre de bien.

loans.use: Para realizar la compra de una mototaxi.

loans.name: Luisa Gladys

texts.es:
Luisa es una mujer de 50 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con sus cuatro hijas, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es madre y padre para sus hijas; gracias a su esfuerzo Luisa pudo estudiar pequeños cursos de repostería, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar y en alguna de estas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luisa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de pasteles, como queques, flanes, alfajores y otros, ella trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Luisa se encuentra muy agradecida, con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una pequeña refrigerado y una vitrina, los cuales le servirán de mucho para acondicionar mejor su negocio e iniciar ventas de bebidas en la época de verano, así pues Luisa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propia pastelería.
texts.en: Luisa is 50 years old and lives in the city of Canete, in the district of Imperial, with her four children whom she loves and who are the focus of her life.  She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of her efforts to raising her family, because she is both mother and father to her children.  Thanks to her efforts Luisa has been able to take some confectionery courses.  In her free time she likes to cook, and sometimes cooks a delicious "carapulcra con sopa seca" [a Peruvian pork and potato stew with spaghetti] to share with her family.  On her own initiative, and with great effort and dedication, Luisa works in her small cake business selling products such as cakes, flan, cookies and others.  She works every day starting early in the morning, and can work for about 8 hours.  She is happy doing her work and believes that it is going well because of the good flavors of her products and the friendly service that she provides to her customers.  Luisa is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the help that they are providing, because with it she will be able to buy a small fridge and a display case which will improve her business and allow her to start selling drinks in summer.  In this way she will be able to continue working and trying to get ahead, to achieve her great dream of having her own cake shop.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and a display case.

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr: La   dame   Aissatou    est  une  sénégalaise   qui séjourne  dans le pays   depuis   longtemps.  Elle  évolue   dans   le  secteur   du  commerce.  Son   activité   consiste   à  vendre   du  mil  et  des  fruits.  Avec  ce  premier  crédit   de  200000 frs,  elle  veut  renforcer  son stock et    augmenter   sa  marge   bénéficiaire .   Elle a  une  expérience   de  20 ans   dans   ce  domaine.   Les   bénéfices que lui génère son   activité  lui  permettent  de    diversifier  les   produits  qu’elle commercialise,  d’épargner  davantage  et   d’améliorer  les  conditions  alimentaires  de  sa  famille. Son   projet   futur est d’obtenir  une cantine.

loans.use: acheter du mil et des fruits a revendre

loans.name: V. Florence Marline Sylvia 1

texts.fr: V. Florence Marline Sylvia 1 âgée de 39 ans, a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. V. Florence Marline Sylvia 1 est mariée à un maintenancier du nom de Auguste. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. V. Florence Marline Sylvia 1 vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportée par le couple.  Pour cette raison, V. Florence Marline Sylvia 1 vend a son domicile et par la méthode de distribution, du charbon de bois et des amuses gueule. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. V. Florence Marline Sylvia 1 achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, V. Florence Marline Sylvia 1 sollicite pour une deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieurs a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du charbon de bois et des amuses gueule.

loans.name: Nieves Violeta

texts.es:
Nieves es una mujer trabajadora de 46 años, goza de la compañía de sus 6 menores hijos, la mayoría en etapa escolar. Cuenta con la compañía de su esposo Alejandro, en quien siempre ha encontrado un apoyo incondicional. Se dedican a la producción de mantequilla, queso y otros productos lácteos orgánicos con su propio ganado vacuno que es alimentado con alfalfa orgánica.
Ellos en su localidad de Coracora que esta ubicada en Ayacucho, llevan mas de 20 años de experiencia en su trabajo y es por ello que los pobladores gustan de sus productos naturales orgánicos. Nieves solicita el préstamo para comprar semilla de alfalfa mejorada y de calidad; también dará mantenimiento a su pequeño terreno agrícola, comprara abono orgánico que venden en su propia localidad que es producido por el excremento de cuyes. Nieves en el futuro solo espera poder darle comodidad y estabilidad económica a su gran familia.

loans.use: Para comprar semilla de alfalfa mejorada y de calidad

loans.name: Rex

texts.en: Rex is a farmer from the town of San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. He is married with one child. He has been in the farming business for five years. This is the main source of his income. Rex is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for his rice production. With this loan, He will be able to improve the productivity of his farm and thus he can harvest as many as they can. In the future, Rex hopes to make his farming business more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for rice production.

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
My name is Sara L. and I have been selling flip flops and sandles in my own store for the last four years. My business allows me to suppot my family, my clients are very nice and I have already sold my products in various points of sale at the market in the capital city. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to increase sales and use the profits to renovate my home and provide my three sons with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Sara L. me dedico a la venta de chancletas y sandalias, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que yo reparto mi productos en diferentes puestos de venta del mercado de la capital, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que tenga poder remodelar mi casa y darles un buen estudio a mis tres hijos.

loans.use: Buy sandals, flip flops

loans.name: Bi

texts.en:
Bi is now 47, and Tu is her husband. They have a small house in the countryside with no land. Her husband raises pigs and fish but their income is still only $10/person/month.

They have three children; 2 daughters and a son. Ngoc Han, their oldest daughter, wants to attend university. Their other daughter is working in the city to help support her family. Their son is mentally retarded and must be cared for at home.

Bi needs a loan of $75 to use for her grocery store at home and to help her husband raise fish and pigs. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: Bi needs a loan so that she can sell some things in her grocery store at home and for her husband to raise fish

loans.name: Khuraman

texts.en: Khuraman B. lives in Beylagan and sells women's clothes from a small booth she rents in the Beylagan city bazaar. Her husband helps her buy the clothes she sells there. During 2001-2006, Khuraman took out 6 loans from Normicro Beylagan Branch totaling $2500. Now she is asking for a loan of $1000 to expand the range of goods she offers for sale.

loans.use: To diversify inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes for her inventory

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Mr. Jalal is a vulnerable, low income person.  He is 23 and lives with his people in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Jalal owns a herd of cows.  Every day he grazes the cows starting early in the morning while his mother sells milk in Saatli town.  He started this business as a child because milk selling is their family business.  The work is quite profitable, but takes a lot of time and effort.  There is a need to widen the cow-shed.  It is not so expensive, but Jalal has no money to provide for this project.  That is why he has applied to Normicro Saatli branch to get a $500 loan.  If he could make his cow-shed bigger, he could have more pedigree cows, and hence, a higher income.

loans.use: To widen his cow-shed and increase his business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Doña Lourdes lives in 192, street "c" in the area of Rio Seco in the town of El Alto.

She is divorced and lives with her two sons, 16 and 1 year of age.

The loan will be used to buy raw material for the preparation of dow and special kinds of bread which is being sold in the area where she lives.

It is the first loan granted to Doña Lourdes by Impro, and the socio-economic evaluation qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Lourdes vive en el plan 192 calle “c” de la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

La señora es divorciada y vive junto a sus dos hijos de 16 y 1 años respectivamente.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de mercadería, pues ella se dedica a la elaboración de masas y panes especiales, los cuales los comercializa en la zona en la que vive.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación socioeconómica realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for the preparation of dow for a specialized bakery.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 45 year old father of 6 who lives with his family in the Bekaa region of Lebanon. Ali owns a van which he uses for all kinds of transportation. Ali is depending on this business to provide for his family. Ali is requesting a loan for the maintenance of his van, which needs to be fixed in order to continue to run efficiently.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance costs of his van

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr Kokou Z. as an entrepreneur selling coffee and cocoa. He is 38 years old, is married and a father of 06 children. He has worked in this sector for almost 4 years. In spite of the large size of his family, he manages to support all their needs with his business income. This loan will allow Mr Kokou to pay his suppliers in time, to expand his business to other areas and to rent a store for the storage of his goods. Mr Kokou is the man in the picture dressed in dark blue.

Monsieur Kokou Z. est un commerçant de produits café et cacao. Agé de 38 ans, il est marié et père de 06 enfants. Il détient ce secteur depuis bientôt 04 ans. Malgré la taille importante de sa famille, il arrive à supporter toutes ses charges rien que par les revenus issus de son activité. Ce crédit permettra à monsieur Kokou de régler à temps ses fournisseurs, de conquérir d’autres zones et de louer un magasin pour le stockage de ses marchandises. Monsieur Kokou est celui habillé en tenue provisoire de couleur indigo.

loans.use: Purchase of 3 tons of cocoa and 2 of tons coffee for resale to the international exporters

loans.name: Ipah

texts.en: Ipah, 33, is a mother of 3 children, ages 14, 5, and 1. Every day, she goes around the villages, door-to-door, selling cosmetics, such as powder, perfume, and shampoo, and is earning $4 a day. Her husband, A., sells fried bean sprouts at the market and earns $30 each week. She is a member of MBK and she is asking for a loan of $100 to expand both of their businesses. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel M. C. does everything he can to provide for his 4 children. 20 years ago he and his wife had their first child. From then on Manuel worked welding doors and windows. Little by little he learned this trade and generated the income needed to pay for home expenses. From there Manuel and his wife went on to have 3 more kids.

Thanks to Manuel's hard work, his family has been able to move forward. Nevertheless there is still much ground to cover. For this reason Manuel is asking for a $750 loan, which he will repay in 6 months. With the money he will be able to buy a new welding machine. This way he will be able to provide customers with better service. With your help Manuel will be able to support and empower his family.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Manuel M. C. es padre de familia de 4 pequeños a quienes desea brindarles siempre lo mejor. Hace 20 años que su esposa quedó embarazada. Fue como Manuel comenzó a dedicarse a soldar puertas y ventanas. Poco a poco se fue dando a conocer y de ese trabajo sacó dinero para poder pagar los gastos de su casa y los que iban surgiendo con el nacimiento de sus otros 3 hijos.

Gracias a esta labor que realiza Manuel es por lo que ha podido salir adelante su familia. Sin embargo queda mucho camino por recorrer y es por eso que Manuel está solicitando un crédito de US $750 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Manuel podrá comprar una máquina para soldar nueva para poder ofrecerles mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Manuel logrará sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanjuma is 47 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 25,24,23 and 20 years. Mwanajuma is a business woman. She started in 1998. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is married with 4 children. She is 45 years old and has been running her business for 8 years, and it is the only source of income for her family. With her previous loan from Kiva, her capital and profits increased. She paid her children’s school fees for this year in cash, unlike before the loan, when she used to pay the fees in installments. She is able to meet her children’s school requirements without as much difficulty as before the loan. She is very grateful and would like an additional loan to expand and diversify her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of jewels and lotions

loans.name: Ezinah

texts.en:
Ezinah is a nurse/widwife who serves clients mostly from the Manyatta slums of Kisumu. She is the proprietor of Mt Everest Medical Clinic. She offers general curative services, family planning, counseling, and maternal and child health services, and also runs a pharmacy and laboratory.
