Ezinah requires $1200.00 to enable her to improve on quality of services in her facility.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To improve the quality of services in her clinic.

loans.name: Sonia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Sonia is a married, 33 year-old woman. She is a small merchant who has a store in her house. She lives in Colonia Máximo Jérez in the city of Managua. Sonia's husband works in a free-trade zone in the city. This small family plans to improver their quality of life, for which they work for daily.

Although Sonia has been working in her store for the last two years, sometimes she still struggles to sell her merchandise, which makes it difficult to make ends meet. Sonia also sells food on Sundays to augment her income. Sonia wants to expand her business, because of which she is asking for a loan to buy shoes to sell in her store, and raw materials to make the food she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Sonia es una mujer de 33 años de edad, está casada. Es una pequeña comerciante que tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación. Habita en la Colonia Máximo Jérez de la ciudad de Managua. El esposo de Sonia trabaja en una zona franca de la ciudad. Los planes de esta pequeña familia es poder mejorar su nivel de vida y para eso luchan diariamente.

Sonia tiene dos años de haber empezado el negocio de la pulpería, aunque en ocasiones presenta ventas bajas y eso le dificulta su situación económica. Como actividad Sonia también desarrolla la venta de comida los días domingos y así poder generar más ingresos. Sonia quiere empezar a crecer, es por eso que solicita el préstamo, para compra de zapatos para venderlos en la pulpería y compra también de materia prima para la elaboración de comidas.

loans.use: Purchase shoes and raw materials to sell in her store.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is a member of the communal bank “Nobleza”.

Julia is partnered, is 23 years old, and has an 8-month old son. Julia lives in the Santa Elena neighborhood at her parents’ home. Julia has a stand at the market in her neighborhood where, with the help of her sister-in-law, she sells groceries, cereals and a variety of candy. In addition, Julia sells natural products such as medicines and nutritional supplements by catalog and offers them for sale to friends and neighbors.

Julia needs a loan of 2,600 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, barley, wheat and garbanzo.

Julia’s dreams include having her own home, buying a car, expanding her grocery stand and providing a good education for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.

Julia es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo pequeño de 8 meses, Julia vive en el barrio de Santa Elena en la casa de sus padres, Julia tiene un puesto en el mercado de su barrio en donde vende abarrotes, cereales, golosinas variadas, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su cuñada. Además Julia vende productos naturales como medicinas, nutrientes que vende por catalogo que ofrece a sus amigos, vecinos.

Julia necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, leche, cebada, trigo y garbanzo.

Los sueños des Julia son tener casa propia, comprar un carro , ampliar su kiosco y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.

loans.use: Julia needs a loan of 2,600 soles, funds that she will invest into the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, oil, milk, barley, wheat and garbanzo.

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en: Abiba A. is 30 years old and a mother of two children who are currently in school. Abiba sells used clothing in Ghana, where there is a very big market for them, as brand new clothes are too expensive for the economically active poor. Abiba is asking for a loan to buy more bales of used clothing and increase her inventory. She believes this loan will help her to save for her children's future and also to rent a store for her business.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Faafouina

texts.en:
Faafouina T., 24, is married with two children. She has many years of experience in the foodstall business. She sells to the village and public six days per week. 

She has tow previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Faafouina's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. 

The loan will be used to buy goods for the store such as snack food, canned food and freezers. Her husband is helping her run the business.

loans.use: To buy goods for the shop and a freezer

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Mrs. Pen D. is a farmer in Sen Born Village in Takeo Province while her husband, Mr. Nguon Ngoan, is a chicken breeder. They have four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining two are attending the local school.

Their house lacks a protective fence, so Pen is requesting a loan to purchase cement and pay the construction costs. She hopes that she and her family will live in greater safety as a result of this loan. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy cement and pay fthe construction costs of a protective fence.

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr:
Née le 28 janvier 1970 à Lomé, madame W. Martine est une fille célibataire avec deux (2) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de boisson locale qu’elle-même prépare avec du sorgho, de l’eau et avec du bois de chauffe. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 1993 et a beaucoup de clients qui sont généralement des cultivateurs et des menuisiers.
Toutefois cette boisson est appréciée par la plupart des gens surtout en période de fête. 
Elle sollicite  ce premier crédit pour acheter deux (2) sacs de sorgho et 5 fagots de bois de chauffe.
texts.en:
Born on January 28, 1970 in Lomé, Mrs. Martine W. is a single mother of two. She sells a local drink that she makes herself from sorghum and water with the aid of firewood. She has been doing this since 1993 and has a lot of customers, mainly farmers and carpenters.Nevertheless, most people enjoy this drink, especially during festive periods. She is requesting a first-time loan to buy two bags of sorghum and five bundles of firewood.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereal and firewood

loans.name: Adalgisa Bido Nuñez Group
loans.use: To establish a women's clothing shop/business

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 36 year old woman living in Bourj el Barajneh, a southern suburb of Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Nidal has been working as a home hairdresser for eleven years. Nidal decided on opening her ownbusiness because she likes her work. Nidal's clients are her friends and neighbors. To make more money, she plans on opening a salon. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase tools for her business and to open a salon. This is the first time that Nidal has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase hairdressing tools and to open a salon.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou W. est célibataire avec 02 enfants en charge. Elle s’active dans la restauration. Elle souhaiterait avec ce prêt renforcer son activité et augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux améliorer les conditions de vie familiales.
texts.en:
Fatou W. is unmarried and has two children to support. She is active in the restaurant business. She would like to use this loan to enhance her business and to increase her revenues, so as to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her restaurant business

loans.name: Rosa Elia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elia P. Ramírez es empleada de maquiladora, tiene 20 años laborando para la misma empresa; ella tiene a su cargo un nieto que le dejo uno de sus hijos porque el ya no quiso hacerse cargo de el. La señora Rosa Elia P. cuenta con una discapacidad Labio leporino.
Toda su vida ha vivido en una casa que le presto su hermano, ella siente que ya es tiempo de adquirir su propia vivienda por un lado todo su esfuerzo y ganas de prosperar son por el nieto que al ver que esta creciendo necesita su espacio y un sustento para el futuro.
El tipo de vivienda que va adquirir es de interés social esta se le va descontando vía nomina por un lapso de 20 años pero para iniciar tramites piden una cantidad que ella por el momento no cuenta el efectivo.
texts.en:
Rosa Elia P. Ramírez is an employee of a maquiladora factory and has been working for the same company for 20 years. She takes care of a grandson, which one of her children left her because they no longer wanted to be responsible for him. Rosa Elia P. has a disability, a cleft lip. For her entire life she has lived in a house that her brother loaned her. She feels that it is time she gets her own home, on the one hand all of her efforts to succeed are for her grandson and seeing that he is growing up he needs his space and a means of support for the future. The type of house she is going to buy is social housing, which will be deducted from her pay over 20 years, but to start the paperwork they ask for an amount of money which she does not currently have.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase housing.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor cuenta con 24 años de edad, vive hace 4 años con la madre de sus dos hijos en una casa que le dieron a cuidar. En pareja se dedican al tejido de mantas, las cuales venden de acuerdo al grosor y la combinación de colores. Hace un año, unos clientes le solicitaron tapices, y Víctor cumplió con el pedido, pero él prefiere elaborar mantas, ya que los tapices requieren de mucho tiempo en la combinación de colores, y dice ganar igual. Lo que él desea es aumentar su producción para incrementar sus ingresos económicos para el bienestar de su familia. Víctor viene trabajando por 3ra vez consecutiva con MFP, en todo este tiempo no ha tenido problemas de morosidad, asimismo hace compromiso de seguir con la misma puntualidad en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de un nuevo telar, para que su esposa ya no solo le apoye, sino produzca sus propias mantas, y ambos capten mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Victor is 24 years old and has lived for 4 years with the mother of his two children in a house that was given to them to look after. The couple works in the weaving of blankets which they sell according to their thickness and combination of colors. For a year, some customers have asked for tapestries and Victor satisfies these requests, but he prefers to produce blankets because tapestries require a lot of time and color combinations, and earn the same amount. What he wants is to increase his production to increase his income for the benefit of his family. This is Victor's 3rd consecutive time working with MFP, and in all that time he has not had problems with bad debt, and he has made a commitment to continue with the same timely payments. The money that he is asking for is for the purchase of a new loom, so that his wife can offer support, producing her own blankets, and so they can gain more income.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new loom

loans.name: Sa'ed

texts.en:
Sa’ed A. is a loving husband and father. In pursuit of a better quality of life and to obtain the necessary resources for his wife and his son, he decided to begin his own business. So he started to sell fruit and vegetables. This business is in a strategic location and is rapidly generating a very good income.

Sa’ed has applied for a loan of $1,200 to purchase greater volumes of fruit and vegetables.

He and his family greatly appreciate the trust and support that you offer them. Today is the time to help.

loans.use: To purchase greater volumes of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Tursunboy

texts.ru: Турсунбой - 59 лет. У него есть жена и 8 детей. Пятеро сына и три дочери. Старшие сыновья уехали в Россию для работы. Работая там, они высылают деньги родителям. Родители копят высланные деньги, чтобы потом потратить их на женитьбу сыновей и замужество дочерей. Дочери помогают по хозяйству. Жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Она сама ездит на рынок, чтобы продать их. Турсунбой пасет скот в горах и возвращается очень поздно. Он взял кредит в нашей организации, чтобы увеличить количество скота. Теперь он наш клиент.
texts.en:
Tursunboy is 59 years old. He has a wife and eight children, five sons and three daughters. The older sons went to Russia to work. Working there they send money to the parents. The parents save the sent money in order to spend it on the marriages of their sons and daughters. The daughters help around the house. The wife processes yarn. She travels to the market herself in order to sell it. Tursunboy takes the livestock out to pasture in the mountains and returns very late. He took out a loan in order to increase his livestock count. Now he is our client.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock count

loans.name: Juan Arnoldo

texts.es: El Señor Juan P. de 34 años de edad,  casado de oficios Sastre, “Elaboración de Pantalones” cuenta con un taller de 4 maquinas,  habita conjuntamente con su esposa,  desde su niñez se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los préstamos  a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Xerachochac, Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan P. is 34 years old, married, and lives with his wife. He is a tailor by profession who specializes in making pants, and has a tailoring workshop with 4 machines. Since childhood he has worked making handicrafts, and thanks to loans he has been able to help his family get ahead. Juan is very well known in Paraje Xerachochac, Totonicapán, Guatemala, where he lives. He is asking the Asdir Association for a loan so he can purchase raw material for making pants. This will allow Juan to meet the demand of his clientele and thus help him improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (purchasing raw material)

loans.name: Phann

texts.en:
Mrs. Phann S., 57, has had a farming job since early 2000. She always grows vegetable crops to sell in the local market. Normally, she retails her mature crops two months after she plants them. She is married to Keit Bunthon, 67, who works with her in the farm work. This humble older couple has four children: two are single and the others are married. All four of their children are employed at different jobs and have provided their income to better meet their family’s food needs.

Phann S. is requesting a loan in order to help support her children’s businesses since they are lacking capital to make their businesses more successful.

loans.use: To help support her children’s businesses

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia A. is thirty–five years old. She is divorced and has five children - four sons and one daughter. All are currently in the primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Leticia is a food vendor. She roasts and sells ripped plantain, yam and fresh maize. She roasts and sells on a coal pot by the road side. She wants a loan to buy food stuffs in bulk. Leticia buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for nine years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy plantain, yam and fresh maize

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.en:
Y. Ulugbek is 33 years old, and married with three children. He is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the cultivation and sale of livestock at the local market. Every year, Ulugbek buys young heifers from farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. Now Ulugbek is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest in a loan of 4000 TJS for his business. In order to receive this amount, Ulugbek has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Rosa Fernando

texts.pt:
Rosa Fernando M. nasceu na cidade de maputo, tem 44 anos de idade e mãe de 4 filhos todos a estudar excepto o mais novo que tem 2 anos. Estudou apenas ate 2 classe tendo parado por falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. Cresceu na companhia da sua mãe porque o pai abandonara há bastante tempo tendo deixado a família num mar de dificuldades.

Vive na casa própria e não tem parentes sob sua responsabilidade.
Iniciou a actividade de venda de diversos produtos para sobrevivência da família e o negocio foi crescendo ate que há mais de dez anos começou a vender cadeiras plásticas no seu quintal e mais tarde conseguiu um espaço num local estratégico para o negocio (na terminal dos transportes inter provinciais na cidade).

Adquire o produto na África do sul a 168,00MT cada cadeira e vende a 230,00MT onde consegue um rendimento diário no valor de 1.000,00MT e não poupa.
Nunca teve empréstimo com outras instituições e este é o seu primeiro com Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 12.000,00MT para compra e venda de cadeiras.
Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para no futuro construir uma casa de material convencional.
texts.en:
Rosa Fernando M. was born in Maputo, she is 44 years old and has 4 children who are all studying, the youngest one is 2 years old. She studied until the 2nd grade and had to stop because of lack of financial resources. She grew with her mother because her father left them leaving the family in a sea of difficulties. She lives in her own house and has no relatives under her responsibility. She started selling diverse products in order to support her family and the business started growing and after 10 years she started selling plastic chairs at her place and then she got a store in an strategic place for business (at the inter provincial transportation terminal in the city). Rosa gets her products in South Africa at 168,00MT each and sells them at 230,00MT she obtains a daily profit of 1.000,00MT and doesn't save. She never had credit with other institutions and this is her first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema for 12.000,00MT to buy chairs. She expects to pay the credit without any problems to get new ones in the future to build a house with regular materials.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plastic chairs

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba Q., from the city of Dapitan, is a 37-year-old married mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Melba owns and operates a general store whose main source of income comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Melba has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Melba joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering, Melba is now requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This loan will be her seventh from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en: Veronicah M. is the 42-year-old single mother of two children. She lives in Shanzu, Mombasa where she runs a restaurant and she has been in the business for fourteen years. Veronicah was introduced to KADET by an existing client and this is her first loan. She intends to repair her restaurant and purchase more stock for her business. Her main customers are tourists who come to the beach in Mombassa and residents of Shanzu. In the future Veronicah hopes to establish another restaurant in Shanzu to maximize her income. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To repair her restaurant and to increase her stock

loans.name: Concepcion Del Rosario

texts.es: Concepción del Rosario M. V. con la edad de 36 años, tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000. Ella tiene 4 hijos a su cargo que actualmente están estudiando gracias al gran sacrificio de Concepción. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que humildemente se gana de esta manera el pan de cada día. Por lo que sus inicios se dan porque su esposo le ayudo a establecer este negocio con muy pocos recursos ya que tenían que proporcionarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar y alimento diario, por lo que con el apoyo de ambos logran salir adelante. El financiamiento que actualmente solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas, granos básicos. Su deseo es que su familia permanezca unida para seguir trabajando.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en: H., 39, lives in the rural area of Pursat province, where she has owned a small plot of land since 1979. She grows rice and has two crops per year, in both the dry and rainy seasons. She is married and has two teenage children who attend school. Her husband, Kosal, 31, works with her in the farming business and this is their main source of income. Because the rainy season is coming, H. needs a loan of $400 USD to buy her nearby neighbor's farmland, on which she will plant rice.

loans.use: To buy her nearby farmland to plant rice

loans.name: Dolores De La Concepción

texts.es:
En una de las calles del departamento de León, la señora Dolores C. se ha destacado por ser una vendedora de frutas y de bebidas ofreciéndolas a sus clientes que a diario visitan el local.

A pesar que el local donde ella se encuentra no presenta las condiciones necesarias para llevar a cabo la actividad, ella busca la manera de cómo mejorar su situación y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito con el que comprará las frutas y las verduras para posteriormente ofrecerlas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
On one of the department of León's streets, Dolores has stood out as a fruit and beverage salesperson offering them to her customers who daily visit her site. Despite the fact that the locale in which she operates does not have the necessary conditions to carry out this activity, she still seems to find the way to better her situation and for this she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy the fruits and vegetables which she will then offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and beverages.

loans.name: Licet Marina

texts.es:
Licet Marina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mariscalense”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 44 años y 06 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida y hace dos años que por iniciativa propia Licet se dedica a la venta de leña, en sus inicios nos cuenta que le fue un poco bajo en sus ventas, pero con el tiempo ya sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, conocieron su negocio y sus ventas empezaron a aumentar progresivamente. 

Se inicio con S/. 300.00 y poco  a poco  fue ahorrando, luego acondicionó un lugar en su casa para almacenar la leña y así poder mostrar a sus clientes y moradores de la Ciudad.
 
Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará 180 tercios de leña. Parte del dinero utilizará para construir un pequeño tambo y así evitar que la lluvia le siga afectando su negocio. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Licet Marina is a member of the Mariscalense Communal Bank, which is located in the District of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres Province, Department of San Martín. She is 44 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 6 children of whom 2 are still dependents.

She previously sold food, but two years ago, she decided to sell firewood instead. Sales were slow at first. Over time her friends, neighbors, and relatives learned about her business and her sales began to increase steadily. Licet started her business with initial capital of 300 soles. She was able to accumulate a bit of savings so that she could remodel a space in her house to store wood that she could supply to her customers and other residents of the city.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy 180 bundles of firewood. Part of the money will be used to build a small storage shed since rain can have a negative impact on her business.

Today Licet feels she is a very accomplished woman. She has even more desire to accomplish her dreams. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and supporting many more women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bundles of firewood & build a storage shed

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Yat B. is the group leader of four who all live in Ta Skor village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he grows vegetables.

Mr. Yat B.’s wife, Mrs. Kong Neang, is a fruit seller. The couple has two children, one of whom is a fruit seller while another is too young to work or study.

Now Mr. Yat B. is requesting a loan to buy more fruit to resell to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for his wife to resell

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
La señora Hilaria es socia del  Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes. 

El grado de instrucción de la señora Hilaria es primaria completa y tiene 4 hijos.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años.  Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de mercadería.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de abarrotes como: azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener una tienda bien implementada en su casa para así ya no ir al mercado.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y la puntualidad de las demás socias
texts.en:
Hilaria is a member of the "3 de mayo" ("May 3rd") Communal Bank and lives in Ilave District, El Collao Province, Puno Department, Peru. She is 50 years old and married, and works buying and selling basic grains and grocery items. She has completed primary school, and has four children. Hilaria has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past four years. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian Soles, and she used it to buy more merchandise. She is currently requesting a loan of 1200 Peruvian Soles to buy dry goods like rice, sugar, pasta, etc. Her dream for the future is to have her own fully stocked store at home, so that she doesn't have to go out to sell at the market. Her favorite part of her Communal Bank is her savings account, and the fact that her fellow group members are always punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, pasta and eggs

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
Clemente tiene 41 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. 
Desde hace 9 años comenzó su negocio de venta de madera, la cual extrae de árboles de eucalipto. Para ello, contrata peones para realizar la labor en menor tiempo, usando una motosierra como su principal instrumento de trabajo.

Con esta madera elabora puntales y mangos para diferentes herramientas, y también la vende por trozos (leña). Con este trabajo logra obtener los ingresos necesarios para los gastos de su familia.
Adicionalmente, Clemente también cultiva papa y maíz, productos con los que obtiene ingresos adicionales durante la época de cosecha, cada año. 

Este es su 14avo crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, él siempre se ha mostrado muy comprometido en las tareas que le encomiendan en su banco comunal, por lo que es muy estimado en su grupo. Además renueva su compromiso de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará madera al por mayor y pagará el transporte de ésta hasta su taller.
texts.en:
Clemente is 41 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in their own house. 9 years ago he started his business selling wood, which he extracts from Eucalyptus trees. To do that, he hires workers to carry out the job in less time, using a chainsaw as his primary work tool. With this wood he crafts wooden props and handles for different tools; he also sells it by piece (firewood). Through this work he is able to obtain the necessary income to cover family expenses. Additionally, Clemente also plants potatoes and corn, which allows him he obtains extra income during each year’s harvest season. This is his 14th loan through Microfinanzas Prisma. He has demonstrated that he is very committed to the tasks assigned to him by his communal bank, for which he is highly regarded by his group. In addition, he renews his commitment to pay his loan quotas on time. With the money that he is currently requesting he will purchase wood wholesale and pay for its transport to his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 30-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife. Abass has been selling home products for the past three years. He sells shampoos, perfumes, deodorant, tissues, washing products, and lots more. His shop is very well located on a main street in a popular neighborhood. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. 

Abass requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his shop and to expand his stock. This is the first time that Abass has requested a loan.

When Abass first started his business, he didn’t have enough cash to expand his stock and diversify his merchandise. He decided to start his business because he wanted to work independently and he liked retail sales. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es una joven alegre y amorosa de 21 años, se acaba de casar con Gabriel, de 27 años, ambos tienen un hijo de un año quien es el motor que los empuja a salir adelante. Ellos viven en una casa alquila da en una zona de la sierra central del Perú.

Todos los días, desde muy temprano, ella es la encargada de preparar los alimentos que llevará a los terrenos donde trabaja al lado de su esposo. Pese a dedicarse a la agricultura diariamente, no se cansa, pues tiene12 años sembrando papa, arveja y maíz, productos bastante solicitados en el mercado, por lo que le es rentable comercializarlos rápidamente y a buenos precio.
Además, las ganancias obtenidas le permiten ahorrar, pues más adelante desea instalar una tienda de comestibles a pocos metros del lugar donde vive, en un espacio que alquilará en busca de progreso. 

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y sabe que cada crédito le ayuda a mejorar su situación económica, también dice que trabajar con su banco comunal le gusta y le ayuda mucho. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería (productos de primera necesidad) para implementar e inaugurar su tienda.
texts.en:
Miriam is a cheerful and loving young woman who is 21 years old, and is about to marry Gabriel, 27. Together they have a 1 year-old son , and he is the engine that drives them to succeed. They live in a rented house in a neighborhood in the central highlands of Peru. Every day, from very early in the morning, she is in charge of preparing food that she will take to the fields where she works along with her husband. In spite of working daily in agriculture, she does not tire. She has been cultivating potatoes, peas and corn for 12 years. There is substantial demand for these products in the market, so it is profitable to sell them quickly and at a good price. In addition, the earnings she obtains allow her to save, because later on she would like to establish a grocery store a few yards from the place that she lives, in a space that she will rent in search of progress. This is the 6th loan that she has taken with MFP, and she knows that every loan helps her to improve her economic situation. In addition, she says that it has been very helpful to her to work with her communal bank, which she likes very much. The money that she requests now will be used to purchase merchandise (basic necessities) to set up and start up her store.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to set up her new grocery store

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: Este empresario tiene 40 años, por lo que siempre se ha encargo de su actividad económica,  el tiene 1 hijos por el cual velar y proporcionarle lo necesario. El se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general y una pulpería, el siempre ha buscado la forma de salir adelante y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, el inicio este negocio con su compañera de vida que le ayudo a volver realidad su idea. Además Juan con el poco capital que obtuvo con su financiamiento anterior logro establecer una pequeña pulpería en su  vivienda ya que es un hombre que realiza sacrificios para obtener ingresos necesarios. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de productos de su pulpería.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is forty years old and has been working his whole life. He has one son who depends on him for his necessities. He owns and runs a general store. He has always sought ways to prosper and improve his family's quality of life. He started this business with his life partner who helped him realize this life-long dream. Additionally, Juan used the small amount of capital he received from his previous loan to open a small general store out of his home. He is a man who makes sacrifices in order to gain his necessary income. This loan he his seeking is for working capital that will be used to buy goods for his general store.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital - inventory

loans.name: Sarem

texts.en: P. Sarem, 43, is a widow who lives with her three children in the Takeo province. She and the children are professional tailors. On average, they make a combined income of US $5 per day. Every month, she spends US $45 on food, US $5 on utilities and about US $10 on transportation. P. Sarem would like a loan of US $700 to purchase sewing machines, allowing her and her daughters to begin a business in her home. (P. Sarem is pictured with her sister.)

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines.

loans.name: Lisandro

texts.es:
Lisandro M. Ocampos, es taxista, la ubicación de su parada está en una zona estratégica del centro de la ciudad.
El crédito que solicita es para inversiones de mantenimiento y mejoramiento de sus unidades de vehículo, que utiliza para el servicio de Taxi.
Lisandro M. Ocampos, es cliente de Fundación Paraguaya desde hace tiempo y se siente muy satisfecho por la atención que le brinda la institución, por la rapidez, la calidez y el buen trato de los empleados.
texts.en:
Lisandro M. Ocampos is a taxi driver. His stand is located in a strategic part of the city's downtown area. The loan he is asking for is for investment in the maintenance and improvement of the vehicle which he uses for his taxi service. Lisandro M. Ocampos has been a customer of Fundación Paraguaya for some time and is very satisfied with the service he receives from the institution, thanks to the promptness, warmth and politeness of its employees

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for vehicle

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen L., aged 36, is widowed and resides with her two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business selling cosmetic products, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the famiL.'s expenses. Their standard of living has improved since Sen L. has had this business. She is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more cosmetic products for resale. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo es un padre D. familia D. 43 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposa y al menor D. sus hijos D. cuatro años D. edad en el sector Nueva Jerusalen del distrito D. San Gregorio, en L. provincia D. San Miguel, región Cajamarca; una región ubicada en L. serranía del país, sus actividades principales son L. agricultura y L. minería.

Se dedica a L. agricultura desD. que era muy joven, empezó trabajando como peón agrícoL. en los campos D. cultivo cercanos y poco a poco pudo ahorrar el dinero suficiente para adquirir su terreno propio. Actualmente tiene sembrado maíz, el cultivo tiene quince dias D. sembrado y Gerardo desea trabajar arduamente para que este producto D. una buena produccción que le permita agenciarse D. los recursos necesarios con los cuales pueda sostener a su familia.

Su cultivo está siendo invadido por maleza y el desea realizar actividades D. limpieza D. terreno para que esta dificultad no perjudique el correcto desarrollo D. su cultivo, por ello se ha visto en L. necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que piena utilizar en el logro D. su objetivo.

Gerardo es una persona muy entregada a su familia y a su trabajo, su mayor anhelo es otorgarles una mejor calidad D. vida. Las personas que lo conocen siempre acuden a el cuando necesitan ayuda ya que lo consideran una persona D. confianza.
texts.en:
Gerardo is a 43-year-old father who lives together with his wife and his youngest child, age 4, in the Nueva Jerusalen sector of the San Gregorio district, in San Miguel province, Cajamarca region. This region is located in the highlands of the country, where the main economic activities are agriculture and mining. Gerardo has worked in agriculture since he was very young. He began working as an agricultural laborer on the farms near his home, and he was gradually able to save up enough money to acquire his own land. He is currently growing corn, which he planted 15 days ago. Gerardo is determined to work hard in order to reap a good harvest from this crop, which will allow him to obtain the necessary resources to support his family. His fields are being invaded by weeds and brush, and he wants to carry out some land clearing work so that this problem will not affect his crop. Because of this, he has seen the need to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, for 2000 Peruvian new soles. He plans to use the funds to achieve this objective. Gerardo is a person who is very devoted to his family and to his work. His greatest desire is to proviD. his family with a better quality of life. Those who know him always turn to him when they need help, because they consider him a reliable person.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance expenses for his corn fields

location.town: Nueva Jerusalen - San Gregorio - San Miguel - Caja

loans.name: Eutiquio

texts.en:
Eutiquio C. R. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 34 years old and single. To make a living, Eutiquio runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling snack food products in the local community. He is just starting this business.

In 2010, Eutiquio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Silvio José

texts.es:
El señor Silvio José M., tiene la edad de 48 años es casado y con sus dos hijos habitan en el Barrio Georgino Andrade, uno de sus hijos labora y le apoya económicamente a sus padres, El señor  labora como panadero, actividad que le ha producido problemas en su salud, pero es la principal fuente de ingresos de la familia, y tiene mucha popularidad en su barrio por la buena calidad de sus productos.

El negocio ha registrado muy buenos resultados,  razón por la cual ahora desea realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda, la edificación de un muro que le divida el área del patio con un cuarto, dará mejores condiciones de habitad y comodidades para todos. Con este préstamo realizara las compras de materiales de construcción necesarias para llevar a andar este proyecto, el apoyo que se le brinde aportara a mejorara día a día sus forma de vivir, en el pasado a tenido otros préstamos con Afodenic y dice sentirse complacido de obtener excelentes resultados que a la fecha han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones socio-económicas.
texts.en:
Silvio José M., 48, is married and has two children; they all live in Georgino Andrade neighborhood. One of his sons is employed and helps his parents out financially. Silvio is a baker, an occupation that has caused him some health problems, but it’s the family’s main source of income; he is very popular in his neighborhood due to the good quality of his products. The business has been having good results so he wants to make some home improvements; he’d like to build a wall to separate the yard from a bedroom which will provide better living conditions and more comfort for everyone. He will use the funds to buy building materials and supplies to do this project. Whatever help he gets will improve his day-to-day existence. He has had previous loans with Afodenic and he says that he is pleased with the excellent results which he’s had to date that have made it possible for him to improve his socio-economic conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in his house.

loans.name: Hélène

texts.fr: Née en 1982 à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique, S. Hélène est mariée à HOMEVO Mathieu, un maçon. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. La famille vit au quartier Dogoudo à Allada.Hélène assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Hélène n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a près de cinq ans que Hélène vend des tissus de façon ambulante à Allada. Hélène achète ses tissus à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, mais aussi à Allada. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à faire face sans grande difficulté, à ses différents besoins. Hélène a bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Hélène désire élever le niveau de son activité et accroître sa clientèle à travers ses produits. C'est pour cette raison que Hélène sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Hélène S. was born in 1982 in Allada, Atlantic Department, and is married to Mathieu HOMEVO, a mason. The couple has three children, out of whom some attend schools. The family lives in the Dogoudo neighborhood in Allada. Helène and her husband both ensure that the various family expenses are covered. Helène never attended school. For about five years, she's been selling fabrics as an ambulant saleswoman in Allada. She buys her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, but also in Allada. This business creates income that helps her provide for herself without many difficulties. Helène already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, which were repaid without problems. She would like to bolster her business and increase her clientele. For this reason, Helène is seeking a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 lengths of fabric

loans.name: Musuq Inti Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Musuq Inti que significa Nuevo Sol en quechua, inicia su quinto ciclo con 17 socias.
Julia es fiscal del Banco Comunal, es socia hace 2 ciclos y lo quemas le gusta es que le enseñaron a ser responsable y no ser pesimista, Julia es casada, tiene 4 hijos, una D. ellas ya termino la universidad y trabaja, 3 D. ellos están estudiando en la universidad, Julia tiene una panadería en su casa, tiene un horno D. leña, elabora panes típicos como biscochos, chapla, productos que reparte a las tiendas, para lo cual cuenta con un carro.
Además tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa que atienD. con la ayuda D. sus hijas en sus tiempos libres. También Julia siembra papa y quinua, que luego venD. en los mercados, negocio que piensa dejar D. realizar porque ya no es rentable.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. harina y manteca. 
Julia sueña con comprar un carro para realizar transporte urbano en la ciudad D. Ayacucho y que sus hijos sean profesionales. Julia desearía mas joven para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
“Musuq Inti” means “New Soles” (Peruvian currency) in the Quechua language. The Musuq Inti Community Bank is starting its fifth cycle, with 17 members. Julia has been a bank member for two cycles. She has always been taught to be responsible and positive. She’s married with four children—one has already finished university and entered the work force. The other three are still studying. Julia runs a bakery out of her home. She prepares traditional biscuits and chapla. She uses her car to distribute these products to stores. She also has a grocery store in her home. Her daughters help her run it in their spare time. Julia grows potatoes and quinoa, too, and sells it in markets. She may soon give up growing produce, though; it’s not profitable. Julia needs a loan of 600 soles for flour and butter. She hopes to one day buy a new car so that she can easily travel around Ayachuco. She wants to see her children become professionals, and she hopes to stay young so that she’ll be able to work for years to come.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flour and butter.

loans.name: Amen Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Petty trading like the sale of cosmetics is widespread in Ghana because it is easy to start. A large number of women wear make-up and use one cosmetic product or another to add beauty to their appearance. Different occasions define which make-up is appropriate for most of the women, making the sale of cosmetics a lucrative job for many women. 

Yaa is one of such entrepreneurs who have been selling cosmetics for the past ten years. She currently sells on a table top in the market, hoping that, one day, she will be able to grow her business into a cosmetics wholesale shop. She is excited to be taking the loan which she plans to invest in purchasing assorted cosmetics in bulk to serve her customers. She anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market.

Apart from being an entrepreneur, Yaa also provides support to her thirteen-year-old child in school, hoping that he will be able to enter university. Currently, Yaa is the group leader of “Amen” Trust Bank Group made up six members. The other members are mainly food traders and food processors.

loans.use: To purchase assorted cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Ngam Ntoh

texts.en:
Born in 1944, Ngam Ntoh E. has been having difficulties trying to raise business capital. He is married and has nine children.  He had tried borrowing money from other financial institutions but had problems of repayment due to high interest rates. He joined GHAPE in 2007. He has taken and repaid loans two times and he had no repayment problem.  He faces difficulties taking care of his family, especially when they are sick
The buy and sell of basic commodities is a very profitable trade in his community so he decided to obtain a loan from GHAPE in order to carry out this trade. He had received and repaid loans two times from GHAPE.

He knows he will succeed in the trade because he has been doing this trade for a very long time and has so many customers. He plans to expand in his trade by purchasing three bags of rice, three cartons of savon (soap), four cartons of tine tomatoes and five bags of salt. With profit from this business, he plans to carry out repairs on his uncompleted house, pay tuition fees and buy school needs for his children.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase rice, soap, tomatoes, salt and groundnuts.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is married and has a 4-year-old child. He is a businessman from Kamenka and owns a store selling spare vehicle parts and accessories. His store is located right in downtown Kamenka which makes it a popular stop for car owners. Ruslan finds an individual approach to each customer. He has much experience, having worked in this sphere of trade for eleven years. Currently, he has 50,000 - 60,000 UAH in turnover capital. 

Ruslan is requesting a 20,000 UAH loan to purchase additional merchandise such as tires, acoustic engineering systems and spares. His business is very popular in Ukraine where more and more people can afford to buy a car or get a car loan. One of Ruslan's long-term plans is to start a second store and open a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Radha

texts.en:
This is 56-year-old Radha S..  She is married and has two children who are 30 and 25 years old.  In 1990, she established her grocery shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid three loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to increase the store inventory.  In the future, Radha plans to capitalize more.  She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.  For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates.

loans.use: To increase the store inventory

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.en:
Eusebia V. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 52 years old. Eusebia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Eusebia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Eusebia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eusebia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Eusebia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eusebia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Eusebia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Oscar Javier

texts.es: Oscar Javier tiene 40 años, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de aires acondicionados. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita crédito con Fundación, pues ha sido muy beneficioso con su negocio.  Por lo que sus inicios se dan por la falta de ingresos en su hogar por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante el tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de soldaduras, aires comprimidos, alicates entre otras cosas. Su actividad económica es su mayor fuente de trabajo, el desea establecer un local con todas las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en: Oscar Javier is a 40-year-old man who provides air conditioning maintenance and repair services for a living. This is not his first time requesting a loan from Fundación as these loans have been very beneficial to his business. He started the business because of a lack of income, and because he needed to find a way to get ahead. He has two minors under his care. The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase welds, air compressors, pliers, and other things. This business is his biggest source of income. He would like to set up a shop with all the necessary equipment.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann N. is a single woman with one child who is two-and-a-half years old. Her business is located in Uhuru market in Nairobi. She sells handbags to the local people. She says that she has been in this business for eight years, and she is happy because the business has grown and people come to buy from her in bulk to resell. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is the fact that the business is very seasonal. During high seasons, for example, over the holidays, she makes lots of money, but other times, her inventory moves slowly, decreasing her income. 

Ann works very hard every day from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 70,000 to buy more handbags, in order to expand her business while meeting her customers' demands. She hopes to grow her business to a point where she can import bags and also export to other countries. She describes herself as hardworking and humble.

loans.use: To buy more handbags for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Bun Yong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank consists of eighteen people who live in Boeng Krum Kraom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Bun Y., born in 1961, is a village bank president and has been selected as the group leader by the other members. Each of the members will use his or her portion of the loan in varied ways to support their businesses. 

Mrs. Bun Y. is a widow with a child who works as a waiter. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice and corn to sell to support her family. Now, in her field it is time to plant rice but Mrs. Y. does not have enough capital to buy seeds. Therefore, to improve production, Mrs. Bun Y. will use her loan to buy rice seed to plant this year.

loans.use: to buy rice seed

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky P. is from the village of Bonbon, in Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Pinky owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing & blankets in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Pinky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to purchase additional products to buy and sell. She is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This will be Pinky’s 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Mrs. Nelfa A. is from the Barangay of Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old, married to Rosito A. and blessed with two adult children. To make a living, Nelfa sells delicacies and works as a cook. She also receives regular support from her husband, who earns 375 PHP each week as a gardener. She has been engaged in her business of cooking and selling delicacies for the past ten years. She earns an average of more than 3000 PHP a month from her business.  

On January 12, 2006, Nelfa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nelfa is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the PDP-LP, a microfinance program that reaches out to rural communities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP. She is now requesting her tenth loan: 14,000 PHP, which she will use to pay her grandson's tuition fees. She also joined Paglaum MPC because of the savings and insurance program offered to its members. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Tuition fees

loans.name: Joefemia

texts.en:
31-year-old Joefemia D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has two children. She grows rice and pigs for a living. She and her husband till their own land planting and harvesting rice crops. They also used their backyard to grow pigs for fattening and sale. Joefemia works hard to build her business and have better income.

Joefemia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joefemia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Joefemia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and feed

loans.name: Wasim

texts.ar:
وسيم يعمل في تعهدات البلاط عمره 21 سنة يعمل في مصلحته من 5 سنوات يحب عمله ودائما التجدد به
طموح لكن ما ينقصه هو المادة لي يزيد من مدخوله في العمل يتميز في الجودة بالعمل والدقة والاتقان يعاني
من صعوبة في محيطه العملي يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء عدة جديدة للمصلحة + مواد اولية
وسيم شاب طموح متجدد
texts.en: Wasim works in floorings. He is 21 years old, and has been working in the field for five years. Wasim loves his job and is always seeking to develop. He is ambitious, but has financial difficulties. He hopes to be able to increase his income. He is diligent and accurate. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, Wasim wants to purchase a new tool set and raw materials. He is ambitious and constantly seeks improvement.

loans.use: To purchase new materials and raw materials

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong S., 26, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She is employed at the factory, earning an income of about $4 per day. Her husband is an electrician, earning an income of about $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $55 on food and $25 on other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family use

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 33 años, es una mujer alegre y bastante trabajadora. En compañía de su esposo Eduardo y sus 4 hijos, formaron una familia feliz y consolidada, en la localidad de Playa Hermosa – San Ramón (selva central peruana). Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano, las frescas verduras que compran los pobladores del mercado central de la ciudad de San Ramón, son ofertadas por Ana desde hace ya 3 años. Lo que más le gusta a ella es poder brindar un buen trato a sus clientes, pues de ello depende su buena venta y preferencia. Como ya es conocida en el mercado, para el futuro desea obtener su propio puesto (espacio comprado dentro del mercado), con el que podrá adquirir mejores ganancias, ya que no pagará alquiler. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Claveles”, y este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde es una socia confiable y muy responsable. Ana tiene un respaldo económico que le sirve para poder abastecerse la compra de sus verduras, por ello con el crédito solicitado, está pensando adquirir varias hortalizas, verduras y legumbres para su próxima venta.
texts.en:
Ana, 33, is a cheerful, hardworking woman.  Along with her husband and their 4 children, they are a happy and close-knit family, living near Playa Hermosa-San Ramón (the central Peruvian jungle).  
Every morning for the past 3 years Ana has been selling fresh vegetables to the people in the central market of the city of 
San Ramón.  What she likes most is the interaction with the customers, since good sales and popularity depend on that.  Because she is respected in the market, in the future she would like to have her own stall (space that she buys inside the market) where she can increase her earnings since she wouldn’t be paying rent.  She belongs to the communal bank “Los Claveles” (the Carnations) and this is her second loan with MFP.  She is a trustworthy and responsible member.  Ana has the economic support that she depends on for the purchase of the vegetables.  That is why she is requesting the loan so that can buy various produce, vegetables and legumes for her next sale.

loans.use: To buy wholesale produce and legumes to supply her business.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie U. is from the village of Wahigan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 38 years old. Rosie is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Rosie owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling coconuts, bananas & firewood in the local community. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Rosie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like bananas and coconuts. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Wahigan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Orien

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: La señora Paula Martínez M. ella es originaria de la localidad del Chirimoyo ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, conocido porque muy cerca de ahí se encuentra el santuario de la mariposa monarca, las pirámides de Zirahuato, también es conocido por su artesanía y por la deliciosa gastronomía. Doña Paula tiene 22 años de edad, comenta que estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria porque muy jovencita se caso y por eso no pudo continuar con sus estudios y su esposo también no la dejo estudiar. Doña Paula se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres, comenta que ella pidió el préstamo a Fundación Realidad para invertir en la compra frutas y verduras ella comprara naranjas, mandarinas, plátanos, manzanas, guayabas, jitomates, cebollas, papas, calabazas etc. Tiene trabajando con su negocio hace aproximadamente 5 años, comenta que empezó a vender sus frutas y legumbres para ayudarle a su esposo con el negocio ya que su esposo ya tenía su puesto ambulante. Ella surte en la central de abastos de Zitacuaro y Toluca, los días jueves y lunes desde muy tempranas horas ella y su esposo van a surtir los días jueves y sábados y toda la semana restante trabaja en su puesto, comenta que ella y su esposo tienen una camioneta y van a las localidades aledañas a su población a vender sus frutas. La meta que tiene para su negocio es más adelante abrir un local estable donde venda sus frutas y vender un poco de abarrotes ya que es uno de sus sueños. Doña Paula está casada con el señor Adrián el cual es comerciante de frutas y verduras, ellos tienen 3 hijos de nombres Isaac de 5 años estudiante de preescolar, Valeria de 2 años y Adriana de 1 año de edad. Ella está contenta porque Fundación Realidad le hizo el préstamo y además se le hace muy poco lo que pagara de intereses y está agradecida por la confianza que depositaron en ella.
texts.en:
Sra. Paula Martínez M. is originally from the town of Chirimoyo in the State of Michoacán, which is known for its proximity to a monarch butterfly sanctuary and the pyramids of Zirahuato. Chirimoyo is also known for its handicrafts and delicious cuisine.

Doña Paula is 22 years old. She says she dropped out after completing three years of high school because she got married and was not able to finish her education. Her husband did not finish his schooling as well. Doña Paula sells fruits and legumes. She requested a loan from Fundación Realidad to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables such as oranges, tangerines, bananas, apples, guavas, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, pumpkins, and other types of produce. Paula has worked in this business for approximately five years. She started out selling fruits and legumes by helping her husband with his business since he has a mobile produce stand. Her merchandise comes from the central supply depots in Zitacuaro and Toluca. On Mondays and Thursdays, she and her husband wake up early to restock with more merchandise. On Fridays, Saturdays, and the remainder of the week they work at their stand. Paula says that she and her husband have a truck that they use for traveling to the neighboring towns to sell fruit. Her goal for her business is to open a stable location in the future where she can sell fruit as well as a few groceries.

Doña Paula is married to Sr. Adrián, who is also a fruit and vegetable merchant. They have three children named Isaac (age 5 and attends pre-school), Valeria (age 2), and Adriana (age 1). Paula is pleased because Fundación Realidad has given her this loan for which she will pay very little interest. She is also grateful for the trust that has been demonstrated to her.

loans.use: Purchase legumes & seasonal fruits

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 38 years old, married and with two children.  For five years, he has been doing tailoring for a living.  He has managed to grow his business through Faulu Kenya.  This has made him improve his standard of living.  He  aspires to become a major supplier of school uniforms.  He hopes to open other outlets of his business in the future.  He has requested 20,000 Kes to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity N. K. is thirty four years old. She is married to a businessman and they have two children aged five years old and two years old whom they hope to give good education to the university level. Her business is located at the busy Gikomba market in Nairobi. She owns a mobile phone accessories shop in which she sells chargers, batteries and other accessories to the local people. She has been in this business for five years now and has managed to employ one person. 

Charity says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 45,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of mobile phone accessories to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to grow her business and in the future become a wholesaler of mobile phone accessories. She describes herself as aggressive, honest and committed to her work.

loans.use: Mobile Phone accessories

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth N. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Lilibeth is widowed and has four school-aged children. Lilibeth owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling bananas & coconuts in the local community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2011, Lilibeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lilibeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts

loans.name: Chuluunbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Chuluunbaatar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He owns a plot of land and a house on it. His eldest daughter works as a salesperson and the youngest one is studying Law at the University. His wife Uranchimeg works as a cleaner in a sock-making textile factory. Chuluunbaatar works in a construction company as a plasterer. 

His family used to run a recycling business, collecting different recyclable materials like glasses, soft drink cans, metal and plastics, and then selling them to waste recycling companies for money. Now his children are grown up and everyone in the family is employed, so he decided to change the business profile. 

His eldest daughter had been working for a retail shop as a salesperson for a few years, and gathered quite a good knowledge about retail business. So she decided to run a clothes selling retail business on her own, and she needs some starting capital. He is supporting his daughter's idea, and he is asking for a loan to invest in his daughter's business. She has completed her business plan and at the moment she is looking for a suitable place to rent.

loans.use: to invest in his daughter's new clothes retail business by buying clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is a married woman with five adult-aged children. She is 58 years old and has had a food selling business for seven years.

Visitacion sells fruits and vegetables like bananas, cabbage, tomatoes, carrots and potatoes to the people in her community. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly.

Visitacion is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase bananas, cabbage, tomatoes and carrots.

In the future, Visitacion hopes that her business as well as the general living condition of her family will improve.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, cabbage, tomatoes and carrots to sell

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou, a 23-year-old fisherman, is from Siem Reap Province and the father of one child who is still young and lives under his care. 

Early every morning, Nou goes to the middle of the river to fish using a various tools. After he is done fishing, he quickly brings his fish by motorbike to the market for resale. For additional income, Nou’s wife works in a local hotel providing massage services for guests. 

Nou is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase fishing equipment, such as a new boat and nets, so he can continue fishing and catch more fish.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
This is Francisca, 52, a resident of Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Manolo, a Public Councilor. She has four children who all now have their own families. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.
